results.description:
Speaker: Jon Kalb

Title: C++ Today: The Beast Is Back

Abstract:

This talk will cover why engineers looking for performance choose C++. 

Jon will present an historical perspective of C++ focusing on what’s going on in the C++ community right now and where the language and its user base is heading.

With a renewed interest in performance for both data centers and mobile devices, and the success of open source software libraries, C++ is back and it is hot. This talk will explain why C++ is most software engineers’ go-to language for performance.

You will receive a rough historical sketch that puts C++ in perspective and covers its popularity ups and downs. 


Bio:

Jon Kalb is a freelance C++ instructor and chairs CppCon, C++ Now, and the Boost Steering Committee.

He has been programming in C++ for over 25 years and has written C++ for Amazon, Apple, Dow Chemical, Intuit, Lotus, Microsoft, Netscape, Sun, and Yahoo!

Jon has taught C++ at the graduate school at Golden Gate University in San Francisco and is a Microsoft MVP.


(RSVPs open 12PM August 6th)
results.name: C++ Today: The Beast Is Back

results.description:
Abstract:

Stan (mc-stan.org) turns 3 this month. I'll give a brief overview of the language and software, some of our history, and what's on the horizon.

Stan is a statistical modeling language and a collection of inference algorithms written in C++. There are interfaces to many popular computing frameworks including the command line, R, Python, Julia, Matlab, and Stata.

The Stan team: 

Andrew Gelman, Bob Carpenter, Matt Hoffman, Daniel Lee, Ben Goodrich, Michael Betancourt, Marcus Brubaker, Jiqiang Guo, Peter Li, Allen Riddell, Marco Inacio, Jeffrey Arnold, Rob Trangucci, Rob Goedman, Brian Lau, Jonah Sol Gabry, Alp Kucukelbir, Robert L. Grant, Dustin Tran

(Also note - there is now a Stan Meetup locally!  http://www.meetup.com/Stan-Users-NYC)


Speaker Bio:


Daniel Lee is a statistical researcher at Columbia University. He's worked with Andrew Gelman for the past 6 years on a number of applied projects and Stan. He has a BS (Math with CS) from MIT and a CASM (Part III, stats) from Cambridge.
results.name: Stan is back!

results.description:
Come and join us. It is a great introduction to skating with a group of skaters.


Meet up at the West side of the Maine Monument fountain just inside the Columbus Circle entrance to Central Park. This is a free event but not a skating lesson.


While we will have Skate Patrol member(s) available to offer tips, it is not the place to learn to skate. It is important that you can already skate and slow down on hills and stop. You must be comfortable going both up and down hills. We will skate around the Central Park Loop. There will be an option for 5.2 miles or 6.1 miles depending on whether you cut across at the 102nd street transverse or do the entire loop to 110th St.

In case of RAIN, please note: 


This event will be cancelled if the Park Drive Roads are wet. 

-----------------------

Let me know if you are interested because if no one contacts me, I may not make the effort to come early.  As with the skate there is no charge for this extra time just trying to build better skaters and have more fun.

results.description:
Please join us at the next monthly meeting on Thursday, June August 20th at 7pm at the Women's National Republican Club.

Our speaker for the evening will be Brian Maher, Former Mayor, Village of Walden, NY:

Brian Maher was elected Mayor of the Village of Walden in 2009 when he was 23 years old, giving him the distinct honor of being the youngest Mayor in New York State. In his first term Mayor Maher founded Walden's Youth Employment Program, which has since employed over 60 youth between the ages of 14-18.

As a standout athlete in high school, Brian was awarded a Division II Basketball scholarship to Post University in Waterbury, CT where he majored in Sociology. Maher later continued his studies at Brooklyn College where he developed and grew his passion for public service. As a political science major attending Brooklyn College, Maher interned for several nonprofit organizations and gained experience in grassroots outreach, fundraising and advocacy. 
In 2009 Maher returned home and answered his call to public service. Maher bested a two-term incumbent Mayor and a 14 year Trustee in a hotly contested three way Mayoral race. Maher ran for re-election in 2011 and 2013 unopposed. During his three terms as Mayor, Maher had a proven record of balanced growth, holding the line on taxes and developed and adopted a strong plan for economic development that both enhanced and protected Walden's infrastructure for the next 20 years.

During his third term as Mayor Maher was hired by senior New York State Senator Bill Larkin. Maher started out as a constituent services aide and was recently promoted to communications director and official spokesman for Larkin who is now serving under the new Senate leadership as Deputy Majority Leader for House Operations.

Maher's message stresses the importance of not just being a leader in government but also being a leader in his community. Since being elected Maher has: 
Founded "Be the Movement, Inc." - A local nonprofit organization with a mission to provide opportunities for people to become more involved in community service. 
Co-Founded the "Montgomery Youth Movement Council" - Working with the Orange County Youth Bureau, this organization focuses on teens giving back to their community through intergenerational and educational workshops. 
Co-Founder/Chairman, Hudson Valley Honor Flight - Honors WWII Veterans with an all expense paid flight to the WWII Memorial in Washington D.C. 
Chairman, Orange County Young Republicans Club 
Mid Hudson Regional Vice-Chair, NYSYR 
Board Member, Orange County Chamber of Commerce Young Professional Committee 
Maher spends any free time he has with his wife Becky and their 15 month old daughter Mia.

Traditional Business Attire is REQUIRED. No jeans, sneakers, hats, sweatshirts, etc.

Join us at Langan's Pub & Restaurant for drinks and networking after the meeting. Langan's is located at 150 W 47th Street (between 6th and 7th Avenue). First event or coming alone? Let us know and we will introduce you around!

Where & When 
Women's National Republican Club 
3 West 51st Street, between 5th and 6th Avenues 
Thursday, August 20th, 7-8:30pm

Visit us on Facebook:http://www.facebook.c...

results.description:
From Amazon:

HER PERFECT LIFE IS A PERFECT LIE.

As a teenager at the prestigious Bradley School, Ani FaNelli endured a shocking, public humiliation that left her desperate to reinvent herself. Now, with a glamorous job, expensive wardrobe, and handsome blue blood fiancé, she’s this close to living the perfect life she’s worked so hard to achieve.

But Ani has a secret.

There’s something else buried in her past that still haunts her, something private and painful that threatens to bubble to the surface and destroy everything.

With a singular voice and twists you won’t see coming, Luckiest Girl Alive explores the unbearable pressure that so many women feel to “have it all” and introduces a heroine whose sharp edges and cutthroat ambition have been protecting a scandalous truth, and a heart that's bigger than it first appears.

The question remains: will breaking her silence destroy all that she has worked for—or, will it at long last, set Ani free?
results.name: Luckiest Girl Alive by Jessica Knoll

results.description:
It's not easy being a food innovator. There's no road map for reinventing an industry. So, in partnership with Force Brands: FoodForce | BevForce, we cooked up the Fail Friday series to celebrate failure in all its glory. 


This time around, we'll hear from the WTRMLN WTR, Super Sprowtz, The 86 Company and more. Startups will share their stories of failure and lessons learned from growing their businesses, followed by audience Q&A. 

There will be snacks from food360, Legally Addictive Foods and Pure Genius Provisions</a>, cocktails from <a href="http://www.the86co.com/">The 86 Company, a coffee bar from Califia Farms and watermelon juice from WTRMLN WTR. Plus lots of networking.

SCHEDULE:

7:00 - 7:45: Networking, Snacks & Drinks


7:45 - 8:45: Failure Stories & Q&A

8:45 - 9:30: More Networking

CONFIRMED SPEAKERS: 

Jeff Rubenstein - CMO, WTRMLN WTR - the pioneer in cold pressed, juiced watermelon and one of the fastest growing companies in beverage.  Prior to WTRMLN WTR, Mr. Rubenstein served as SVP, Marketing for Vita Coco, the worldwide leader in coconut water, where he was instrumental in helping the brand evolve from a niche, natural food trend with revenues under $10M into a global phenomenon with revenues over $300M and a 2014 partial sale to Red Bull China that valued the business at $665M. He spent the early part of his career in Brand Management at The Coca-Cola Company.

Considered a leading voice in consumer marketing, Mr. Rubenstein is regularly featured as a speaker at industry and academic conferences, including those at Harvard Business School.  Mr. Rubenstein is a graduate of the Warrington College of Business at the University of Florida and currently lives in New York City with his wife Loren and daughter Olivia.

Kate Galassi - Product Head, Natoora - Kate started her career in food as an apprentice on an organic produce farm in New Hampshire. She has worked for several Union Square Greenmarket producers including Rick's Picks and Cayuga Pure Organics. In 2010 she became the produce buyer for The Spotted Pig and The Breslin. In early 2013 she co-founded Quinciple, a curated farmers' market box company. She recently left Quinciple and has joined the team at Natoors a London-based produce company. 


Alice Cheng - Founder & CEO, Culinary Agents - a professional networking and job matching website designed for current and aspiring professionals in the food, beverage, and hospitality industry.  Having spent years working in a restaurant and then going on to work for IBM for 13 years in cross-industry innovation, Alice brings her knowledge of technology into the food and beverage industry to solve inefficiencies and gaps around talent sourcing and career development. Alice is a deeply experienced business, marketing and sales professional who is passionate about helping people build careers and has taken, and continues to take, leadership roles in mentoring all levels of talent in the technology, business and hospitality spaces.


Radha Agrawal - Founder & CEO, Super Sprowtz - a leading children's multi-media nutrition education company whose mission is to engage children to make better food choices through storytelling, music and a proven curriculum impacting over 1 million children and counting. Visit supersprowtz.com to learn more. 

Radha is also the co-Founder of Daybreaker, an early morning dance party for urban professionals that takes place on weekday mornings and serves coffee, tea and green juice in lieu of alcohol and replaces the monotony and often lonely gym experience for a community inspired dance party. She is also the co-Founder of THINX, a women’s apparel company that provides a sustainable,patented solution for women to provide support, comfort, confidence, and peace of mind during their "time of the month" and beyond. 

She was a 2013 Recipient for the Tribeca Film Festival "Disruptive Innovation Awards", was named by MTV as “one of eight women who will change the world” and was named by Forbes Magazine as a "2013 Millenial On a Mission”.

Malte Barnekow - CEO, The 86 Company - The 86 Company develops and sells hight quality spirits designed by bartenders for bartenders specifically for crafted cocktails and house pour use. The 86 Co. portfolio currently includes Fords Gin, Caña Brava Rum, Aylesbury Duck Vodka and Tequila Cabeza, all launched in the United States in 2012.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
Meditation:

To discover deep internal Peace…

To wake up by connecting with your vital Force…

To live with profound Joy and a sense of Well Being…

To experience the Sacred in yourself and those around you.

……

In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection. This is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211

Ryanne and Jay are proud Scavengers and make money on eBay by selling items they find in or near the waste stream, at auctions, yard sales, and thrift stores. Join us at Braddock Park in North Bergen for Thursday Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with a Hudson County ID. Non-residents may play as guests.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible.

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

results.description:
New Social Dancing Workshop Series Begins Thursday, August 20th at Ripley-Grier Studios (520 8th Ave b/t 36th & 37th St - 16th Floor, Room 16U)

7:30-8:30pm = Advanced Casino (Level 3 & Up) w/Evelyn & Chris
8:30-9:30pm = Intro to Son (Level 2 & Up) w/Evelyn, Ryan & Chris
9:30-10:30pm = Son & Timba Social

For more detailed info:
Thursdays (Specialized Workshops spanning 6-weeks from August 13th - September 17th)*

7:30-8:30pm Advanced Casino (Open to Levels 3 & Up)

This 6-week workshop will focus on Casino partnering for dancers at the advanced level, with emphasis on connected and separated patterns, styling, body movement, and footwork. Students will also be shown how to fuse other Cuban traditional and popular dances into the proposed framework, all while dancing to rhythmically dense Timba as a means to combine intricate patterns with dynamic rhythmic variation. Instructors: Evelyn & Chris

8:30-9:30pm Intro to Son (Open to Levels 2 & Up)

Considered Cuba's first global choreographic export, Son originated in the eastern (Oriente) provinces of Cuba in the late 19th century and became Cuba's national rhythm and dance in the 1930's. Bringing together both West African, Hispanic and local creole musical characteristics, its derivatives and fusions, particularly Salsa, have spread across the world. This 6-week workshop will expose students to the fundamentals of Son Cubano, with considerable attention to musicality, coordination, and its structural application to Casino. Over the course of the workshop, students will become familiar with the defining characteristics of Son, including contra-tiempo (on 2) timing, clave and other key Cuban musical concepts - will be able to distinguish Son from other Cuban musical genres and will be able to execute its defining footwork & traveling patterns, paseos, caídas, tornillos, etc. Instructors: Evelyn, Ryan, & Chris

9:30-10:30pm Social Dancing (All Levels)
Music will include Son & Timba, with ample opportunities to practice key concepts from classes & dance with instructors.

Location (Thursday Workshops):
Ripley-Grier Studios
520 8th Avenue between 36th & 37th Streets
16th Floor - Room 16U

Pricing (Thursday Workshops):
$20 Drop-In for 1 Workshop
$35 Double Drop-In (Same Night)
$100 for all 6 Casino OR 6 Son Workshops
$150 for all 6 Casino AND 6 Son Workshops
results.name: Casino & Son Partnering Workshops + Social

results.description:
Let's get together and hear some local brass talent!

The PitchBlak Brass Band are playing at the Rubenstein Atrium at Lincoln Center, opened by DJ KS 360! Free!


The 10-piece PitchBlak Brass Band infuses hip-hop driven beats with funk, rock, jazz, and classical music. Their rich brass harmonies, lyrical hooks, tongue-twisting raps, and rhythms will make your blood race. A collective of musicians, composers, and artists, PitchBlak embodies the vibrant undercurrents of New York City. They channel the style and sound of hip-hop from its early days in the 1980s to today.


Kwikstep, known as DJ KS 360 on the turntables, is an internationally known hip-hop dancer, choreographer, poet, actor, and hand percussionist.


7:30–8:00: DJ set by DJ KS 360
8:00–9:15: PitchBlak Brass Band
9:15–9:45: DJ set by DJ KS 360

Important Information:

You must enter the Atrium on Broadway between 62/63rd.
Arrival soon after 6:30pm is recommended.
Entrance is first-come, first-in, and if you arrive too close to the set you will have to wait outside until others leave.
There's a 'Wichcraft snack bar with sandwiches & drinks, or you can bring your own food.

results.description:
Congressional Recess or Congressional Regress? (by Justin Krebs, 8/20/15)


Congress is enjoying their summer break,
but many Republicans are eager to return to DC
to launch baseless, ruthless attacks against
one of America's critical women's health providers.

For many, summer break is peace and quiet,
but for the neocons it's war and noise,
as they spend August sensationally saber-rattling
and seeking to sink a diplomatic deal with Iran.

And meanwhile, there's no vacation at all
for GOP hopefuls hanging in Iowa and NH,
as they race to the right and raise their voices
to find some air Trump hasn't sucked up already.

So much for a summer of love.
Looking at the Republican Party,
it's less a recess, and more a regress.

As they often say about these August days,
it's not the heat, it's the stupidity …

Cool down with a cold beer and chill company,
sharing values, sips and a night out
at your local, progressive social club.

Join us for our weekly gathering. As your busy week almost comes to an end, unwind with other similar-minded progressives over liberal libations.  

You can find us in the covered upper deck of the backyard -- look for a large banner on the wall, like the one shown above.  The NYC Chapter of Drinking Liberally has been gathering at Rudy's Bar & Grill since our in inception in 2003.
results.name: Weekly Thursday Meetup ("Congressional Recess or Congressional Regress?")

results.description:
A Contract with God by Will Eisner

It's fair to say that Will Eisner invented modern comic art. A Contract with God has been called the first graphic novel, and its divergence from traditional comics themes and forms highlights Eisner's foresight and brilliance. Dealing with stories and memories from his childhood in a Bronx tenement, he explores the brutality, fragility, and tenderness possible among people living in close quarters close to the poverty line. The four stories here are tough but funny, deep but finely detailed, much like the traditional Jewish stories he drew upon to flavor his own work. Ending reflectively (and perhaps autobiographically), A Contract with God shows us a young man peering out into his city as he decides whether and how to face adulthood. You won't see that in the funny papers. --Rob Lightner

results.name: NBCBC #39 A Contract with God by Will Eisner

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Saturday, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.why: Writers develop their story telling skills through steady writing and constructive feedback delivered by their peers. This group is full of talented writers willing to give their time to help others develop their craft.

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
YOU MUST REGISTER FOR THIS CLASS THE DAY BEFORE CLASS BY EMAILING: [masked]

Hello Friends! I am so happy to share with you one of my new passions! THE FASCIANATION METHOD™!! Within minutes of my first class I felt such a release in my body like I'd never felt before, even more than after a deep tissue massage or a day at the spa. If I carry a heavy bag on my shoulder I realize it causes headaches. Also I've been a dancer for much of my life and the unfortunate part is that it resulted in bunions! Randomly I feel shooting pains everywhere, beginning at my feet, then to my knees, hip, neck and head leading to headaches. Since I began using the fascianator to roll out my muscles, I feel open, more limber, and pain free. It's amazing!!!!

Class Description: The Fascianation Method™ is a self-myofascial release that involves using a fitness roller, the Fascianator™, to assist in the release of #myofascial adhesions by rolling out the muscles to relax the fascia that surround them. This is done in a sequence beginning at the bottom of the foot and concluding at the back of neck. This causes a release of pressure on the nerves, arteries, veins and lymphatic vessels that cause pain, numbness, tingling, weakness and inflammation. Rolling out the muscles relax the fascia that surround them causing the release of pressure on the nerves, arteries, veins and lymphatic vessels that cause pain, numbness, tingling, weakness and inflammation. The Fascianator® myofascial release roller and Fascianation Method® are helping the masses terminate their chronic pain without invasive procedures and pharmacological agents. The Fascianator® and Fascianation Method® have been shown to terminate chronic pain and literally CHANGE lives! Giving people hope for their future while getting them off highly addictive pharmaceuticals! You owe it to yourself to live a life FREE from PAIN! Price: $20

About Instructor Andriana:
During my stay in Hawaii I became certified in the FASCIANATION METHOD™ by it’s founder, Anthony Chrisco. It is a calling of mine to be knowledgeable in how to help myself and others live a healthy pain free lifestyle in order to improve the quality of the mind and body as a unit. I’m so happy to have found the Fascianation Method. Everyday I learn something fascinating about Fascia and how activating this organ can have miraculous healing effects to overall health. I am officially the first instructor on the East Coast and at the time La Luz is the only studio to host this life changing class.

WHAT IS FASCIA?
Fascia is the neurologically active tissue that envelops all of our tissues head to toe. Sometimes it is referred to as the ‘plastic wrap’ that keeps all our muscles and ligaments together. This connective tissue wraps and envelops our arteries, veins, muscles, nerves, organs, bones, tendons and ligaments and is the most neurologically active tissue in the body. It is the system that holds most of the water in our bodies.

http://youtu.be/uzy8-wQzQMY

(READ MORE) When left untreated, it can exert tensile forces of up to 2,000 pounds per square inch on pain sensitive structures in the body and x-rays & MRI's cannot see these areas of tension; referred to as myofascial adhesions. The Fascianation Method™ involves using a fitness roller to assist in the release of these myofascial adhesions.
This pressure causes a decreased blood flow and decreased lymphatic drainage, which leads to increased inflammation and pain. Regular exercise and activity does help move the fascia, but rarely does it get at the source of the tension. And for those that cannot be physically active, myofascial release can help them decrease their pain and increase mobility so that they can begin being more active. GREAT VIDEO OF FASCIA EXPLAINED.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-uzQMn87Hg0


Despite the importance of this amazing tissue, fascia was not recognized as an organ system until 2012! And yet, this fascinating system has been known for thousands of years. In fact, the meridian lines (energy lines) in Traditional Chinese Medicine match up with key points of fascia! http://vibrantwellnessjournal.com/2014/02/18/myofascial-release-pain-management-self-healing/
Here is a list of ailments that The Fascianation Method can help alleviate:
· Plantar Fasciitis/Heel Pain
· Gout
· Diabetic Foot
· Shin Splints
· Anterior Compartment Syndrome
· Creaky Knees
· I.T. Band Syndrome
· Sciatica
· Low Back Pain
· Migraine/ Tension Headache
· Tennis/Golfer Elbow
· Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
· Trigger Finger (When the finger cannot straighten after bending.)
· Constipation
· Hip Pain
· Ovarian Cysts
· Incontinent Bladder
· Frozen Shoulder Syndrome

About Anthony (founder of The Fascianator & Fascianation Method)
Anthony is also a Continuing Education Provider for the National Academy of Sports Medicine and the American Council on Exercise. He is the developer of The Fascianator™ Roller and the Fascianation Method™, used to find and eliminate the stress in the body so it can heal itself. Anthony lectures and teaches both professionals in health and fitness and other allied health professions about the human body’s fascial system, which was classified as an organ system just last year. His techniques of self-myofascial release has helped hundreds of people suffering from numerous chronic pain disorders. Anthony has over 18 years of study and experience in utilizing this method to help alleviate pain and issues through this process. In Anthony's Method he has mastered a way to alleviate stress and issues to your body so it can heal itself. He has a wealth of knowledge not only with this method of self treatment but with the body anatomy as a whole. Throughout the years Anthony researched myofascial release as a therapeutic modality and gathered clinical proof that led him to assert that self-myofascial release has therapeutic utility. Coincidentally, around that time, Eileen (Anthony’s Wife and Co-Founder) was involved in a human tissue transplantation project which involved the study of fibroblasts, extracellular matrix (major component of fascia) and their role in affecting the immune system and injury repair. It became evident to Anthony and Eileen that caring for one's fascia most likely plays a role in not just fitness, but wellness. Anthony and Eileen are privileged to be Founding Members of the Fascia Research Society, in which they join academics, researchers, physicians, clinicians, movement therapists, physical therapists, massage therapists, chiropractors, and personal trainers to share interest and discussion about the human fascial system.

results.description:
Welcome to OneTaste's new Lecture Series.  This week, "The Art of Having What You Want?" by Aubrey Agrawal


When you open up through Orgasmic Meditation, you start to get everything you want because you learn how to actually receive it. Then the game really begins! We are built to filter how much good stuff can come in at once or it is destabilizing to our "when do I get mine" identity. The longer I OMed, I've had to get really good at HAVING. At allowing my desires to actually come to me, change me, change my life, remake me. And it takes a lot of attention. It's like managing a lot of money in a way - you have to begin to look at questions like, what do I want to do with all this wealth? How do I want to spend it? How can I not let it go to my head? How do I share it where it will be used well? And maybe the biggest question: how do I not sabotage it all so I can just go back to my comfort level of not-having and complaining? Come listen to me muse on the topic of HAVING what you desire and how to do it well. Or at least how to make it a practice of doing it well!

-Aubrey


Doors lock at 8:10 sharp! We will not allow late entry after that.

All comics performing on the show are professionals and have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc) + MORE!! Being just around the corner from the legendary Comedy Cellar, we regularly get special guest drop in's from some of the biggest names in comedy!!

The Village Lantern is located at 167 Bleeker St. Trains Stations Nearby: W. 4th St- D/B/M/F/A/C/E, Bleeker St- 6, Christopher St- 1

Meetup and hang out in the bar area from 730-8 and join us downstairs in the Comedy Club at 8 for the FREE SHOW!!

The Lantern offers a full bar and food menu, including $5 Comedy Show specials including:
$5 Can of Beer
$5 Well Drink
$5 Glass of Wine

Food:
$5 Mozzarella Sticks,
$5 Fresh Cut Fries
$5 Nachos
$5 Quesadilla
$5 Chicken Wings

** 1 item minimum for the show **

(Leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

results.description:
A BIBLICAL WORLDVIEW OF CIVIL GOVERNMENT AND CHRISTIAN LIFE

“But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord”

(Joshua 24:15 KJV)


Please, join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Biblical Worldview Conference Call led by Pastor and Christian Party of America National Chairman, Clell Drumheller. He will present an in-depth scriptural perspective of how Christians are to live in these challenging times and engage in civil affairs. The conference call is the third Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM. EST (7:30 PM Central). Topics will range from how to be culturally “in the world, but not of it,” to what is the Christian’s biblical response to political events. Each call will begin with a 30-minute formal presentation by Mr. Drumheller, followed by a question and answer section. For recording quality of the presentations, which will be archived, we ask that everyone, please, mute their telephones until the end of the presentation. If you arrive late to the call, please, mute your phone as you log in, so that the presentation will not be interrupted as you join us. Thank you ahead of time for your compliance. After the presentation you can unmute your phone if you would like to participate in the discussion and/or ask questions. If you would like to contact Mr. Drumheller, please do so at [masked] or call the Christian Party of America toll-free number at [masked]-3927.


Biography -- Clell M. Drumheller, II: Mr. Drumheller, a former Marine Corps Sergeant, is an ordained pastor and is the Founder/Pastor of Truth in Love Ministries in Houston, Texas. He has a Master of Divinity from Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary and a Bachelor of Arts in Christianity and English from Houston Baptist University. In 2010, Mr. Drumheller became the founding National Chairman of the Christian Party of America. Among other affiliations Mr. Drumheller is a member of the Black Robed Regiment and holds a teaching certificate through Lone Star College. He has also engaged in various professional, business, and volunteer activities. He was born in Ocala, Florida on November 20, 1951 and was saved in Houston, Texas on August 4, 1969. He and his wife Cynde reside in Houston, Texas.


The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls provide a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So, sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!


The conference call will last for about an hour but staying for the entire call is optional.  If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges required by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can, even, listen in on the conference call while at other events. Just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: A BIBLICAL WORLDVIEW OF CIVIL GOVERNMENT AND CHRISTIAN LIFE-CONFERENCE CALL

results.description:
Foreclosures 101! Including Short Sales & Bank REO's!

Hello Everyone!

We are making a slight change, and see if we can get our National Short Sale Expert on the call in the next week or two? for now:

READ this article from DS News this July 2014!(Yes, it is dated by one year, & we will talk about that)

Foreclosure-starts-rise-first-time-months

http://dsnews.com/news/07-03-2014/foreclosure-starts-rise-first-time-months

Foreclosures 101!

Learn to locate and purchase properties in all stages of foreclosure (Pre-foreclosure, Short Sale, Auction and REOs). This is a critical skill to have in today's real estate market!


"The Riches are in the Niches!" - that quote is so true! It is impossible to become an expert in everything at once. And trying to do everything at the same time will only dilute your efforts and ultimately frustrate you. What you need is a Focus! But, how do you determine what to Focus on? How do you determine the areas of investing that best suit your resources and goals? That is exactly what the These Real Estate Investing Classes are designed to help you do! Get started right away and start making your Real Estate investments a reality! These classes are specifically designed to give investors the knowledge and tools they need to invest in a particular discipline. They are taught by active investors that live and breathe real estate! Learning from people "in the trenches" sure beats trying to invest out of a book or worse, months of trial and error! Hear about the good, bad and ugly - what really works and how to get started fast!

Since I am doing this from Houston, Texas/8:00pm / central time. My time

IMPORTANT! Email your questions in advance to [masked] Please be on the call 5 minutes early if possible,
And either in a quiet place, or be prepared to mute you phone please.

Please be considerate and courteous of others....
All it takes is ONE person to disrupt the call for everyone else.
Please be considerate and courteous of others....

From the Netherlands, Vivienne Aerts studied at Berklee College of Music (Boston, USA) where she worked with renowned jazz artists such as Danilo Perez, Joe Lovano, John Patitucci, Ed Saindon, Joanne Brackeen and Kenny Werner. Her music refers to the sounds of the Ella, Duke and Miles. Being occasionally uncategorizable Vivienne is more than a composer and a singer. The flow of her music creates an intimate connection with the audience. She shared stages with national and international renowned artists such as Lee Konitz, Joe Cohn and Florian Weber. In 2009 was the release of the 1st cd called 'Roofgarden' and her second cd "Polaroid" (2012) is a snappy Jazz a cappella EP, recorded with Australian electronic producer Geoff Baker.

With bellydancing by Caridad Rivera

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
Join us for a fast hike up Mt. Washington prior to the Franconia Ridge weekend festivities with Baker and Co. We'll be starting at Pinkham Notch, ascending Tuckerman's Trail then deciding if we want to summit via Huntington's or just straight up Lion's Head. Once there, we'll have a bite to eat, visit the attractions, and then descend back to Pinkham for a shower before heading back to the campground. What we do depends on weather, and keep in mind some of us may brave more extreme weather than others, so be prepared to hike on your own.

Everyone will be waitlisted until I determine you are ready to ascend the tallest peak in the Northeast.

++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Women helping women train to find their inner warrior ! Walking can do so much more for you then get you from point A to B. It's a great way to tone up and increase your fitness and health.

My passion is CrossFit and Spartan Obstacle course racing and helping people improve their health and wellness. With the support and comraderie of other women of all fitness levels , we come together to walk and add in moderate intervals of body movement workouts as we power through the beautiful scenery of Tibbets Brook Park.

Women of all fitness levels, shapes and sizes can see in a few short weeks the amazing changes in their bodies ! Let's get in a powerful walk and chat about nutrition and relieve alittle stress and make our bodies stronger !! Who knows you may want to sign up for a local mud run with me!!!

results.description:
CUNY CLIMATE WALK
CUNY Board of Trustees: Divest from Fossil Fuels Now!

City University of New York (CUNY) Divest - a group made up of CUNY students, alumni, and faculty - is walking to every CUNY campus over a four day period beginning August 21st. We will be planting a flag at each institution to remind our Board of Trustees that our resolution for divestment must be passed this fall. The sustainability of our planet cannot tolerate continued inaction.

WHO: CUNY students, faculty and alumni as inspired by Nihigaal bee lina (Our Journey for Existence)- the group of Navajo men and women that traveled 1000+ miles on foot to bring attention to the environmental injustices they are faced with

WHAT: We are demanding CUNY divest its endowment from the top 200 fossil fuel companies

WHERE: We will be marching to every CUNY campus in all 5 boroughs
WHEN: August 21-24th

WHY: We need a new social and political climate in which fossil fuel companies are not upheld by our universities and political leaders.

HOW: On foot, amassing support step by step

Fossil fuel companies have five times more oil on reserve than can be burned if we want a habitable planet- and their central business models necessitate that it all gets burned. Divestment is how those of us that are not business or Washington insiders will knock this unsustainable industry on its knees.

For more information contact Jessica Johnson [masked]
www.cunydivest.org
https://twitter.com/cunydivest
https://www.facebook.com/CUNYDivest

Small donations can help! https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cuny-climate-walk
results.name: CUNY CLIMATE WALK - CUNY Board of Trustees: Divest from Fossil Fuels Now!

results.description:
Join Robert Caplin and legendary sports photographer Neil Leifer for a podcast LIVE at Adorama! ➟ PhotoBrigade.com/LIVE

NEIL LEIFER’s photography career has spanned over 50 years since becoming a professional while still in his teens. Beginning in 1960, his pictures regularly appeared in every major national magazine, including the Saturday Evening Post, Look, LIFE, Newsweek, Time and, most often, Sports Illustrated.

Leifer eventually became a staff photographer for Sports Illustrated before leaving in 1978 to become a staffer for Time magazine. In 1988 he was made a contributing photographer at LIFE magazine and spent the next two years dividing his time between Time and LIFE. When Leifer left Time Inc. in 1990, his photographs had appeared on over 200 Sports Illustrated, Time, and People covers—at that point, the most ever published of one photographer’s work in Time Inc. history. Neil Leifer is the 2006 recipient of the prestigious Lucie Award for Achievement in Sports Photography. In 2008 he was honored for his outstanding contribution to Time Inc. journalism with The Britton Hadden Lifetime Achievement Award.

Leifer has published 16 books, 9 of which have been collections of his sports photographs. Sports, his 1978 Abrams book, is considered by many to be the quintessential sports photography book. His two most recent, Ballet in the Dirt and Guts and Glory—both published by TASCHEN, showcase the very best of Leifer’s professional baseball and football photographs. Leifer is currently working on his memoir “Relentless” which will be published in 2014.

Leifer has traveled all over the world on sports assignments. He has photographed 16 Olympic Games (7 winter and 9 summer), 4 FIFA World Cups, 15 Kentucky Derbies, countless World Series games, the first 12 Super Bowls and every important heavyweight title fight since Ingemar Johansson beat Floyd Patterson in 1959. He has photographed his favorite subject, Muhammad Ali, on almost 60 different occasions—covering his biggest fights and over 30 one-on-one studio sessions.

While Neil Leifer is now a full-time filmmaker, producer and director; there is a very good chance that you’ll spot him, camera in hand, at any big championship fight. “Boxing” says Leifer “is the one sport I still love shooting.”

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography: 

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/PhotoBrigade_HEAD%5B1%5D.jpg?itok=bKADUApv The Photo Brigade is an amazing blog and resource for freelance photographers that showcase the amazing work of their talented network of photographers through features, guest posts, gear reviews, and podcasts, on the business of photography.
results.name: LIVESTREAM: Photo Brigade Podcast with Neil Leifer

results.description:
Join Adorama as we present Al Bello, Chief Sports Photographer in North America for Getty Images, as he walks us through his illustrious career as a professional sports photographer. Al has demonstrated a knack for capturing the vibrancy and adrenaline of the sporting world. His work conveys the motion and emotions of each athlete and subject that he photographs and we hope that his story and his work will inspire you to find new ways of photographing the sports that you love.

Al Bello graduated with a Liberal Arts degree from the University of New York at Stony Brook in 1989. In 1993 Al landed a position as a junior photographer at Allsport which is now a part of Getty images. Since Joining Getty, Al has become Chief Sports Photographer in North America on a very talented staff. He is assigned to cover sporting events and people in sport worldwide. He has covered 10 Olympic Games.

Al has won various awards from the likes of World Press Photo, National Press Photographers Association, Pictures of the Year International

Al has also taught and lectured at The Eddie Adams Workshop, The National Press Photographers Association Short Course, The Richard Clarkson Workshop, The World Press Photo Foundation, The Rochester Institute of Technology, The Poynter Institute, The Wisconsin News Photographers Association, Sacred Heart University, and several functions for Getty Images.

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.
results.name: SEMINAR: Sports Photography with Al Bello

results.description:
Byte Academy presents Igor Gonta, CEO of Market Prophit has a wealth of experience on the Wall Street and Big Data fronts working for companies such as Goldman Sachs, Barclays, and Credit Suisse.  The MIT Computer Science & Electrical Engineering major recently started Market Prophit which is bursting into the FinTech scene.  Hear Igor discuss his company at this upcoming presentation that we are excited to open up to a limited number of meetup community members in addition to our students. See more information about Market Prophit below.  

Market Prophit

Extracting the market signal from social media noise 

Imagine you are in a room with hundreds of thousands of people all shouting at you what stocks they are buying and selling at the same time.  It’s impossible for you to listen to everyone at once and easily organize everyone’s opinions about the stocks you care about.  And how do you know who to listen to in the crowd?  Who has the best track record based on their “stock calls”?  How do you find the mavens with the highest quality of information?  How do you know whom to trust?  How do you reduce the noise? 

Market Prophit solves these problems by quantitatively ranking financial bloggers in the social media-sphere based on the track record of the performance of their stock market commentary.  Market Prophit is the first service ever to provide rankings of financial bloggers in social media and generate unique, real-time sentiment signals (bullish/bearish) based on identifying the mavens or “Market Prophits” in the “Crowd”.  

As the volume of chatter in social media about stocks keeps growing, the need for a filter that separates noise from valuable insights has become increasingly urgent for the investment community.  Market Prophit’s solution solves this problem, helping investors determine which financial market bloggers are credible, and providing a filter for investors and traders which allows them to more easily search and discover the key market influencers while helping them tune out the noise.

- See more at: http://marketprophit.com/about/#sthash.mjXXYYmY.dpuf

results.description:
Greenwich Village in Manhattan is a community with a global history and reputation. The quiet streets of the area have been the stage for creative and social movements that today give shape to the unique American character. The area started out as farm territory and later became an immigrant community. In the first half of the 20th century the area was inhabited by some of the greatest creative minds of American Culture. Today the area retains it’s cultural essence in diverse aspects and it’s public art and architecture contrast richly with the greater metropolitan environment of NYC.

Itenerary:
• Father Demo Square
• Bleecker Street
• Cherry Lane Theater
• Sheridan Square
• Cafe Wha?
• Washington Square Park
• New York University
• And Much More

Reservations: 
Please RSVP.If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins at father Demo Square on 6th Av. and Bleecker St. map here. I will be standing by the fountain with a meetup sign. If you need to contact me by phone you can do so at[masked]-6737. Tour concludes at/near Washington Square Park map here.

Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

results.description:
Watch now at http://www.Qualcomm.com/inventoff

Question: what happens when you bring together two teams of artists, engineers, students, and a pile of technology? Answer: an invention that will inspire change. That’s the idea behind Qualcomm’s #WhyWait Invent-Off.

In this webseries, Qualcomm and host Jason Silva (@JasonSilva) challenge two teams of inventors to stop waiting and start innovating, using shelves full of technology and Qualcomm products to build their new creations. They have five days to create something that positively impacts the future. The winning team gets $5,000, a feature in Gizmodo, and participation in the Qualcomm CES booth this January. So far, the competition is young, but promises a fascinating look at creativity, technology, and how the cyber-sausage gets made. Why are you still waiting, when you could be watching?

It’s summer, all the good TV shows are over, and it’s time to get yourself a new obsession. The #WhyWait Invent-Off is your answer. This isn’t your grandma’s competition. (Unless you have the type of grandma who’s really into microprocessors.)

Watch now at http://www.Qualcomm.com/inventoff
results.name: Hackathon: Arduino Yun + SmartWatch + Snapdragon = Qualcomm #WhyWait Invent-Off

results.description:
THE NORTHEAST REGIONAL ORGANIZATION

OF THE NATIONAL SPELEOLOGY SOCIETY

IS EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE  N.R.O.

This is a fantastic weekend for all interested in caving, beginners and beyond... Come for the day or the whole weekend. It is an awesome time complete with trips led by experienced cavers. Feel free to ask questions and bring friends.

CHECK THIS OUT!!! CHECK THIS OUT!!! <<<<<< click!!!!

THIS IS CAVE COUNTRY!

Activities Include

Caving (Duh..)

Vertical Training (Rapelling)

Camping, Bonfire, BBQ

Live Music

Auctions, Raffles & Prizes

Hiking

Bike trails

The best caves in NY!

Details & Fees

CAMPGROUND & REGISTRATION FEES
Dogs are welcome but you must provide copies of their rabies vaccination certificate and they must be registered with the campground office. Dogs must remain on leashes on all times; please pick up after them. The campground is actually holding a benefit for a the Schoharie Counting Animal Shelter this weekend, so we welcome you to show your support and bring some sealed pet food or treats to donate to their efforts. 

1. Camping (pay directly to campground office at entry to property)
a. $7 Per person per Night ( $14 for the whole weekend, Friday Night till Sunday Afternoon)
b. Day Pass is $7, same as camping - come join us for the day!
c. For campers / RVs contact the campground 
i. ($32 per night including electricity and water and 2 adult wrist bands) 
ii. $7 per night for each additional person
d. Dogs must have copies of rabies papers and be on leash at all times

2. Registration 
Download the editable NRO registration form or fillable pdf and email it to [masked]. If you have trouble saving the pdf, please print it out and bring with you to NRO.

a. $6 Adults (14 and older) ( $2 for NRO, $4 for CCG)
b. $4 Children under (6-13) ( $1 for NRO, $3 for CCG)
c. Guidebook: $3 or free for people who pre-pay and preregister ( limited quantity available: 120)
d. Limited Edition McFail’s Map + Northeastern Caver Collection DVD: $10 ( limited quantity available: 50)
e. CCG Patches: $5
f. Summer NRO 2015 T-Shirts: $15

MEALS AND DINING
Saturday and Sunday morning breakfasts are $5 each and will be served from 7:00-8:30 am by Steve Janesky and a team of volunteers. Saturday night dinner (6:30-8:00pm) is $15 and will be hosted by Kay Rising and 7 Angelica Farms, an Organic Farm and Catering Company from Long Island, NY. 

For lunches we recommend packing something for your cave trip or visiting some of our favorite restaurants:

Things to Bring

Tent and camping equipment.

Synthetic clothing, a few layers.

Helmet with chin strap and 2 headlamps kneepads any form of gloves..

Snacky cakes and cheesy poofs....plenty of water and other beverages of choice :)

acoustic instrument or hand drum if you like

hula hoop, poi, devil sticks, orbs spheres, hackey sack

Lastly bring your sense of adventure love of nature and common sense!!

PAYMENT ...ALL FEES GO TO REGISTRATION DESK AT TIME OF CHECK IN

For this weekend, the people here really need to have accurate numbers so they can properly prepare for the amount of equipment AND FOOD needed on these types of trips. It will be a better and easier experience for everyone involved with organizing, if we can avoid flakers and last minute RSVP changes.

HERE'S SOME HELPFUL LINKS

NATIONAL SPELEOLOGICAL SOCIETY    http://caves.org/

SPELEOBOOKS  http://www.speleobooks.com/

NORTHEAST CAVE CONSERVANCY   http://www.necaveconservancy.org/default.php

MET GROTTO LOCAL CHAPTER OF THE N.S.S.    https://www.facebook.com/groups/23186146133/

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

This will be a new idea for meetups I'll be experimenting with in which each week will have a theme picked for that day to work with, discuss, and draw. I think these themed meetups will be exciting and give artists a more common focus, this will be a great exercise to either draw something their familiar with, curious about trying, wanting to learn, or to experiment with and challenge themselves with something new.

These meetups will be focused on creating art, sketches, and ideas with a central focus depending on the theme and be a slightly different from our casual meetups. Including discussing our drawings and concepts as well as  critiquing each others work if your ok with being critqued.


So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be more drawing focused! 


You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun in participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC.

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
It is a whimsical reference to a custom Denise discovered in Edinburgh in which members of the legal profession would assemble once a month or so in a private club to smoke cigars and network over a bottle of port wine (the bottle was handed from one person to the other from the left and not allowed to be set back down on the table until empty...the tradition has naval/nautical roots, we believe). 


Picking up on that custom, this will be a get-together of wise-gals on a week-night in an upscale Manhattan bar/hotel to talk about current topics in science and engineering.


(Alcohol consumption would be optional. Cigars would only feature figuratively, not literally). 

*** Location: SixtyFive - Rainbow Room -> Take the elevator to the 65th floor of the Rockefeller Center. Here's a link to their Yelp's reviews:


http://www.yelp.com/biz/sixtyfive-new-york-2
results.name: Pass the Port - Talking Shop Over Drinks and Cigars

Aloha Everyone:

Summer is here so its time to announce one of our most popular events:

A Luau @ 230 Fifth! 

May's Luau @ 230 Fifth was awesome, just check out the pics:

Our 10th Annual Luau @ 230 FIFTH[masked]

So we're back again, based in the enclosed penthouse Lounge. In addition, we will have full access to the Rooftop Garden Club @ 230 FIFTH, with Manhattan's most spectacular view!

The Details:

*Free Leis* for those not already wearing them as a fashion statement!

*Dancing to all your favorite tunes with DJ Vinnie Campisi!

Drink Specials:

* $6 wine drink special!

* $8 Mai Tai's!

* $8 Well drinks!

*Umbrellas* for your umbrella drinks!

*Umbrella Drinks* for your umbrellas!

** Drink specials on the lower level ONLY!**

***Admission Is FREE!***

But there's more! Four years ago my friends Andie & Spicer met at one of our events. Things have progressed nicely, so they're getting married, a true Social Networking success story! What will make this event truly special is that since they met at one of our events, they want to get married at one as well so during this event we'll have a brief ceremony where Andie & Spicer will exchange vows & you're all invited!


The Date:  Friday, August 21st from 6-11PM.

The Location:


230 FIFTH (west side of Fifth Avenue between 26th & 27th Streets)

230 FIFTH.com

Since 230 FIFTH's opening in May of 2006:

. Voted #1 most popular night life venue in Manhattan by ZAGAT

· Voted #2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by CitySearch

· Voted #1 thing "To Do" in New York by Spur, Japan's leading fashion magazine

The Enclosed Penthouse Lounge at 230 FIFTH

The Rooftop Garden at 230 FIFTH

The Food at 230 FIFTH:

Besides offering a full bar, 230 FIFTH also offers a full kitchen menu (serving food from 4:00PM - 4:00AM)

The food at '230 FIFTH' has also received outstanding reviews.  If you merely Google 'Best Restaurants Manhattan' or 'Best Restaurants NYC' (out of over 2 million Google searches for these terms), '230 FIFTH' consistently comes up #1, #2, or #3!  (Note: Although we really don't compare ourselves to some of New York's truly outstanding four star restaurants such as 'Daniel,' 'Jean-George' or 'Le Bernandin,' as you will see by that which follows, many think of us quite highly!)

Dress Code For Men: No shorts, baggy/torn or very worn out jeans, tank tops, sleeveless shirts.

General Dress Code: No t-shirts with logos or pictures, sports jerseys, athletic wear, flip-flops and baseball caps/hats of any kind.

I'll add more details as I have them so stay tuned!

For more info: [masked]

Or call/text:[masked]

See you there!

Andy

results.description:
Join us in North Chelsea at Pushcart Coffee for knitting, crocheting, good pastries, great coffee and craft beer. Soft instruction for beginner knitters will be offered by Janna. So, if you're a newbie Janna will be happy to introduce you to the basics or make you more comfortable with what you already know.

Be sure to let Janna know you want instruction, since many people come just hang out and knit. Feel free to come with any other craft too.

For those of you who would like knitting instruction, Janna will bring some supplies to use, but if you want to bring your project home you have two options:

1) We can get supplies for you!  For a small fee (around $10), Janna will pick up for needles and yarn for you to keep.  Please post on the discussion board if you would like Janna to get materials for you.

2)You are welcome to bring your own materials. Feel free to ask me questions about what supplies to bring by commenting below or messaging Janna Maria Vallee.

Pushcart Coffee closes at 8:30pm

We would love to see/support your progress at other meetups throughout the month!
results.name: Knitting at Pushcart Coffee with free beginner knitting instruction from Janna

Dress Code For Men: No shorts, baggy/torn or very worn out jeans, tank tops, sleeveless shirts.

General Dress Code: No t-shirts with logos or pictures, sports jerseys, athletic wear, flip-flops and baseball caps/hats of any kind.

I'll add more details as I have them so stay tuned!

Or call/text:[masked]

See you there!

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
http://www.bbkingblues.com/bio.php?id=5231


LOS VAN VAN
w/ DJ DAVID MEDINA

August 21, 2015
Showtime @ 8pm
Doors Open @ 6pm

VIP Reserved Side Loge Seating
* $80
* First Come, First Served General Admission - Standing Room
* $45 Advance / $50 Day of Show
* Limited Seating Available First Come, First Served * Full Menu Available
* $10 Minimum Per Person, For All Tables
* All Ages

"A huge music machine with gears and cogs and cylinders all churning simultaneously" 

 
- Peter Watrous, New York Times "The undisputed king of Cuban dance orchestras and one of the most influential forces ever in Afro-Cuban music" 

 
- Los Angeles Times Searock Music LLC proudly announces the U.S. 2015 tour of Formell y Los Van Van, Cuba's legendary, Grammy-winning dance orchestra. Heralded as Cuba's greatest dance orchestra and known throughout the world for their iconic live performances, Los Van Van return to North America, reuniting with Leo Tizol, the producer and creative force behind their 1996 debut tour of the U.S. Founded in 1969 by Juan Formell, Los Van Van continue to dominate as one of the world's foremost interpreters of contemporary Afro-Caribbean music. Fans can expect to hear the group's greatest hits along with work from their more current CD releases. Continuing the legacy of the late Juan Formell, his son Samuel, the band's artistic director, has left no doubt that the group will follow the footsteps of his father. The tour of Los Van Van will present compositions from their latest production entitled La Fantasia ("The Fantasy"), a collection of danceable tracks incorporating innovative, contemporary arrangements of Juan Formell's hits from past "La Fantasia es el mejor album de los Van Van"
- Samuel Formell - 

See more at: http://www.bbkingblues.com/bio.php?id=5231#sthash.H0aoTRGd.dpuf
results.name: Los Van Van Live @ BB King's this Friday, 8/21!

Both venues are free for our group members (mention Rory's List to the door person)

Many of our Meetup groups have been invited to this event. Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Feel free to come solo or with your friends.

Contact us if you have further questions.

We look forward in seeing you for a fun weekend.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory
