group.name: Single Men and Single Women in NYC!!!

venue.address_1: Central Park South between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
venue.name: Central Park Pond

results.description:
Vamos a empezar el fin de semana como debe ser, con un poco de estiramientos, vinyasas y ejercicios de respiracion al aire libre. Simplemente trae tu colchoneta, o usa una de las mías.

Nos encontraremos en la grama frente al lago del sur, por la entrada cerca del Hotel Plaza y de los caballos (calle 60 & 5ta Avenida). 


EVENTO POR DONACIÓN.
-----------------------------
Let's start the weekend with the right foot, with a some stretches, vinyasas and breathing exercises outdoors. Just bring your mat, or use one of mine. 

We'll meet in the grass across the south pond, around the area of the entrance close to the Plaza Hotel and the horses (60th Street & 5th Avenue). 


EVENT BY DONATION.
results.name: Yoga Terapéutica en Central Park

results.description:
Aloha Everyone:

Summer is here so its time to announce one of our most popular events:

A Luau @ 230 Fifth!

May's Luau @ 230 Fifth was awesome so we're back again, based in the enclosed penthouse Lounge. In addition, we will have full access to the Rooftop Garden Club @ 230 FIFTH, with Manhattan's most spectacular view!

The Details:

*Free Leis* for those not already wearing them as a fashion statement!

*Dancing to all your favorite tunes with DJ Vinnie Campisi!

Drink Specials:

* $6 wine drink special!

* $8 Mai Tai's!

* $8 Well drinks!

*Umbrellas* for your umbrella drinks!

*Umbrella Drinks* for your umbrellas!

** Drink specials on the lower level ONLY!**

***Admission Is FREE!***

But there's more! Four years ago my friends Andie & Spicer met at one of our events. Things have progressed nicely, so they're getting married, a true Social Networking success story! What will make this event truly special is that since they met at one of our events, they want to get married at one as well so during this event we'll have a brief ceremony where Andie & Spicer will exchange vows & you're all invited! 


The Date:  Friday, August 21st from 6-11PM.

The Location:

230 FIFTH (west side of Fifth Avenue between 26th & 27th Streets)

230 FIFTH.com

Since 230 FIFTH's opening in May of 2006:

. Voted #1 most popular night life venue in Manhattan by ZAGAT

· Voted #2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by CitySearch

· Voted #1 thing "To Do" in New York by Spur, Japan's leading fashion magazine

The Enclosed Penthouse Lounge at 230 FIFTH

The Rooftop Garden at 230 FIFTH

The Food at 230 FIFTH:

Besides offering a full bar, 230 FIFTH also offers a full kitchen menu (serving food from 4:00PM - 4:00AM)

The food at '230 FIFTH' has also received outstanding reviews.  If you merely Google 'Best Restaurants Manhattan' or 'Best Restaurants NYC' (out of over 2 million Google searches for these terms), '230 FIFTH' consistently comes up #1, #2, or #3!  (Note: Although we really don't compare ourselves to some of New York's truly outstanding four star restaurants such as 'Daniel,' 'Jean-George' or 'Le Bernandin,' as you will see by that which follows, many think of us quite highly!)

Dress Code For Men: No shorts, baggy/torn or very worn out jeans, tank tops, sleeveless shirts.

General Dress Code: No t-shirts with logos or pictures, sports jerseys, athletic wear, flip-flops and baseball caps/hats of any kind.

I'll add more details as I have them so stay tuned!

See you there!

Andy

*Dancing to all your favorite tunes with DJ Vinnie Campisi!

Drink Specials:

* $6 wine drink special!

* $8 Mai Tai's!

* $8 Well drinks!

*Umbrellas* for your umbrella drinks!

*Umbrella Drinks* for your umbrellas!

** Drink specials on the lower level ONLY!**

***Admission Is FREE!***

But there's more! Four years ago my friends Andie & Spicer met at one of our events. Things have progressed nicely, so they're getting married, a true Social Networking success story! What will make this event truly special is that since they met at one of our events, they want to get married at one as well so during this event we'll have a brief ceremony where Andie & Spicer will exchange vows & you're all invited! 


The Date:  Friday, August 21st from 6-11PM.

The Location:

230 FIFTH (west side of Fifth Avenue between 26th & 27th Streets)

230 FIFTH.com

Since 230 FIFTH's opening in May of 2006:

. Voted #1 most popular night life venue in Manhattan by ZAGAT

· Voted #2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by CitySearch

· Voted #1 thing "To Do" in New York by Spur, Japan's leading fashion magazine

The Enclosed Penthouse Lounge at 230 FIFTH

The Rooftop Garden at 230 FIFTH

The Food at 230 FIFTH:

Besides offering a full bar, 230 FIFTH also offers a full kitchen menu (serving food from 4:00PM - 4:00AM)

The food at '230 FIFTH' has also received outstanding reviews.  If you merely Google 'Best Restaurants Manhattan' or 'Best Restaurants NYC' (out of over 2 million Google searches for these terms), '230 FIFTH' consistently comes up #1, #2, or #3!  (Note: Although we really don't compare ourselves to some of New York's truly outstanding four star restaurants such as 'Daniel,' 'Jean-George' or 'Le Bernandin,' as you will see by that which follows, many think of us quite highly!)

Dress Code For Men: No shorts, baggy/torn or very worn out jeans, tank tops, sleeveless shirts.

General Dress Code: No t-shirts with logos or pictures, sports jerseys, athletic wear, flip-flops and baseball caps/hats of any kind.

I'll add more details as I have them so stay tuned!

See you there!

Andy

Whether you’re getting ready for work in the morning, or going out for a night on the town, your makeup needs to leave a strong impression. Let us teach you all about today’s products and techniques, and then give you the skills to combine them into the perfect look. Each class features an intimate group setting for maximum fun and learning. Join our class, learn about makeup, and finish off the night with a sweet glass of wine; you deserve it!

Found a 20% off Promo Code in an Email: HISUMMER

Date: August 21st - 6:00pm - 3Hrs 
Tickets Link: https://goo.gl/qyXZbU
results.name: Make-up Applications - A Quick Guide

results.description:
Note: It is recommended to purchase tickets in advance for this event in case it sells out.

Climb aboard the Jewel for a 3 hour cruise around Manhattan featuring the sounds of the Smiths and Morrissey. For those of you who missed the Sons and Heirs last time, here is another chance to catch this talented band in a setting that will also include spectacular views of NYC area sites. Let's face it, the Smiths will never re-form so we have to accept the next best thing. This will be the best we can get. What other cover band plays this great music?

Tickets are $25 in advance and $30 at the door (I already got mine!). They can be purchased through the link below. A cash bar will be available on board as will be food for purchase. The boat boards at 7pm at E 23rd St. and FDR Drive, and departs at 8pm sharp.

http://rocksoff.com/shows/3202

Let's meet at nearby Vamos! for some pre show festivities and then head over to the boat.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bar area
results.name: Rock and Roll River Cruise Featuring a Tribute to the Smiths and Morrissey

results.description:
Holistic Hangout

(typically every 3rd Friday of the month)

Relax, Unwind, Refresh

When climbing the mountain of enlightenment, growth, self-development, healing, and spirituality it can be good to stop and catch your breath.

Share, Connect and Exchange!

Meet fellow seekers off the mat, outside the circle, beyond the classroom.

Rest your 3rd eye

Revive your Chakras

Fill your heart with good company, food and drink.


COME OUT & PLAY WITH US at the WHOLE FOODS CAFE!

Stop by for a little, Stop by for a lot,

Stop by on your way or Stop by and stay,

Stop by for some stimulating conversation and a bite to eat with unique and interesting people who share an interest in the diversity of holistic and alternative news, views and practices. We are experimenting with this new, quieter space with more freedom to mingle, move, chat and exchange.

This is a very casual event.  No agenda, just simple conversation, meet and mingle.

Share adventures, experiences, health tips, intentions and more

Learn about interesting classes

Meet healers, practitioners and coaches

 If you are just beginning to explore or been exploring for a while, we welcome you.  It is amazing how so many people who are attracted find that they have natural abilities of healing, coaching, energyworking or even more amazing skills.

Make Great Connections in an inviting social setting

We Look Forward To Welcoming Back Old Friends & Meeting New Ones Too!

You can Register here on Meetup or on EventBrite

Many Blessings,


Joel Elfman & Michael Balice


***We are often joined by members from several other Meetup groups this event is posted to.
results.how_to_find_us: we'll have some signs out at the tables on the upper level
results.name: Holistic Hangout @ Whole Foods Cafe - Houston St

results.description:
Join us in North Chelsea at Pushcart Cafe for knitting, crocheting, good pastries, great coffee and craft beer. Soft instruction for beginner knitters will be offered by me (Janna). So, if you're a newbie I will be happy to introduce you to the basics or make you more comfortable with what you already know.  Be sure to let me know you want instruction, since many people come just hang out and knit.  Feel free to come with any other project you're working on too.

For those of you who would like knitting instruction, Janna will bring some supplies to use, but if you want to bring your project home you should bring your own yarn and knitting needles.  Feel free to ask me questions about what supplies to bring by commenting below or messaging me (Janna).

Pushcart closes at 8pm during the summer.

This meetup is free.
results.name: Knitting Group at Pushcart Cafe: free beginner knitting instruction

results.description:
The team that brought The DL and Dinner on Ludlow to the Lower East Side has recently built a rooftop lounge in Hell's Kitchen with sweeping views of Manhattan. The 5,000 square foot bi-level venue, boasting indoor and outdoor space, is located in the penthouse of the Hilton Garden Hotel at 251 West 48th Street near 8th Avenue.  

The DL’s Mino Habib and NYC nightlife veteran Paul Seres are at the helm of the space located on the 15th and 16th floors of the property. Habib will also head up operations. Bookings are being taken for private parties and corporate events. 

https://vimeo.com/109659348

Lets come out after work and mingle with members from our group. We are not asking for a deposit when you RSVP,  as we do not want to limit the number of people who can attend this event. We will all meet at the bar for some mingling.

Food Menu

http://www.theattic-nyc.com/food/

Drink Menu

http://www.theattic-nyc.com/cocktails/
results.name: Afterwork at Attic Rooftop and Lounge

Summer is here so its time to announce one of our most popular events:

Our 10th Annual Luau @ 230 FIFTH[masked]

So we're back again, based in the enclosed penthouse Lounge. In addition, we will have full access to the Rooftop Garden Club @ 230 FIFTH, with Manhattan's most spectacular view!

The Location:

230 FIFTH (west side of Fifth Avenue between 26th & 27th Streets)

230 FIFTH.com

Since 230 FIFTH's opening in May of 2006:

. Voted #1 most popular night life venue in Manhattan by ZAGAT

· Voted #2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by CitySearch

· Voted #1 thing "To Do" in New York by Spur, Japan's leading fashion magazine

The Enclosed Penthouse Lounge at 230 FIFTH

The Rooftop Garden at 230 FIFTH

The Food at 230 FIFTH:

Besides offering a full bar, 230 FIFTH also offers a full kitchen menu (serving food from 4:00PM - 4:00AM)

The food at '230 FIFTH' has also received outstanding reviews.  If you merely Google 'Best Restaurants Manhattan' or 'Best Restaurants NYC' (out of over 2 million Google searches for these terms), '230 FIFTH' consistently comes up #1, #2, or #3!  (Note: Although we really don't compare ourselves to some of New York's truly outstanding four star restaurants such as 'Daniel,' 'Jean-George' or 'Le Bernandin,' as you will see by that which follows, many think of us quite highly!)

Dress Code For Men: No shorts, baggy/torn or very worn out jeans, tank tops, sleeveless shirts.

General Dress Code: No t-shirts with logos or pictures, sports jerseys, athletic wear, flip-flops and baseball caps/hats of any kind.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

results.description:
Dharma Drink Friends!

Let's go experience old school deep in Brooklyn at Ruby's Old Tyme Bar and Grill in Coney Island.  Then we're going to watch the fireworks from the Boardwalk.

Ruby Bar Restaurant is a Coney Island institution.  The location was originally Hebrew National Deli and Bar starting in 1934, then in 1970's it was purchased by the current owners and converted to Ruby's.

Ruby's is New York Magazine's critic's pick!  Per Brooklyn Historical Society: "Rubin Jacobs opened Ruby's in 1975 and it has since become a mainstay as the headquarters for both the Mermaid Parade and the Polar Bear Club..."  It's weather through two hurricanes and near eviction in 2010.  

At around 9:30pm we will go check out the Coney Island summer fireworks.

It's a trek, real trek, but it will be an island of nostalgia in our fast changing New York landscape...

Hope to see y'all!

Pete and Eddie,

Organizers

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

YOU MUST PRE PAY FOR YOUR TICKET USING THIS LINK : https://www.eventbrite.com/e/yankee-game-group-night-rotating-seats-tickets-18077129180

This is the most fun you will have at the ballpark ever!!!  Join us for this special night of socializing, conversations and baseball!  We have a block of 50 tickets reserved for our group where we will use our famous rotating seat system so you get to sit with a whole different group of people after ever inning!!!  ( If you come with a group of friends the rotating system is optional) You can meet the group either at Grand Central or The Stadium.  This is the perfect night for both baseball and non baseball fans to come together!

Here is how it works...

Register today and you will have several choices on how to enjoy the night.

1-Group 1 will meet at the Campbell Terrace Bar at Grand Central at 5-5:15pm.

2- Group 2 will meet on the patio of the Hard Rock Cafe located next to gate 6 at the Stadium at 6:30pm.

3- We will randomly hand out seats unless you have come with a friend or group then we would sit you together

4- After each full inning you will pull a new seat number out of a hat and go to a new seat surrounded by completely different people.  If you cane with a  friend or group you will have the option to  rotate or stay in your original seats.

5- Following the game you can go home or head out to one of the local bars near the stadium.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own

Do I need to be a baseball fan?  No, there will be probably half fans and half non fans.  There is always someone available to explain the rules.

How should I dress?  Most come from work so business casual or wear your favorite team jersey!

Where are the seats?  We are in section 408 which is the upper deck in left field

What if it rains?  Tickets are non refundable and we will be issue tickets to a future game ( we have no control over the date of the new game)  In case of rain we will likely invite all who wanted to go to a bar near Grand Central.

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]


YOU MUST PRE PAY FOR YOUR TICKET USING THIS LINK : https://www.eventbrite.com/e/yankee-game-group-night-rotating-seats-tickets-18077129180

This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Cristina Rodríguez

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
Only up to 10 participants per group. We'll have two groups running at the same time.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and John Estrada from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over twelve years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. John is a dynamic instructor from Colombia with a good sense of humor and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues in Colombia and the rest of the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

Nos vemos!

Jorge

Jessica

results.description:
Join us the 3rd Friday of each month for networking and coding! 


Socializing starts at 6:30PM — Make new friends, find a study group or study partner, or just practice your people skills. :-) 

Xcoding — That's what it's all about, right? During a typical MeetUp people socialize, work on Stanford assignments, ask other members questions, ask for help with a bug, offer help to others, etc. There is no set agenda and no formal presentation. If you prefer to sit in a corner and code away, you can do that. If you want to walk around offering people a helping hand, you can do that too.

Just Getting Started? Follow these steps . . .

• Stanford CS193P Winter 2015 Class (Swift) — Developing iOS 8 Apps with Swift 

• Stanford CS193P Fall 2013 Class (Objective-C) — Developing iOS 7 Apps for iPhone and iPad 

• Get the homework assignments and lecture code from Stanford University

• Download Xcode from the Mac App Store

• Sign up for a free Developer Account (note: the free account doesn't allow you to install apps on your device, for that you'll need the $99/year account)
results.name: iOS Study Group, 3rd Friday

results.description:
Uptown Fridays! is a highly anticipated social networking & dance party series, hosted at the Studio Museum in Harlem, during the summer and fall months.


From The Studio Museum in Harlem:

Boogie with us at Uptown Fridays! at The Studio Museum in Harlem! With a variety of vibrant events this series transforms the Museum into a center of social activity in Harlem.

Groove to the sounds of Libation's DJ Ian Friday with Manchildblack. Throughout the course of the evening we will provide opportunities to explore our current exhibitions during free guided tours, dance to great music in the Studio Museum’s courtyard, and browse incredible books, jewelry, t-shirts and gifts in the Museum Store. Bring a friend or come solo and make a few during a festive evening of art and culture!


Admission

Admission Suggested donation: Adults $7.00
Seniors and students (with valid id) $3.00
Free for members and children under 12. Join as a new member by clicking here.

Our Meetup

The event is from 7:00pm - 10:00pm, but we'll get together in the Museum lobby (bench area) @ 6:30pm for a little meet-and-greet, then go to the courtyard for drinks, socializing, & dancing shortly after. If you are running late, it's ok - just shoot Daniel a text to[masked] as early as possible to give a heads up. Thanks!

About The Studio Museum in Harlem

Right in the heart of Harlem, the Studio Museum is an art museum dedicated to black artists, both local and worldwide, and to artwork revolving around black culture.


The two floors of collection and exhibitions, consisting mostly of 19th- and 20th-century works, features artists from their Artists-in-Residence program, and the Studio’s Permanent Collection, which houses over 1,600 paintings, sculptures, drawings, prints, & photographs.
results.how_to_find_us: In front of the museum @ 6:30pm
results.name: Uptown Fridays! @ Studio Museum in Harlem

results.description:
Join us as we watch and discuss part 1 History's Mysteries of the 6 part documentary series: The Inexplicable Universe with Neil deGrasse Tysonfrom a Rosicrucian Perspective.

View Trailer Here!

Summary:

Science history is filled with puzzling mysteries that were only solved with modern science’s focus on experimentation instead of thought. Here, take a closer look at concepts that were once unexplainable but, thanks to modern physics, are now better understood. You’ll focus on two such former mysteries: the existence of an invisible “aether” through which light and sound were believed to travel and the orbit of Mercury, which seemed (to earlier scientists) to violate Newton’s fundamental laws of motion.

“We know a lot about the universe. But there’s even more that we don’t know,” says astrophysicist and Professor Neil deGrasse Tyson, director of the Hayden Planetarium, an award-winning lecturer, and one of the world’s foremost experts on the secrets of the universe. And his course The Inexplicable Universe: Unsolved Mysteries is the perfect gateway into this mind-bending and eye-opening subject. This visually stunning course, which has been honored with a 2013 Telly Award for Outstanding Educational Program, features six self-contained lectures that transport you on a marvelous journey to the frontiers of the known (and unknown) universe and introduce you to tantalizing questions being addressed by the world’s top scientists. Undeniably engaging and fascinating, this lecture series is a wonderful entrée to scientific pursuits that lie at the very heart of the history and nature of our universe.

All Are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Mystical Movie Night: The Inexplicable Universe

venue.name: Film Forum in New York City

results.description:
BELTRACCHI The Art of Forgery

WRITTEN AND DIRECTED BY ARNE BIRKENSTOCK 


60 Minutes called Wolfgang Beltracchi a “con man of epic proportions” and dubbed him and his wife Helene, “the Bonnie and Clyde of the art world.” For nearly 40 years the charming and effervescent Beltracchi produced hundreds of meticulous works of art, forgeries of early and mid-20th century artists, using old canvases and distressed frames scoured from flea markets and paints whose pigments he ground himself. Amazingly, he didn’t reproduce known paintings, but, working in an artist’s style, would create entirely new “masterpieces.” A large Max Ernst that took him three days to produce could sell for $5 million. Beltracchi was put on trial in 2011, but readily admits that the handful of forgeries he was held accountable for are just the tip of the iceberg. Many others sit in some of the world’s greatest art museums and private collections. This documentary captures his unique personality: a bizarre mix of candor and cunning, insouciance and joie de vivre.

GERMANY • 2014 • 93 MINS. • IN GERMAN WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES • KIMSTIM

Reviews

“Without a doubt he is the biggest forger of our times.”
– Vanity Fair

“A highly enjoyable look at a career spent duping the art world. Offers plenty of behind-the-scenes secrets. Walks us through the tricks of his trade, in this case buying a genuine but worthless old painting at a flea market and using the signs of authenticity on the canvas to bolster his illusion. This process is fascinating.”
– John DeFore, The Hollywood Reporter

Tickets

Tickets can be purchased in August by following this link and clicking on the ticketing options on the right side of the screen.http://filmforum.org/film/beltracchi-the-art-of-forgery-film-page

Meeting


We will meet outside the Film Forum at 6:45 to see the film and decide on a food or drink spot and discuss the film after.
results.name: Film:  BELTRACCHI The Art of Forgery

results.description:
Why try to improve perfection? The intro to the Wikipedia article for Top Dog is the perfect, factual, sad summary of this flick:

"Top Dog is a 1995 comedy action film directed by Aaron Norris and starring Chuck Norris. Written by Aaron Norris and Tim Grayem, it was Norris' last film to release theatrically before he shifted to direct-to-video films for several years.

In the film, Norris' character, Jake Wilder, is partnered with Reno, a police dog, whose handler was killed. Jake and Reno investigate a plot by domestic terrorists to attack a conference on unity. Jake and Reno survive assassination attempts and several hand-to-hand fights with the terrorists and eventually discover enough clues to foil the attack. The film is set in San Diego and was largely filmed there.

The film received mainly negative reviews."

Here's the trailer: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fdGzAWg_dtk

-------------------

For those new to Wasted Cinema - we celebrate the best of campy, low-budget and cult movies. You can check out our previous screenings at www.wastedcinema.com for an idea of the type of cinematic escapades you can normally expect from one of our showings.

At our screenings, we've got:
- Live Twitter stream (best Tweet each half wins a free beer)
- Raffle with sweet prizes
- Drink specials
- Toastworthy Moment cues to drink along with the movie


MOVIE STARTS AT 8:30.

Become the non-chalant wine aficionado you’ve always wanted to be. This is a wine tasting class with cheese, fruit & jam. Led by wine and cheese expert from the Chelsea Market’s, ‘Lucy’s Whey’ cheese shop, this was nominated as one of the best Wine Tourism features of NYC! It also has a 4.5 star Yelp rating. results.description:
Our 21st Permaculture Design Certification starts Sept 12th and this is an excellent opportunity to come meet Andrew and learn more about our life changing course. Join us!

Retrofitting Industrial Mega Cities with Permaculture Design @ Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup


There are 22 mega cities of over 10 million people in the world.There were 5 in 1975, 19 in 2000 and 16 of the 22 that exist today are in the developing countries.

In just 1950 none existed and the majority of the worlds people were employed in agricultural activities.By 1990 the majority of the worlds population works in urban related services of some kind.

We will explore how to retool and retrofit,intelligently, systemically and with finesse. How to adapt with biology and Permaculture design methodologies before resorting to quick fix end of the pipe technological solutions to the challenges and opportunities of these very unique industrial megacities of our era.

Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup.
results.name: Retrofitting Industrial Mega cities with Permaculture Design @ BPM

Tickets: https://goo.gl/kaVmrc Learn how to hand sculpt a beautiful mug. No experience needed. At this event, we'll focus on making 1 porcelain mug. Our 2-hour workshop will include: -Pinching and creating various shapes -Learning to score and slip to attach functional or decorative details -Exploring various finishing techniques like smoothing, adding a variety of textures and altering the shape through cutouts and paddling -Black and blue underglazes will be provided to add additional surface designs, if desired. -The pieces will be glazed with food safe clear, high-fired within 3 weeks. -Pick up coordination will be emailed out once your piece is ready

results.description:
Friday, August 21 from 7pm to 9pm

Thursday, August 27 from 7pm to 9pm

Friday, August 28 from 7pm to 9pm

at Tibet House

"Hearing the teachings benefits your own mind, and later, because of having heard it, you will be able to benefit others."  

- Lama Zopa Rinpoche 

In this rare series of teachings in New York City, Lama Zopa Rinpoche will offer instruction and advice related to the path to enlightenment. Rinpoche's unique style is to offer teachings in accordance with the minds and needs of the students attending. Topics may include transforming problems, bodhicitta, emptiness, karma, and other essential teachings necessary to progress on the path to enlightenment. 

Suggested Donation: 

Open. 

A portion of net proceeds will go towards those affected by the Nepal earthquake, who continue to need our support. 

Offerings will also go to Lama Zopa Rinpoche, expenses associated with the teachings (such as space rental and transportation), and support of the Center.

Registration:

There is no pre-registration, and admission will be based on a first-come, first-served basis. Doors will open at 5:30pm. We recommend arriving early, as we expect many people to attend and the Tibet House Gallery may become full. 

If you are an ordained Sangha member, please contact us by August 19, as we would be honored to reserve seating for you.

Special Gift for Members:

We will reserve and guarantee seating for all Members of Shantideva Meditation Center, to express our deep gratitude for your life-sustaining generosity to our Center and to the Dharma. Please RSVP by August 19 to reserve your seat. 

It's not too late to become a member. To be eligible for reserved seating, please do so by August 19. 

About Kyabje Lama Zopa Rinpoche:

Lama Zopa Rinpoche is the Spiritual Director of the Foundation for the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition (FPMT), which he founded with Lama Thubten Yeshe based on the request of students wishing to learn and share Mahayana Buddhist teachings and values with others.

For over 30 years, he has overseen the spiritual activities of the extensive worldwide network of centers, projects, and services that form FPMT. 

Rinpoche's kindness is legendary. Details of Rinpoche's ongoing philanthropy can be followed through the Lama Zopa Rinpoche Bodhichitta Fund News. 

To read more on Lama Zopa's life accomplishments and contributions to the world please click here.
results.name: Opening the Door to Liberation: Teachings with Kyabje Lama Zopa Rinpoche

CASH Only No exception! ( make organizer Job easier! Do not show up with credit card please!) 

• Serious RSVP only. Do not RSVP if you're not certain. 

• "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated.

• We are going to eat Family Style, each person orders one dish to share. We will split the final bill of food. Every individual is responsible to pay their own drinks.

• Do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above.


The Cost of Food without Drink should be around $25-$33 per person (could been more or less ) , No including Drinks

I love me some good chinese and this is as good as it gets! We actually had no intentions of eating here as we were going to the famous Joe's Shanghai located a few doors down, but as we were entering Joe's we noticed that the health department had downgraded them from an A to a B so we skipped it and we're glad we did.

Located just a few doors down from Joe's Shanghai Gourmet is a hidden jewel of a restaurant just waiting to be discovered. small with a super attentive staff we considered ourselves lucky to have found this place.

Vegetable with Black Mushroom

We started with the soup dumplings which were just crazy good and I'm sad knowing that I will never find anything like this in Tampa. I ordered the Chicken and Pork two ways, my wife had the vegetable lo mien, and my daughter had the chicken lo mien, lets leave it at best lo mien noodles any of us have ever had period! my dish was equally good and we can't wait to go back on our next visit to the big apple.

If you're in the area, skip the better know Joe's Shanghai and find this beauty of a place, you won't be sorry...

Enjoy!

results.description:
A chilling tale of sci-fi terror from legendary director Roger Corman, X offers the story of a scientist who has successfully realized the ability to see through solid matter as a cautionary study in obsessive excess. At first amused with his new discovery, Ray Milland's performance effectively shifts from a sense of intoxicated wonder to inescapable terror as his obsession with furthering his experiments ultimately renders him able to see through much more than clothes and buildings. From respected scientist to miracle worker to man on the run, Milland's turn as the tortured scientist provides the film with a believable lead and a solid foundation. Likewise, master of insults Don Rickles offers a believably uncharacteristic turn as a seemingly sympathetic soul whose true intentions are slowly revealed to be much darker. With an effective and thoughtful screenplay peppered with social commentary, complex and almost hypnotic visual effects, and a bleak ending that is sure to stick with viewers for some time later, Corman has crafted a tight and suspenseful little yarn that some argue is one of his best.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E-38qQBofak

You can purchase advance tickets for the event here: 

http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2061879

results.description:
Our 21st Permaculture Design Certification starts Sept 12th and this is an excellent opportunity to come meet Andrew and learn more about our life changing course. Join us!

Retrofitting Industrial Mega Cities with Permaculture Design @ Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

There are 22 mega cities of over 10 million people in the world.There were 5 in 1975, 19 in 2000 and 16 of the 22 that exist today are in the developing countries.

In just 1950 none existed and the majority of the worlds people were employed in agricultural activities.By 1990 the majority of the worlds population works in urban related services of some kind.

We will explore how to retool and retrofit,intelligently, systemically and with finesse. How to adapt with biology and Permaculture design methodologies before resorting to quick fix end of the pipe technological solutions to the challenges and opportunities of these very unique industrial megacities of our era.

Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup
results.name: Retrofitting Industrial Mega Cities with Permaculture Design @ BPM

results.description:
Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who
want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate
in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics
like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose
of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.

Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of
hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by
melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful
heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct
experience. Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe
or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal
realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual
practice are welcome.

Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner
(prasadam) served.

Admission to each meetup is free.
Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.

1. Please RSVP. Location given on the phone.

[masked]

Charu Gopika

results.description:
Watch now at http://www.Qualcomm.com/inventoff

Question: what happens when you bring together two teams of artists, engineers, students, and a pile of technology? Answer: an invention that will inspire change. That’s the idea behind Qualcomm’s #WhyWait Invent-Off.

In this webseries, Qualcomm and host Jason Silva (@JasonSilva) challenge two teams of inventors to stop waiting and start innovating, using shelves full of technology and Qualcomm products to build their new creations. They have five days to create something that positively impacts the future. The winning team gets $5,000, a feature in Gizmodo, and participation in the Qualcomm CES booth this January. So far, the competition is young, but promises a fascinating look at creativity, technology, and how the cyber-sausage gets made. Why are you still waiting, when you could be watching?

It’s summer, all the good TV shows are over, and it’s time to get yourself a new obsession. The #WhyWait Invent-Off is your answer. This isn’t your grandma’s competition. (Unless you have the type of grandma who’s really into microprocessors.)

Watch now at http://www.Qualcomm.com/inventoff
results.name: Hackathon: Arduino Yun + SmartWatch + Snapdragon = Qualcomm #WhyWait Invent-Off

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)
results.name: On Going FRIDAY EVENING Yoga with Reiki (both men and women are in this class)

group.name: The Reiki & Yoga Meetup Group of Clifton New Jersey

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C5FsdMky0J8

Another good one people!!! I've seen this multi-talented artist and let me vouch for him,,, He's amazing, but not for virgin ears!!! If you want to hear some good blues and watch this gifted performer sing some bluesy (not for the faint at heart) tunes, come on out and join me for this show!!! Tickets are $12 (in advance) and $15 the day of the show and can be purchased at: http://www.bbkingblues.com/bio.php?id=5710

Paxton seems to effortlessly embody the spirit of early musics including ragtime, '20s jazz and Dust Bowl-era blues, delivering them through a dizzying display of virtuosity on guitar, piano, banjo, and lately, fiddle. And his delivery in dress, manner, speech, and humor of the period is so spot-on that it seems impossible that it is all contained within one so young. He can usually be found in smart overalls and a starched white shirt buttoned to the top, with a pocket watch and fob and either a derby hat or yarmulke topping his cherubic face. With his perpetually wry expression, Paxton is part old-school bluesman, part trickster. From looks alone, you might think he was the great-grandson of Willie Dixon or Lemon Jefferson.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll send out my number the day before the show.
results.name: BLIND BOY PAXTON at BB Kings!!!

results.description:
What’s it all about? Is spirituality part of your everyday life? How do you find it? Each monthly conversation will focus on a specific topic or question to guide the conversation.

Upcoming topic:    Are There Spiritual DO's and DON’Ts?

As we go through this life there is the question of learning and growing. How do we know what is right or wrong for ourselves, and what actions to take or not? Are there spiritual laws to live by that smooth the journey through life, and how do we know? What are your key principles to living a spiritual life?

Please join us for this open discussion format—come to explore ideas, share your experiences, ask questions, or hear from others. Our goal is to learn from and honor each other’s spiritual insights in a relaxed and comfortable environment. We look forward to meeting you for the first time or seeing you again. Feel free to bring a friend.

This Meetup repeats on the 3rd Friday of every month at the same location and time. Look for our future postings, including conversations on these topics: The Quest for Truth … Is Life a Random Walk? … Dreams are Real—What is Their Purpose? … You Have Lived Before—Past Lives and Karmic Ties…What’s Love Got to Do With It? … When Love Replaces Fear … Are There Spiritual DOs and DON’Ts? … Soul Travel and Out-of-Body Experiences … Awaken to Greater Spirituality in Your Life … An Intimate Relationship with God

Panera Bread at 15 Bloomfield Ave. Montclair, NJ 
(In Glenmont Square next to 7-ELEVEN; parking available)


For information on other events being held throughout the state,
visit www.eckankar-nj.org

results.description:
Henry Koretzky and Jamie O'Brien are sponsoring this dance for Debbie in honor of her birthday. Admission is free; attendees are encouraged to make a small contribution in support of Swingin' Tern.


Beginners' workshop starts at 7:30; the dance begins at 8 PM. 


New to contra dancing? This dance is ideal for meeting friendly people, celebrating Debbie's birthday and learning how to contra dance--all courtesy of Henry and Jamie. Their band, Unbowed, will be playing beautiful music to accompany Bob Isaac's calling. Bob is a national-class caller, famous for teaching newcomers how to glide through a whole contra dance in just a few minutes.

If it's your first time, we recommend the beginners' workshop. You'll learn many of the basic figures of contra dancing, which will make the dance more fun. And because some experienced dancers always attend the beginners workshop to help out, you'll get to know and meet people before the dance itself begins.
results.name: Let's celebrate Debbie's birthday and contra dance to Unbowed and Bob Isaacs

We will be learning various fascinating topics like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.

"Kiss Me or Cut Off My Head" - join us for the very special evening: theater, poetry and visual art collide in this contemporary retelling of the Medusa myth. The play is based on true accounts of survivors of sexual assault. 


Solo show of fine art photography by Kate Goltseva complements the performance.
The both shows are held at Soho Photo Gallery.
The NYC premier is on August 20, through September 5. 

KISS ME OR CUT OFF MY HEAD is adapted by Brooke Haney from the poetry of Sheryl St. Germain. The piece aims to raise money and build awareness for Margaret’s Safe Place, a project of Shining Hope. To that end, 35% of the proceeds from every ticket will go to Margaret's Safe Place.

Tickets: https://www.artful.ly/store/events/6597

About "Kiss Me" the play: http://www.kissmetheplay.com/

About Kate Goltseva: http://www.reartiste.com/kate-goltseva-1/

TALK BACK SERIES

KISS ME OR CUT OFF MY HEAD will host a series of post-show discussions and talk backs immediately following select performances at SoHo Photo Gallery. Check below for the current talk back schedule, guest speakers, and topics of the post-show discussions, then be sure to purchase your ticket to the show that evening. Talk backs are included in the price of admission.

results.description:
The Poetry Table has expanded into the Bronx at Sweetwater Dance and Yoga, just 1 block East of Yankee Stadium. Owner Yosara Trujillo (http://sweetwaterdanceandyoga.com/management) has graciously agreed to host our Bronx Poetry Table at her studio every Friday from 7:30-9:00 p.m.

The parameters are the same – bring a poem, either an original by you or a poem you love written by someone else. Make enough copies for everyone. For the first half hour, we will share them together over wine, cheese, crackers, and much appreciation. At 8:00, we will spend a ½ hour writing original work. At 8:30, we will share what brilliance an hour and a half of creative immersion has inspired us to produce.

No charge, but if you want to bring some wine or cheese or other goodie, who am I to say no?

By subway: take the 4 or D train to the 161st Street Yankee Stadium stop. Walk 1 block to Gerard Avenue. Sweet Water Dance and Yoga, 876 Gerard Ave., Bronx, NY 10452 is on the Northeast corner of Gerard Avenue, across from Foodtown.  Press the doorbell and await the sound of the buzzer that unlocks the door. The studio is on the 2nd floor.

By bus:

Take the Bx 6 or Bx13 to Gerard Ave,

or the Bx 1, or Bx2, to 161st St,

or BxM4 to 158st St

and walk to the location above.

By car: Yankee Stadium is currently hosting few events, so this Friday should be all right. There is street parking in front if you're lucky, and Yankee Stadium garages all around. I would strongly advise you to check if there is a Yankee Stadium event going on before coming by car.   Really.

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Sweet Water Dance and Yoga is on the Northeast corner of Gerard Avenue and 161st Street in Bronx, NY across from Foodtown.

results.description:
The Place: Airy brasserie serving Afro-Asian-American fare & cocktails in a chic space with leather banquettes.


Menu is here: http://thececilharlem.com/themenus/

About the executive chef:

A self-described social minister, Alexander is a Chef, a Restaurateur, an Author and an Opera Singer. He has received great acclaim in the New York City restaurant scene, including being named one of Zagat’s “19 NYC Restaurant Power Players You Need to Know,” and winning Esquire’s “Best New Restaurant in America 2014,” for The Cecil. As the Executive Chef, Co-owner and Creator of the newly reopened Minton’s Supper Club and its award-winning sister restaurant, The Cecil, Alexander endeavors to entertain the world. He is joined in these recent restaurant projects, which fall under the Harlem Jazz Enterprises umbrella by Chef de Cuisine Joseph “JJ” Johnson and partners, Dick and Laura Parsons.

Alexander has successfully introduced New Yorkers to his brand of hospitality and New American Cuisine, which he refers to as Afro-Asian-American Cooking at The Cecil and Southern Revival Cooking, at Minton’s. Southern Revival cooking is Alexander’s interpretation of Low Country Cooking, which is a culinary discipline that he developed for his three previously popular and highly regarded restaurants, Café Beulah, Sweet Ophelia’s, and The Shoebox Café, also in New York City.

Alexander has spent the last twenty-five years traveling the world and studying the cooking techniques, cultures and “food-ways” of the African diaspora. Through the course of his travels, he has developed a unique insight and passion for the influence of the migrating people of Africa and how through their culinary efforts, they changed the palate of our global expression.

Those lessons form the foundation of his Harlem based restaurant, The Cecil, which is the first Afro-Asian-American brasserie in the world. In January of 2015, Alexander was invited by The James Beard Foundation to present his culinary exploration of the African Diaspora to a sold-out audience at The Beard House with chef Joseph JJ Johnson.


 As always:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
Chimney Mountain Camping - Connected with Caving Event on the 22nd.

--------------------------------------------------

Friday Arrivals:


    DaveKoz


    Mike D


    Starchild

Saturday Arrivals:

    Jay Perotto

    Matt H

--------------------------------------------------

This is not car camping, but some easy backpacking.

We will be carrying our camping gear and all the water we'll need for two days to the top of the mountain; the campsite is near the summit.  (1 Mile and 1000' of elevation gain.)

There is no water source on the mountain, so bring a lot.

To Join this event you must be RSVP'ed Yes for caving on the 22nd.  I'll be up there both Friday and Saturday Nights.  Message me you want to be a camper, and which nights you will be staying, and I will add you.  DEC limit for camping is 9.

The campsite is small, so please tent share as much as possible.  Tents which don't fit in the site may have to be put 150' away, in the woods.

There are other overnight options: There are cabins at the trailhead, and 2 leantos about 2 miles away from parking lot, at Puffer Pond.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DETAILS


<a>Link to Parking Lot</a>:  The meetup location does not take you all the way to the parking lot!


Parking is $2 per car, PER DAY.  It is private property.  Please be quietly respectful, and put your fee in the box.

The entire mountain is 1.2 miles / 1000', and the campsite is 0.25 / 120' short of that.


Order of Events:


• Pack in.

• Sleep.

• Arrival of Day-Trippers and Saturday Campers.


• Cave.

• Summit Sunset Dinner.


• Fire.

• Sleep.

• Pack out.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Navigation Points:

• Parking: [masked], [masked]

• Trailhead: [masked], [masked] (Don't go to Puffer Pond!)


• Campsite: [masked], [masked]


• Summit: [masked], [masked]


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------


If you join this event you are responsible for yourself in all regards; including but not limited to the following.  You must be prepared to navigate yourself to your objectives and back to your vehicle.  Which means being familiar with the route prior to arrival, and bringing whatever navigation aids necessary.  You must know the mileage / elevation gain / terrain / planned pace, and be familiar with your ability to traverse them.  Unless the meetup is labeled as "Beginner", it is your responsibility to gauge your ability to keep up with the group and get to the vehicles within a time-frame as to not cause alarm; this may mean that you may not meet all of your objectives.  Your first objective is always to get back to the vehicles safely, and let the rest of the group get on with their trip, so keep track of the time, turn around if you need to, and try to let people know if you think you might disappear.  There will be no gear-check, but extra food, extra water, rain layers, headlamp, lighter, compass, and whistle, should be things that you are very rarely without.  Most people are unfamiliar with how quickly rain on a 90 degree day can become a survival situation, so it warrants saying that, if there is any chance of rain, you need a raincoat.  Hope for the best, plan for the worst.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. 

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
RSVPs are now open.  Thank you all for your cooperation in keeping your RSVPs accurate and updated.  (No one appreciates coming out to a meetup expecting X number of attendees only to find Y some didn't show.)

There are a number of GOP candidates running for President in 2016.  Let's gather to discuss the first GOP debate (aired Thursday, August 6 @ 9PM on FOX) and whom you prefer and why.

Of the 17 candidates running for President, only 10 have been chosen for the first debate:  Donald Trump, Jeb Bush, Scott Walker, Mike Huckabee, Ben Carson, Ted Cruz, Marco Rubio, Rand Paul,  Chris Christie, and John Kasich. For more information about who these candidates are, feel free to visit the following link:  http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2015/08/05/fox-news-announces-candidate-line-up-for-prime-time-debate/

The seven other candidates who are still running include Carly Fiorina, Jim Gilmore, Lindsay Graham, Bobby Jindal, George Pataki, Rick Perry, and Rick Santorum, For more information about each of the 17 candidates, feel free to peruse this link here: http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2016/us/elections/2016-presidential-candidates.html?_r=0

Frankly, why would any of you not agree that Conservatives should stop nominating celebrities like Trump, Bush, Rubio, Huckabee, and Christie, and consider a relatively unknown powerhouse such as Carly Fiorina? Perhaps it would serve the GOP party well to have a business person (harder hitting than Romney ever was) to run for President, so feel free to attend and discuss.  She did exceptionally well debating the other six less popular nominees as well: http://www.cnn.com/2015/08/06/politics/carly-fiorina-republican-debate/

ABOUT:The New York Conservatives Meetup Group

WHO: We are a group of like-minded individuals who believe in upholding American conservative values fiscally, culturally, and politically. If you are a Conservative, Libertarian, Constitution Party, Neocon, Tea Party supporter or Republican, we welcome to you join our group and attend our meetings.

WHAT: We are a political and social discussions group, not an activist group, although activist members are welcome to join our group.

WHEN: We meet monthly, usually the 3rd Friday of each month, although there are occasional monthly exceptions as posted on this Meetup page.

WHERE: Our meetup is held at a restaurant in the Theater District, near Times Square in Manhattan. We chose this location for the convenience of mass transportation for all our Tri-State members, predominately those who reside in New York City and New Jersey.

WHY: Because we are sorely outnumbered by Liberals and Democrats in our Tri-State area. This meetup is intended for us get together to discuss and find common ground with each other.
results.name: The New York Conservatives Meetup Group Monthly Meetup

See you Friday Night.

Lee

To start the event you will break into groups lead by a staff photographer and experience shooting in a variety of setups, including high-key, low-key, boudoir and more. You will also experience a variety of different lighting setups including studio strobes and constant lights.

This shootout is geared toward everyone from the professional to the hobbyist. Technical guidance will be provided just bring your camera, external flash and plenty of memory cards. 

The shootout starts at 8pm and continues to 10pm. Cost for the shootout is $80, with $20 deposit via PayPal upon RSVP. After the deposit, you owe $60 cash at the door. After the shootout, 30-minute one-on-one sessions will be available. Sessions will be $60 payable in cash at the event. You can find the one-on-one chart at the bottom of the workshop information page when you RSVP. Please email scheduling requests to [masked].

One-on-one sessions are a great way to put together your own vision, lighting setup (using your own lights or ours.) It allows for the opportunity to shoot these amazing models without the expense of renting the studio and paying the model's minimum rates. There are several staff members on premises to lend a helping hand if you need/would like assistance or guidance. For more information, please post a comment or email us at [masked]

A $20 deposit is due to hold your space at this event. Send deposit via Paypal to [masked]

I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed:
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun!

results.description:
Do you know your reefer rights? We do!

We are a cross-disciplinary coalition of radical artists, social media experts and grassroots organizers from the Occupy Wall Street community of NYC who have teamed up with drug policy experts from the Empire State Chapter of the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML) to become the militant wing of the marijuana legalization community of NYC. 

Governor Cuomo's Compassionate Care Act is a deadly insult. Progressive leaders in Albany like Senator Liz Krueger tells us that it will be at least another half decade before her Marijuana Regulation and Taxation Act will have a chance of passing the senate floor. We find this unacceptable.

Meet Up with us every Friday night for some free appetizers courtesy of Open Cannabis and free education on how to safely stay high and get by without getting busted while we organize and creatively fight for legal recreational cannabis in NYC.   

UPDATE!!!  We're joining forces with ACT UP NY!

ACT UP has had there own Buyer's club for years and they are working with Dana Beal to create a City Wide Cannabis Users Bill of Rights. Occupy Weed Street will officially be promoting and attending a Town Hall to protest the closure of the Chelsea STD clinic in spite of Governor 1%'s promise to end AIDS in NY by 2020.

ACT UP NY will also be joining the Occupy Wall Street Community for the four year anniversary of the Occupation of Zuccotti Park for a massive, "intersectional" Die-in protest with activists from a variety of causes and coalitions on September 17th. 

Join us this Friday to learn more about these exciting actions and to help everyone in our community stay high and safely get by while we continue to fight for a higher standard of living for us all!

results.description:
We are hosting a Salsa Dance Party at a discount for our members. This party includes a FREE class for people who have never danced salsa before and those who want to practice the basics. The party is normally $12 but just mention the name of this meetup group and you get in for $5 at any time during the party, guaranteed by me.

So come and learn salsa, dance all night, meet new people, and network. This is a nice and affordable way to spend a Friday night. Your total expenses is $5. Bring your friends too and have them mention the group name for a discount as well. This Social happens every Friday but the discount only applies for August the 21st. Come out and party with us!!

The Class starts at 9:30pm so try to get there earlier so that you don't miss a thing. Bring shoes that do not slip out when you dance and that do not have too much grip.

For pictures of past events and to stay update check the official facebook page and like it: https://www.facebook.com/ThreeMLaFama

Dress Code: Casual, come as you please.

Beverages: we have beverages for sale but you can bring your own as well

Age restriction: None

Address: 151 West 46 Street (between Broadway/7th Avenue and 6th Avenue), 11th floor, NYC 10036. 
After the class, the DJ will play great salsa music all night long.

results.description:
DESI FRIDAYS
"New York's Only Weekly Friday Night DesiParty"

:: L E X I C O N ::
226 East 54th St. NYC

Music By New York's Finest:
DJ HARSH - DJ AMIT

Percussive Dhol Beats By :
RAVI BINDRA

Doors Open at 10PM

COMPLIMENTARY ADMISSION TILL 11PM 
&
SPONSORED VODKA OPEN BAR 10-11PM

Desi Fridays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Friday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Friday Nights at Lexicon!!

Dress Code: Trendy & Chic

Absolutely No T-shirts or No sneakers.

21+ | ID Required

For Table Reservations : 908 - 425 - 1603

For Guestlist : DesiFridays.Com

Nearest Subway To Lexicon:
53rd St - Lex Ave (E,M,6)
59th St - Lex Ave (N,Q,R,4,5)

Karaoke & Anime Night at Action Burger.  We will sing Karaoke on the xbox 360 and watch some anime.  Please vote on which Anime you'll like to watch.  Anime show or movie will be announced in the comments each week.  These are the Anime shows we have:

Gurreen Lagann, Tokyo Ghoul, Rosario & Vampire, Parasite - the Maxim. SteinGate, Akame ga kill, manga nippon mukashkhi, sword art online, attack on titan, sailor moon, Dragon ball, Neon Evangelion.

* Please order food or drinks at this establishment, since it's a free event. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lckXS4XT-ys

Optional $30 open bar (per person) for 3 hours (11pm-2am) includes:

Open bar Drinks: Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).

Opius Bliss, the powerful new blues fusion group, will be bringing their American Roots oriented Jazz-Blues Fusion project to the 55 Bar on Friday August 21st.

"....with Michelle Walker's lush and smoky vocals, Opius Bliss is that perfect crossroad where Blues meets Jazz, Soul and Funk....supremely poised for stardom!"
- The Jazz Perspective

55 Bar is a prohibition era dive bar with incredible live Jazz, Funk & Blues nightly in Greenwich village, Since 1919. One of the few original Speakeasies left in New York City!

Modest cover charges & some major talents make this cozy downstairs music club a local stalwart.

$10 COVER!

results.description:
SHAOLIN AND WU TANG gets the midnite movie treatment in 35mm! Shaolin or Wu Tang? Which Kung Fu is greater? Join us at the Nitehawk and find out!

The breakdown:

Besides being the namesake film of The Wu-Tang Clan, Shaolin and Wu Tang is a lit piece of dynamite from Hong Kong legend Gordon Liu. The film follows a tense rivalry between two competing schools of kung-fu: Shaolin shadowboxers and Wu Tang swordsmen. Threatened by the level of skill in both schools, a local warlord vows to master both styles of fighting and then force the two schools to destroy one another. It’s Machiavellian twists with a kung-fu grip, bring the ruckus!


Meet upstairs @ 11:30pm. For info & tix visit:

 http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/series/august-midnite-kung-fu-theater/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oDd2O_n4jqc

This will be a 6 hour team race on August 22nd in Lime Rock CT. Teams will be made up of 2 to 6 people with a team cost of $1685 or $561 per person for a three man team. You can form your own teams or let me know if you need help finding others with whom to race.

This race will count toward the 2015 EK Points Championship.

ECKER & Wheel to Wheel Karting members again will receive a 10% credit toward a future race weekend with Endurance karting for any race fees paid.  A 40 minute practice and qualifying session will preceed the race which is included in the price.  Additional practice sessions will be available the afternoon before, Friday August 21st, from 3:00 to 5:00 PM.

Click on the hyper link in our sponsors area for more info and to register with Endurance Karting.  Make sure to also RSVP on this ECKER site as well as we will be validating the which teams are eligible for the 10% credit.  There are a number of classes within each race for a variety of skill levels and the karts are very equally prepared making for good racing.

results.description:
Today’s Percy Sutton Harlem 5K Run and NYC Walk to Salute the 50th Anniversary of the Civil Rights Act celebrated many things. As part of Harlem Week, a month of festivities and cultural events, it paid tribute to Harlem’s unique place in history and in NYC today. The 5K in particular honored Percy Sutton (1920–2009), the Manhattan Borough President in the 1960s and ’70s who championed the New York City Marathon as a “people’s event” through the five boroughs. And the NYC Walk to Salute the 50th Anniversary of the Civil Rights Act looked back a half-century to historic legislation enacted to protect the rights of all American citizens.
Reservation required http://www.nyrr.org/races-and-events/2014/nyc-walk-to-salute-the-50th-anniversary-of-the-civil-rights-act
results.name: NYC Walk To Salute The 50th Anniversary Of The Civil Rights Act

results.description:
Its time again for the yearly Manhattan Circumnavigation. This is a trip for experienced kayakers only! 32 Miles around the Island of Manhattan. 

PFD's, Spray skirts and Radios are required. This is an all day trip! Please plan gear, food and drinks accordingly.

You must register at the below link prior to the trip.  You will make payment after your registration is confirmed.  You must register and pay all fees PRIOR to the launch day. 

For those Launching from TUBBY HOOK:   Slow Group Launching 7:15 AM.  Everyone else Launching 8:45 AM from (TUBBY HOOK) Dyckman Street Beach on Hudson River, located just north of La Marina Restaurant at 348 Dyckman St., Inwood. 

For those Launching from ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS:

Directions: Use address for:
St Peter's College
333 Hudson Terrace
Englewood Cliffs, NJ 07632
--Upon reaching this address keep going straight an additional 1/2 mile until you can't go no further and make a RIGHT under the highway, stay to your right and follow the road down (it zigg-zags down the cliff) until you see the water and parking lot. Go all the way around the circle (basically a u turn) and straight past the parking lot until you see the marina, go throught the little entryway (next to the rock wall) PAST the marina all the way to the end. You will see a little stone house and a beach. Park along the grass, that's parks dept spots. Parking closer to the water is for the Marina!
--Englewood Cliffs Marina

(JM Englewood Marina LLC)

We need to be across the river in Tubby Hook by 7:45am to check in. *I am suggesting we launch by 7:15am SHARP (no later) from Englewood Cliffs. *

Its 1 mile across and we will have a heavy downriver current. We may have to paddle upriver a little way to offset the river pulling us down. It is up to you what time you arrive but as we may not be the only ones with this idea of launching across the river I'd think the earlier the better.

If you have questions please call my cell[masked]-8769. Elizabeth :)

Raindate: Sunday, August 23

Trip Fee: $25 non-refundable registration fee
ACA Insurance Required: Proof of membership or a $5 single day insurance.


FOR REGISTRATION: 


https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/ManhattanCirc2015

FOR MORE INFO: 
https://www.facebook.com/JerryAndStevesManhattanCirc?ref=hl
