results.description:
Manhattan- circumnavigation 2015
When: August 22, 2015 (Saturday)
Organizer(s): Gerry Blackstone cell[masked]
Rain Date:August 23 !

Yonkers Paddling and Rowing Club
2015 Manhattan Circumnavigation, August 22, 2015 (Rain date: August 23)

The 2015 Manhattan Circumnavigation will take place on Saturday, August 22, 2015 (Rain date: August 23). Launch at 9:45 AM from Dyckman Street Beach on Hudson River located just north of La Marina Restaurant at 348 Dyckman Street, Inwood.

Each summer since 2004 Steve Blumling and Jerry Blackstone have organized a paddle around Manhattan Island: An Annual Manhattan Circumnavigation. In recent years Margrethe Horlyck-Romanovsky and Phil Giller have joined this team. The trip has grown: From 17 paddlers in 2004 to 101 paddlers in 2014.

The Circumnavigation is open to all who qualify; club membership is not required; out-of-towners are welcomed. Kayakers can socialize, exercise, take pictures and explore during this 30 mile excursion.

Careful planning means that the current helps rather than opposes the paddlers. Safety of a large group is enhanced via general marine radio use; a safety boat escort and Coast Guard notification.

Yonkers Paddling and Rowing Club joins with other New York area paddling clubs to carry on this annual tradition. YPRC will be the lead sponsor and Sebago Canoe Club (SCC), Inwood Canoe Club (ICC) and the New York City Water Trail Association (NYCWTA) will co-sponsor. The American Canoe Association (ACA) will provide liability insurance.

Circumnavigation Float Plan/Schedule

7:30-9:00 AM Check-in; unload boat and gear and then park

Registration opens at 7:30am and closes at 9:00am

9:45 AM sharp! Launch; Paddle south on Hudson River

12:05-12:15 AM Cross Battery and head east and then north along east side of East River

2:30 PM Arrive at Hallets Cove for lunch

4:00 PM Launch from Hallets Cove; Cross East River to west bank;

Continue north on the Harlem River

6:45 PM Arrive at Swindler Cove/Peter Sharpe Boathouse

8:00 PM Return to Dyckman St beach

Please note:

We will return after darkness so you will need a white light on your kayak A group of slow and/or meditative kayakers will start out at 8:15 AM. They will need to arrive, unload and park an hour earlier than the main group.

3. A post-paddle Party will take place at the Inwood Canoe Club.

4. For Rain date (8/23) schedule: Add 1 hour to the Saturday Float Plan

Fee: $25 non-refundable registration fee

ACA Insurance Required: Proof of membership or a $5 single day insurance.

Join us on August 22, and be sure to also plan for rain date, August 23.

Please register here:

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/ManhattanCirc2015

Got questions or comments? Use this email address:

[masked].
results.name: Manhattan Circumnavigation by kayak

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

Reminder: Please post your pace and expected distance when RSVPing.

results.description:
I believe this is an HVH first:  Eagle Cave on Chimney Mountain

Explore one the Adirondacks largest cave systems, enjoy the sunset dinner from a 360 degree summit, and  optional camping on the top of Chimney Mountain. 


There is a separate meetup for backpacking on Friday and/or Saturday night(s).  Then you get on this event I'll need to know if you plan on camping either night.


The cave is not far from the summit of Chimney Mountain, on Indian Lake, in the ADK, which offers a 360 degree view.  It is a breakdown cave with 1850' of passages, and several large rooms.  There are two vertical drop-offs where a ladder is needed.  These are formerly The Ice Caves of Chimney Mountain.  Until recent years, there was year-round ice, so it is much colder than you imagine.  Bring some layers, so you don't freeze when we stop moving.  It is a common story that people wander in the mid-levels for hours, until their last battery is dead, and they wait in darkness for someone to happen upon them and show them the way out.  So the group will be small.  We will stay together.  And you will be asked to stay behind if you do not have the required gear.  That being said, the cave is very accessible with the proper gear, and though I don't recommend it, we'll probably see other groups down there with young children.

If backpacking, you will be carrying our camping gear and all the water we'll need for two days to the top of the mountain.


If you join this meetup you will be auto-waitlisted.  I will add those I know to be reliable.  Others I will message in the order you signed up, a few weeks before the event, to find out if you are still interested. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DETAILS


<a>Link to Parking Lot</a>:  The meetup location does not take you all the way to the parking lot!


Parking is $2, Per Day.  It is private property.  Please be quietly respectful, and put your fee in the box.

There is also a campsite near the summit, which we'll use Friday and Saturday Night, after the cave.  There are cabins at the trailhead, and leantos about 2 miles away from parking lot, at Puffer Pond.  (I might also be talked into camping the night before.)

The entire mountain is 1.2 miles / 1000', and the campsite is 0.25 / 120' short of that.

On this event you will be required to traverse 12' of rope ladder.

Order of Events:


• We'll carry our gear to the campsite.  (Less than a mile and a thousand feet.)  Bring a bear vault or bag with cord to store food. 

• Cave.

• Summit Sunset Dinner.


• Fire.

• Sleep.

• Pack-out to vehicles.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Cave


The cave entrance is tight horizontal scoot, about 10' long (it's the worst spot).  Can't turn head.  There are a few other tight places.  Not for the claustrophobic, but absolutely worth it.

After the (Shelter) entrance you are on a slanted face of rock where there is a rope to help get down to the floor of Eagle Hall.  The Hall is the biggest room, and can be rappelled down into from above, but you won't see any daylight.  At the far end of Eagle Hall there is a large fissure, perpendicular to the room, with a big vertical reach.  Here there is a 12' vertical drop-off where a ladder, or ropes, are required. (In Video)  Once at the bottom of the fissure, you'll see it opens up to the left, into a large room; this is the Bat Room.  The Bat Room connects to several passages and other rooms, there are several ways to accomplish the next steps.  After a little crouched travel, through some smaller passages, we'll reach a smaller room called the Jump-Down Room.  It is so named because you have to hop down to enter the room from both entrances on this level and it is difficult to get out without help. There is a large rock slab in the floor of the Jump-Down Room, that if you squeeze underneath, will lead down to a Triangle Room, with a high ceiling of breakdown.  There are three other exits to this room.  One of my friends disappeared out the far end, and reappeared in the ceiling above, reporting he was back in the Bat Room.  The passage to the right has never been explored by my groups, but according to maps, it should terminate before very long.  The passage to the left we will use to continue to the lower levels.  (In Video)  After about a hundred feet it opens into a small room, and there is a tighter passage that will wind downward.  There will be a few times you'll be taking your backpack off and dropping it down / pushing it in front of you.  At one point the way will not be obvious and you will feel a breeze, that is Not the way.  Eventually we will find our way to a smaller room with a fissure in one of the walls.  There is a 8 foot drop off where another ladder will be required.  (In Video)  After many visits, each time finding my way a little farther, this is as far as I've gotten.  Below you can see a sand floor, and I'm told the Ice Room (no longer year-round ice) and it's geocache are nearby.  We'll bring a webbing ladder and some rope to attempt completion.

We were young and stupid in the pictures... Helmets are non-negotiable, and you will be very thankful for them the first time you get tired of crouching and decide to stand up under a low ceiling.

Video Link: starting from the top of the second ladder location, clip exiting "passage to the left", and clip of someone going up first ladder:

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Stuff


Required Gear:

• Helmet. (Bike is fine, but have a plan on how to attach headlamp.)

• TWO light sources.

• Extra headlamp batteries.


• Warm clothing.


• Food / Water / Navigation / Muscles / Brains.

Highly Recommended:

• Gloves.

• Knee Pads.


Navigation Points:

• Parking: [masked], [masked]

• Trailhead: [masked], [masked] (Don't go to Puffer Pond!)


• Campsite: [masked], [masked]


• Summit: [masked], [masked]


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------


If you join this event you are responsible for yourself in all regards; including but not limited to the following.  You must be prepared to navigate yourself to your objectives and back to your vehicle.  Which means being familiar with the route prior to arrival, and bringing whatever navigation aids necessary.  You must know the mileage / elevation gain / terrain / planned pace, and be familiar with your ability to traverse them.  Unless the meetup is labeled as "Beginner", it is your responsibility to gauge your ability to keep up with the group and get to the vehicles within a time-frame as to not cause alarm; this may mean that you may not meet all of your objectives.  Your first objective is always to get back to the vehicles safely, and let the rest of the group get on with their trip, so keep track of the time, turn around if you need to, and try to let people know if you think you might disappear.  There will be no gear-check, but extra food, extra water, rain layers, headlamp, lighter, compass, and whistle, should be things that you are very rarely without.  Most people are unfamiliar with how quickly rain on a 90 degree day can become a survival situation, so it warrants saying that, if there is any chance of rain, you need a raincoat.  Hope for the best, plan for the worst.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. 

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Since August, 2011, Heights Meditation has been meeting on Saturday mornings and this meeting--because of its timing and format--is many meditators' favorite. 

The meeting is held every Saturday morning from 8:00 am until 9:00 am at Our Savior's Atonement Lutheran Church.  Like all Heights Meditation meetings, there is no charge.

All meetings begin with the moderator helping everyone to find a comfortable position and come into a relaxed yet focused state. Participants are briefly walked through their bodies while sitting quietly. A period of silent follows for 20-25 minutes. Whenever the mind wanders and seeks out a satisfaction outside of the self, the meditator steers consciousness back to her breath. In this way we practice mindfulness, focus, and discernment. The mind simplifies its activities as the body relaxes.

Meditation is easy to do but, like most simple things, mastery requires regular practice. Most anyone who practices the technique once a day will note its transformative effect on their life. Meditation makes you ready to be happy and content.

The sangha at Heights Meditation is a friendly and open-hearted group. Please come visit us if meditation seems attractive or necessary to you in your life or if you have had trouble establishing and keeping up your meditation practice as a lone agent!

If you have any questions, please contact us at [masked] or take a look at our main website at HeightsMeditation.com. Thank you!
results.name: Meditate Together Saturday Mornings

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

2nd Annual Search & Rescue Eco-Challenge

TEAM NAME: HOAGIES

Team code to join: HOAGIESNYC

 About This Race:

 Lost Tribe Expedition, Search and Rescue Adventure Race/Orienteering Challenge

August 22rd, 2015

New Paltz, NY

DETAILS:

Are you ready to take your adventure racing to the next level?  Think you have conquered the mountains and all its obstacles? We guarantee that you have never tried a race like this before!  The Lost Tribe Expeditions is hosting their 2nd Annual Search and Rescue Adventure Race/Orienteering Challenge.  This race will be a team race to collect as many control points with a map and some with compass. 

This year there is a two category option: 

1) 3HR ½ course Individual Competitive and

 2) The original 6HR Full course Team Competitive (I'm signed up for this one)

Team racers will begin early morning, Individual racers will be set out on the course 3hours after the team racers start so that all will finish together.  Courses will have overlap, but the 6hr team course will have a much larger course.  Teams consist of a minimum of 2 competitors and a maximum of 6.  Teams must complete the race with at least 2 of the original members to be scored.  Penalties against team and individual racer’s scores will be given for each minute late after the race cutoff time.  Racers and Teams later than 15min will be awarded completion but not scored.  1-3rd places will be awarded for both the 3HR Individual and 6HR Team categories

Event schedule and times to be announced:

Team 6hr Competitive:  will begin early am. Please note exact time is TBA

3hr Competitive Individual:  will begin mid-morning

 Parking:  will be available on site 

Location:  New Paltz, NY

 RULES:

1) This is a daytime event- the course will be open for 6 hours for teams and 3hours for the solo racers to collect as many points as possible. Teams and individuals may turn in their punchcard at any time for scoring, but to remain competitive teams must prepare to be on the course as long as possible and be able to quickly and strategically navigate to control points

2) For the 6hr Team Competitive:  Teams must have at least 2 members and no more than 6 total. Team members may drop from the race but the team must finish with at least 2 original members to be scored.

3) Control points are worth different amounts of points depending on their difficulty to navigate to. Compass will be required to get to some points, but there will be no off trail bushwhacking.

4) Teams may register each member individually by a captain creating the team name-team members can then choose to join open teams. Captains can also close teams so that a password is required to join that team.

5) Join In! This is a race designed for first time orienteers, avid racers, and just for fun adventurers! Can you and your team take home the 1st Place?!

6)  Competitors are responsible for their own gear-clothing, water, packs, and compass-(only 1 required per team)

7)  There will be an aide station at base and at a more remote section of your course with water and snacks.

 8)  NO GPS allowed-not really going to help you out there anyway!

9)  Entry fee includes also includes t-shirt, finisher's award, and prizes for the top 3 teams.

10)  All participants must checkout with base registration before leaving, otherwise we will send you your own search and rescue party

11)  For any questions or more info please contact Janet or mail to:[masked]

Event details and schedule time TBA

BASIC GEAR LIST:

3L Water Bladder Minimum

BackPack

Compass

Headlamp

Sturdy trail/running shoes

food

Emergency Kit

Bug spray

Sunblock 

Light jacket 

Disclaimer:

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.

<a href="http://www.active.com/high-falls-ny/adventure-racing/races/2nd-annual-lost-tribe-search-and-rescue-challenge-2015"></a>
results.name: 2nd Annual Lost Tribe Search and Rescue Orienteering Challenge

results.description:
Welcome to Thunder Mountain.


Located in Ringwood State Park, we are the closest shooting range to NYC, only 25 miles from the Tappan Zee Bridge. Thunder Mountain is a shotgun & clay target only shooting range that is open to the public. No experience or licensing required. Just show up and shoot!Thunder Mountain is open year round and is equipped with lighting for night shooting.


Depart Date: August 22nd Saturday; Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 8:30 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 9:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart around 2:30 PM after group lunch & expect to be back in NYC at 4:00 PM and Flushing at 4:45 PM

Cost: Early Birds $49 for first 8 spots or booked 10 days in advance; Regular $59 afterward. Tickets without transport will be added later ($15 less than those with transport).

Includes: 25 ammos, 25 targets, gun and instructor, & round trip luxury van transportation from midtown Manhattan.


Additional Cost: Bring $22 cash for additional 25 ammos & 25 targets..

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug2015clayshooting.eventbrite.com/You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.


What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, comfortable clothes, and attitude to learn.


Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:


* $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 7 days.


After the shooting, we will lunch together at a local restaurant.

Click the link to Thunder Mountain Skeet & Trap Shooting Center

results.description:
This 5K race honors the late Percy Sutton, who as Manhattan borough president in the 1970s championed the New York City Marathon as a five-borough event and remained a supporter of NYRR and running throughout his life; he passed away in 2009. The run celebrates historic Harlem and is part of HARLEM WEEK, one of the northeast area's largest cultural celebrations. For more information about HARLEM WEEK events and The Greater Harlem Chamber of Commerce, visit www.HarlemDiscover.com

For more information and to register for the 5K run go to: <a>http://www.nyrr.org/races-and-events/2015/percy-sutton-harlem-5k-run—celebrating-the-journey</a>;

For more information and to register for the walk go to:

http://www.nyrr.org/races-and-events/2015/percy-sutton-harlem-walk-celebrating-the-journey-full-steam-ahead

The walk will start at 8:30 a.m., the same time as the 5K run. Registered walkers will line up behind the runners on St. Nicholas Avenue south of West 134th Street. Please be in place for the walk no later than 8:15 a.m.

Select JKO Running as your team affiliation when registering.

Our team code is JKOR.

Good luck everyone!
results.how_to_find_us: TBB
results.name: Percy Sutton Harlem 5K Run or Walk

results.description:
Meet at: Meet at second parking lot, after park entrance. Restrooms and water fountains by park entrance. Park map.

Train: "From NYC by train: Metro North Hudson Line to the Tarrytown Station. From there you can take a short taxi ride from train station to the Preserve Office on Rt. 117 in Pleasantville." 


Cars: $6 /vehicle

What: Exploratory trail run/fast hike at Rockefeller State Park Preserve! Approx. 30 miles from NYC. Venue suggested by Lyndi. We will use maps to route-find! We have never been here before and look forward to the local adventure! Training trail run/fast hike on the Rocky races route.  ~5k, 10k, or 15k (do both) route options (or see maps below to add on or repeat). Start at parking lot, head out ~3/4 mi. (adding RT 1.5 mi to route options) on Sleepy Hollow trail to connect to 5k route. 

Lunch:  Optional lunch to follow at Blue Hill Cafe and Grain Bar, at Stone Barns Center,   
630 Bedford Rd, Pocantico Hills, New York. [masked] 9600. View map (to casual cafe not restaurant). It is adjacent to preserve and accessible by ~1.5-2 mi RT on trail from Rockefeller visitor center. (Otherwise, if you drive to center there's a $20pp admission fee.)

How:  Social. Partner / form pace groups as needed. (Co-host Rosanna will run/walk  (combo: run slowly and fast hike). Feel free to go ahead at your own pace -- just make sure you have your map as a guide! 


Highlights: carriage roads... wind through wetlands, woodlands, meadows, fields, streams, rivers, lakes, wood and stone bridges. 10k route passes by the "foundation of Rockwood Hall, once the 220 room home of William Rockefeller. Its Olmsted designed landscape with its panoramic view of the Hudson River..."

Rain or shine. Heavy rain cancels! Check comments section for updates.


Who:  Runners and brisk run-walkers. All paces are welcome!  Feel free to bring Guests, friends and family. Each person is expected to be prepared, self-sufficient, and able to find her way back to parking lot. Thanks.


REQUIREMENTS

BRING

1) Print and carry:  a) Race route maps** (link) .
b) Rockefeller State Park Preserve trail map (official).  
"Trail maps (with distance and grade descriptions) of all the carriage roads and equestrian permits are also available at the Preserve Office." 
* This is an exploratory run -- we will be using our maps to route-find.  
**  Courtesy of Rocky Races. Options: ~5k, 15k (both race routes) + ~1.5 mi. out-back on trail to race course. Feel free to add more miles by using map.

2)  Water and fuel  


3) Optional: change of clothes for lunch

Facilities:  Restrooms and water fountains at start

Weather:  Pleasantville, NY

Comments? Want to form a carpool? Post in comments section below.

Happy trails!

Photo credit:  via Friends of the Rockefeller State Park Preserve

____________

Note

This is not an organized training program. It is just a notice of runs some members are planning to do that is sent out to those who might want to join them. By choosing to join them, you agree to the legal disclaimer. Each person is solely responsible for himself, and for following trail etiquette<a href="http://www.trailrunner.com/news/trail_etiquette.htm"></a>, laws, park rules, and park safety guidelines. Thanks!


Photo credit:  via Visit Sleepy Hollow

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
For this Healthy Neighborhoods Mobile Market volunteer effort in Harlem, please also register through the City Harvest website. Use the following link to register:


https://cityharvestvolunteers.civicore.com/index.php?section=indGpRegistrations&action=profile_conditional&fwID=3639

The Registration process is as follows:

• Follow the Group Sign-up Link above and click "New User" to create a new volunteer profile and click "Submit" (repeat volunteers can simply log in)

• Read project details and click "Register" to confirm participation

• You will then receive a confirmation email and a reminder the day before the project


Only 10 volunteers are needed, so the first 10 to register will be confirmed, and the address of the volunteer location will be given after registration. All volunteers must be 18 years and older.

Description of Duties:

Volunteers will be stationed at 3-4 market tables, each supplied with thousands of pounds of fresh produce that they will help distribute to eligible market-goers. Sample produce items may include bananas, onions, cabbage, or potatoes. As the market-goers stop by each table, volunteers greet them-and then weigh and bag the produce. Note: All food is distributed free of charge.


That's it for now. If you have any questions, feel free to give me (Daniel) a call or text at [masked]. Thanks!

About City Harvest Healthy Neighborhoods Program


Nearly 1.4 million New Yorkers are facing hunger and for many people that City Harvest serves, healthy food is unavailable and unaffordable. In turn, diseases related to poor nutrition – including diabetes and heart disease – tend to be concentrated where demand for emergency food is greatest.

As a natural extension of the anti-hunger work we began more than 30 years ago, City Harvest developed Healthy Neighborhoods programs to respond to the need for emergency food, improve access to fruits and vegetables for residents in low-income communities and provide nutrition education that will inspire affordable, healthy meal choices. Through our Healthy Neighborhoods programs, City Harvest partners with residents, community organizations, afterschool programs, and local businesses. Together we work to achieve a long-term impact in the fight against hunger by engaging residents in healthy choices and enhancing the local food landscape. Building off our nutrition education classes which began in 2000, and our Mobile Markets which began in 2004, City Harvest has since expanded Healthy Neighborhoodsprograms to high-need communities across the five boroughs.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
NOTE: Attendee size limit is determined by how many tents and vehicles we bring.  So if you have a camping tent or vehicle, let us know in the comments below.


So, it has come to our attention that many of you want to not only hike but also Camp! Well we got news for you!

We have decided to choose an excellent location to not only hike to, but also camp! Come join us on our adventure as we go hike and camp for 2 days and 1 night at Round Valley Reservoir!

However before we can make reservations, we need to get a basic head count on how many of you CAN make it to a camping trip.

Requirements to come...
$25 per person
A backpack to hold your supplies.
At least one water bottle. (We will be near a water pump source, but you need at least one container to hold your water or other drinks in, or a cup.)
1 Toilet paper roll.
Any snacks that you like, food to be cooked over the camp fire.
1 blanket or sleeping bag

1 flash light


Utensils and food wares

The Round Valley Reservation offers a multitude of activities that we hope that you all attending will enjoy with us!
They have various nature trails that we can hike, so bring your most comfortable shoes. They even have a beach water front to enjoy the lake! So bring out those bathing suits, towels and sun block to have good time at the beach!

ATTENTION! 


This camping trip will require you to hold a FULL backpack and hike 3 to 6 miles TO the campsite and back! It is strongly suggested that you prepare for this long hike in advance.

To save on the time of travel and the costs we require that attending members to make their ways out to the Elizabeth Train Station (depicted on Google map). Make sure that you arrive No Later than 8AM! We are picking up people from the station to take everyone together to the Reservation.

If you can't get out the city that early, Rye has offered his home and bed for those wishing to sleep over the night before so they are able to attend. Please PM him in advance to make arrangements :)

More information can be found on their website at http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/round.html

TRAIN TIMES FOR TRAINS LEAVING PENN STATION AND GOING ELIZABETH...

Departs Penn Station at : 7:07AM and Arrvies in Elizabeth at 7:35AM

Departs Penn Station at: 7:14 AM and arrives in Elizaebeth at 7:42 AM

Car pool leaves around 8 AM, once everyone is picked up.

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

Region:

Harriman-Bear Mountain State Parks Region

County:RocklandState:NYMaps/BooksBuy Trail Map:

NEW!! Harriman-Bear Mountain Trails Map set

 Coordinates [masked],[masked] Driving Directions


Driving Directions

Take N.J. Route 17 north to the New York State Thruway and take the first exit, Exit 15A (Sloatsburg). Turn left at the bottom of the ramp onto N.Y. Route 17 north, and continue through the Village of Sloatsburg. Just past the village, turn right at the traffic light, following the sign for Harriman State Park. Cross an overpass over railroad tracks and continue along Seven Lakes Drive for 0.7 mile, passing under the Thruway overpass. Just before a sign indicates that you are entering Harriman State Park, turn left, then immediately turn right onto Johnsontown Road. Proceed for 1.2 miles to the end of the road and park at the cul-de-sac.

Train

Take Metro-North's Port Jervis Line to the Sloatsburg station. From the station, proceed north to Seven Lakes Drive, then turn right and follow driving directions above. There is a two-mile roadwalk from the station to the trailhead.

results.description:
Hi all! 

The Unity Roadshow is Coming to town! (An all day Unity event)! 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/unity-5-roadshow-nyc-registration-17973551376

Note: Unity is requiring a $20 registration fee - that you get it back if you show up. 

Event details and what to bring! 

Who: Anyone interested in learning how to use Unity’s rich, interactive content to create games or other projects. No development or scripting experience necessary! Although this workshop is geared toward beginners it is not suitable for kids or students younger than the age of 15. 

What: Learn to create a simple 3D FPS game using new features in Unity 5 taught by Unity's Evangelists Carl Callewaert and Mark Schoennagel. For those familiar with Unity you will benefit from learning best practices and the improved workflow in Unity 5's new UI and performance versus that of Unity 4.

What to bring:
Laptop & power cord. Mac users must be running on OS 10.8 or higher in order to use Unity 5. No monitors+computers allowed, only laptops are allowed.
Mouse -- unless you are extremely proficient using a track pad in the Unity editor you will need a mouse.
Your printed or mobile ticket for entry.

After this workshop you will be able to:
- CREATE a stunning animated day and night cycles with our new skybox structure.
- APPLY global illumination to create day and night effects with the new Enlighten features.
- USE the multiplatform First Person from the new Standard Assets to speed up the development cycle for multi-platform games.
- SETUP background audio and audio effects with the new Audio Mixer to trigger FPS sounds and duck audio.
- ARRANGE animation and scripts to control the firing of the gun with the new Mecanim features.
- PRODUCE a drone that follows the FPS with use of the improve NavMesh.
- INTEGRATE Everyplay to grow your community.
- SET UP non-intrusive advertsing in your game to drive revenue.
- RECOGNIZE the performance improvement of updated Physics, Instantiate API and Metal support.

Topics:
- Global Illumination
- Emissive materials
- Reflection Probes
- Audio Mixer
- Audio Snapshots
- Audio Ducking
- State Behavior scripts
- Enter and Exit State
- NavMesh
- WebGL
- Cloud Build
- Unity Ads

results.description:
LEADER: Karen Rose ([masked] or[masked])

RATING: B 4 B

To beat the heat we will meet early at 9AM and be out by noon. A loop using the Ridge Trail. Ok for beginners who can hike at a steady pace. Bring plenty of water and a snack. Meet at Ramapo Reservation Parking Lot on Rt. 202. Rain cancels. TC North Jersey map 115.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
results.name: AM Hike in Ramapo Reservation

Welcome back everyone! Come <a>play</a> some <a>beach volleyball</a> :) <a>Games</a> will be 4x4, rotating 3 teams, rally scoring to 15. 

Things to Know: Wondering what intermediate means? <a>Simply</a> put, you know what second ball means, and you can bump, set and spike.

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum . 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Nf4aM-hEzE

But this is how we think we play...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zmfd9etbXGE

We are a fun and friendly group. Any arguments over calls will be a redo.

• "Daria plays" are discouraged, but you get one freebie.

• Dancing between plays is allowed! 

• <a>Open</a> invites to drinks/ <a>lemonade</a> after the game :) Losers can drown their sorrows. 

• Sorry guys no refunds on day of cancellations!

• PLEASE LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT.  Two no shows = ban for a month. 

Where is it?

Pier 25 is located by the <a>West Side Highway</a> between North Moore St. and Harrision St. It's the first Pier north of <a>Battery</a> Park City.

http://pier25.com/location/

Closest <a>subways</a> are: Canal (A, C, E), Franklin St. (1), <a>Chambers</a> on the (A,C, 2,or 3)

This week we will be <a>playing</a> at an Intermediate <a>level</a>. Bumping and setting consistently, and no carrying allowed. If you are unsure if you are at the <a>required level</a>, please <a>message</a> Joe and he will inform you if you can <a>sign up</a>. If you do sign up and are not at that level, you will be asked to sit this one out and refunded your payment. We will have an <a>open play</a> <a>meet up</a> again next week. Thanks!

results.description:
We are going to meet up with Black People Who Love Being Black meetup group at AFROPUNK.

Described by the New York Times as “the most multicultural festival in the US,” the word AFROPUNK itself has become synonymous with open-minded, non-conforming and unconventional, placing the institution at the epicenter of urban culture inspired by alternative music.


Adamant in promoting diversity, the festival stage is always studded with music’s most distinct acts. Rivaling those of the past, 2013's line-up featured New Orleans bounce artist Big Freedia, NYC’s downtown darling Mykki Blanco and festival veteran Saul Williams. Other notables were, blues-infused up-and-comers Vintage Trouble from Los Angeles and The Heavy from the UK, and hardcore punk band Trash Talk from Sacramento. Even Brooklyn’s own metal prodigies Unlocking the Truth and 2013 Battle of the Bands winners Meatloaf Muzik hit the stage. This isn’t to mention hip-hop heavyweights Danny Brown, Jean Grae and Chuck D—just a few more who held it down.
Come to AFROPUNK 2015 this summer and sweat, mosh, and shout. Feel the music, free your mind, join the movement.
Go to www.afropunkfest.com for details.

General Admission - Weekend tickets are $75.00 plus $5.74 fee.

For tickets go to http://afropunkfest.com/general-admission-tickets/

results.description:
PADDLES UP!!  Intro to Dragon Boat Paddling.

Every Saturday we welcome new members to try out this new sport of Dragon Boating. No experience needed; coaching, training and all equipment supplied.

If this is your first time trying this sport out, the cost is free.  If you already attended our " Free intro to Dragon Boating" on May 2nd and May 9th, the cost is $10 per session.  However, the fee is applied to the season membership fee of $75 (mid season rate now) if you become a member of "Team Dragon".  Full time College or High School Student Fee is only $35.  Membership comes with unlimited Dragon Boat practices/training every Thursday 6-8pm, every Saturday 10-12am and all events hosted by the NJ Dragon Boat Club at Lake Parsippany.  The season runs from April to September.

To become a season member, go to njdragonboat.org and complete the online registration.

Come out and give it a try and get a great work out!

Expect to meet new friends and enjoy the beautiful Lake!  Please wear appropriate clothing (no jeans), footwear, and sunblock as you may get a little wet from paddling. Bring a bottle of water to rehydrate. 

Please park on the side streets and not in the boat house parking lot.

Please complete and bring this WAIVER (linked) for each individual.

In the event of inclement weather. Please check this site at 8:30am Saturday morning to see if the event is cancelled.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

Enjoy a fun and relaxing day out of the city! The Hudson Valley is America’s oldest wine making and grape-growing region.  Less than an hour and a half from New York City, a visit to to the Hudson Valley Wineries and wine trails offers hospitable winery tasting rooms, where you can often meet the owners and taste award-winning wines made from classic European varieties, regional hybrids and even delicious fruit wines. Join us for this fun day where you will enjoy a  spectacular Summer day out of the city, taste great wines and meet a fun group of NYSN members and friends.  If you have been to the Long Island wineries, this is a totally different experience!  Hudson Valley Wineries are less crowded, less commercialized and the scenery blows the Long Island Wineries away!

-You will start your day with the beautiful train ride on Metro North from Grand Central alongside the Hudson.  Along the way you will be treated to spectacular views of the Hudson Valley. You may also drive or meet the group there if you live north of the city. Please contact [masked] to make arrangements.

-Your guide will meet you in Poughkeepsie then bring you to several local wineries including one that the group will sit and eat lunch at.

-We will also have a chance to stop at a local farm stand for those who would like to bring home some fresh fruits and veggies.

$55 includes: Transportation from train to all wineries and attractions. (Wineries will likely include many of the following: El Paso, Nostrano, Benmarl, Stoutridge and Weed Farms ) Since everyone will not be drinking, winery fee's are not included. Some wineries are free and some charge $6-$8 for a flight of samples (5-6 samples at each depending on the winery).

What to bring:

-bag lunch

-Dress for the weather.  Casual and comfortable.

-a large backpack or bag if you wish to bring home vegetables from local farm stand or bottles of wine.  

Can you come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be on their own. 

What to expect: 7-14 fun and friendly people  

Who is the host:  Dave


What is not included? Lunch, train fare, winery fee's (budget $12- $18 if you plan to drink at more than 3 wineries) tips for the servers (optional)


$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

WHEN YOU HAVE DECIDED TO GO PLEASE CLICK THIS LINK FOR PAYMENT AND CONFIRMATION. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hudson-valley-wieries-tour-tickets-18213421835

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$


When we are finished, your guide will bring you to the Poughkeepsie train station for the relaxing ride home.

We go rain or shine. Estimated return time to Poughkeepsie train will be 5:50pm.

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

meetup.com: $144

results.name: Season 6

results.description:
Last month we took our bikes down to the shore and took a tour of giant seaside mansions, quaint Victorian architecture, and spent a little time playing in the surf. This visit we are going to experience the more natural side of the New Jersey seaside as we take a ride to the Sandy Hook National Seashore, part of the expansive Gateway Recreation Area.

The plan ...

We'll gather at the New Jersey Transit train station in Red Bank to begin our adventure. From here we cycle through the shore nabes of Red Bank, and tony Rumson and Middletown, home to some of the rich and famous including Jon Bon Jovi, John Stewart, and Bruce Springsteen. Pedal on we will, all the way to Sandy Hook. What will we find there? A 1,600 acre peninsula encompassing a seven-mile stretch of spectacular ocean and bay beaches, a cycling path that winds us through pristine holly forests and salt marshes, a defunct U.S army post -- Fort Hancock, abandoned gun batteries to explore, and a decommissioned Nike missile installation.

After exploring Sandy Hook on our bikes we'll park our rides and spend a few hours on the sand shooting the breeze and enjoying the weather. The last part of our ride will bring us back to Red Bank to depart for home.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for the title of hardest working person at meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is going to be a casually-paced ride (10 - 12 mph) of about 35 miles. Most of the ride will take place on flat terrain and on quiet roads but there will be parts with some automobile congestion. You must be comfortable riding in a group and in traffic. Helmets are strongly suggested.

• Leave your evening open as this event could take 4 hours or it could take 8 hours. Our time is limited only by the amount of fun the group is having.

• Dress for physical activity and time on the beach meaning bring your swimsuit, towel, and sunblock.

• Bring money for lunch or a snack.

• Make sure your bike is in good working order before the meetup -- bring a spare inner tube and a flat repair kit, and a lock to secure your cycle.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup.

• Check your email the evening before for last minute meetup updates as well as my mobile phone number which will be sent to those who RSVP.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

How to get there ...

Mass Transit
Yes, they allow bicycles on New Jersey Transit trains. You can catch the 8:07 AM NJT train #7225 from New York Penn Station and you will arrive in Red Bank at 9:26 AM. Train fare is $14.25 each way. NOTE: NJT rules indicate that only two bicycles are allowed per train car so be sure to arrive at Penn Station early enough to make sure you will be among the first in line to board the train in case there are other cyclists traveling. We'll meet on the corner of Monmouth Street and Bridge Avenue right outside the train station.

By Car
Put the address 175 Monmouth Street, Red Bank, NJ in your GPS to guide you. Parking at the station lots are free on the weekends. We'll meet on the corner of Monmouth Street and Bridge Avenue right outside the train station.

results.description:
********************************************************************************

I'm interrupting this posting with a special message for newbies!

I am genuinely excited by the number of hyper excited newbies who saw this paddle and have tried to sign on.  We usually try to do a better job of getting people to self select out of things that are above their abilities while encouraging them to challenge themselves.  In this case, we just assumed that you all would know that a 30 mile paddle that is going to take you 10 hours of reasonably hard work in a relatively harsh environment is way beyond where newbies should be aiming.  I am sorry for that but I remain excited because I think we have a bumper crop of great new members this year and I can't wait to spend time with you all.

In an email exchange Ralph and I were a little mind boggled as to how people could try to sign up for something like this without a fair amount of experience.  It's become apparent to me as I have corresponded with a few of you that you're certainly not without lots of merit.  You're bright, articulate individuals with a fair amount of athletic talent and a whole bunch of spirit who just don't know what something like this paddle entails.

So to help you all out here are a few parameters to help you figure out if this is right for you.  First of all you have to have your own boat.  There are no rentals available for the circumnavigation.  Your boat really must have two sealed bulkheads and be at least 14 feet long although some less wise than me would suggest even longer.   You need to be well versed in wet exits, as well as self and assisted rescues.  It shouldn't take you more than 90 seconds to get back in your boat if you fall out a few miles from shore.

You also need the time to train a little bit for something like this.  You should be doing a few paddles at least 20 miles in length in August before the event.  Paddling 20 miles with poor technique can be exhausting so you should probably have some good training on proper paddling technique.  There are more experienced paddlers that need to realize they need to do some additional distance training for this paddle too.

Fortunately, you can get everything you need right here at CKA but trying to put it all together by August is something that very few newbies will be able to do regardless of how much of a quick study they are or how great their athletic ability.  How about aiming for the circumnavigation next year.  Until then I will be removing you from this paddle if you don't do so yourself.

Chuck

**********************************************************************************

And now back to our regularly scheduled posting

While I generally only post CKA sponsored events in our regular Meetup schedule, this one seemed worthy of the greater amount of publicity things get by being posted here.


Last year 20+ members of CKA and other DC/VA/MD kayak clubs participated in this event and had a great time.  


DETAILS

The 2015 Manhattan Circumnavigation is sponsored by Yonkers Paddling and Rowing Club.  Co-sponsored by New York City Water Trail Association, Sebago Canoe Club and Inwood Canoe Club.  Insurance is provided by the American Canoe Association.


To signup for this event you must go to the Yonkers Paddling and Rowing Club website listed below.   The purpose of this Meetup is simply a way for those going to exchange information.   

http://www.yprc.org/special-events-circumnav.html


I have copied some of the information from this website and included it below.  The YPRC website, however, is the official source for information.


******************************************************************************

CIRCUMNAVIGATION FLOAT PLAN/SCHEDULE


7:15-8:00 AM.           Check-in; unload boat and gear and then park

                                      Registration opens at 7:30am and closes at 9:00am.

8;45 AM sharp!         Launch; Paddle south on Hudson River

11:35–12:20 AM.         Cross Battery and head east and then north along east side of East River

1:45 PM.                      Arrive at Hallets Cove for lunch

3:40 PM  .                   Launch from Hallets; Cross East River to west bank; 

                                      Head north on west side of Hell Gate

                                      Continue north on the the Harlem River

6:15 PM.                      Arrive at Swindler Cove/Peter Sharpe Boathouse

8:00 PM.                     Return to Dyckman St beach


REGISTRATION AND FEES

Fee: $25 non-refundable registration fee

ACA Insurance Required: Proof of membership or a $5 single day insurance.

If you would like to join us on August 22, (Be sure to also plan for rain date, August 23), 

Please register here:

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/ManhattanCirc2015

*******************************************************************************

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Greetings! 

STSANY is offering a FREE Singing and Acting Workshop to new members, members who have never attended a workshop, and to others who may wish to become members. STSANY membership is FREE.

Please reserve a spot on Saturday, August 22, from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m You will be given a 15-20 minutes sample workshop of what you can expect in regularly scheduled workshops. This is on a first come, first served basis, so specific times will be assigned to those signing up.

RSVP by Thursday, August 20 at 10:00 p.m.

* The workshop will include the following:

* Warm-up vocal exercises;

* Vocal evaluations to determine your level of study;

* Work on vocal technique designed for your individual voice, needs and experience;

* Coaching on vocal interpretation of songs and monologues;

* Advice on both vocal and dramatic repertoire appropriate for your training and experience.

SINGERS: Bring a song (complete sheet music with accompaniment) you  know well, if possible. If not, a song will be provided at the workshop.

ACTORS: Bring a 2-3 minute dramatic or comic monologue

NOTE: Additional free workshops will be given on Saturdays and week nights  TBA. Please check your emails for dates and times.

I look forward to working with you!


Cheers,

Anna

REVIEWS by STSANY members, fellow performers and audience members:


Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting manyhelpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___. P. Vincent, NYC actor, playwright and STSANY showcase performer.

It was a wonderful session w/a warm, knowledgeable & insightful instructor & in great company!____Allyson, Member, STSANY

Great session; good, helpful feedback; supportive.____Barbara, Member, STSANY

“ Fortunately for me I had the pleasure of Anna helping me with my singing technique which is something that I have always to do. I am looking forward to more meetups and meeting new people. You should all attend this meetup whether you are experienced or a beginner (like me). You will be able to discover something so unique and wonderful about yourself with this group. I can guarantee it! ”______Chels, Members, STSANY

An excellent meetup! Anna knows her stuff and helped me improve my performances; the other members/performers are talented and friendly and fun."____Glen, Member, STSANY

The MUSICALE was a wonderfully diverse program in an intimate setting. I found the preliminary workshops extremely helpful in putting a role I'd worked on (for longer than I'd like to say) into a historical, musical, and linguistic framework. I am eager to do more! Anna Bartos is knowledgeable about a broad range of musical styles and genres, acting and character development as well as singing. I would definitely like to perform in this type of event again. For me, once a season would be good (3-4 times a year)."____Rebecca, Member of STSANY (Musicale on 1/19/14)

Amazing event. Thank you, Anna for holding the musicale. I am also glad to meet new singers.___Saadat, Member of STSANY

What a delightful surprise! One often doesn't know what to expect of a showcase! Congratulations to Anna, a real pro, and an impressive mentor to a diverse array of talent. The 'meet-up' seems to be a real resource for both the performers and those of us in the audience.  Keep up the good work!____Mary Jay, Seasoned Senior Performer

It was a privilege to work with Anna Bartos on this 9/11 memorial concert. All of the performers were of high caliber and the audience rewarded our efforts with heartfelt applause. The program, with its mixture of styles and its emphasis on Americana, was just perfect for the anniversary date. I had a great time yesterday. It was a meaningful and well-organized concert.___ Moshe Knoll, Classical pianist.

Thank you so much for inviting us to perform on this wonderful 9/11 concert.___Rosa Hyewon, Classical Guitarist
