results.description:
We do our summer runs in the morning, because it works better for the school, and it's also cooler in the AMs. Plus, you get to start your day off right! :)

Welcome!


If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.
results.name: Summer mornings pickup games

results.description:
About our Meetup:

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com

Thrive in the Park was created by a group of friends with a common interest in fitness, clean food, and having a great time.

Our goal is to get in the best shape while in the company of great people.

Workout Details:

Bring a water bottle and your determination.

Our free workouts are created by certified fitness experts and are designed for everyone at any level of fitness. 


The work out will consist of body weight exercises (pushup, sit ups, squats, lunges, jumps, team competitions, partner exercises, etc).

If you have any questions, please send us a message and we'll get back to you.

Note: When you RSVP we will send you a telephone number you can call/text in case you have any trouble finding us.


What people are saying:

Achelle - #ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!

Devon - #ThriveInThePark is the best way to sweat out last night's wine.

History:

Thrive in the Park started in 2014. We believe in giving back to the community and in creating ripples of kindness, strength and gratitude. It is our hope that you too will go out into the world and create these ripples. 

We can't wait to see you!

Sponsored by: http://www.soRipe.com
results.how_to_find_us: We're located on the track in McCarren Park, close to the bocce ball courts
results.name: Thrive in the Park

results.description:
City Island is an oddity: a sleepy New England fishing village in the middle of the city, with antiques shops, a nautical museum, and some Victorian mansions.


The ride will begin in Manhattan and take us up the West Side Greenway into the Bronx and over to the Island.

Please come prepared: a helmet, bike lock, water and money for any food or drink. A spare inner tube, multi-tool, mini-pump and patch kit are also a very good idea.  Riders are expected to be able to handle their own basic maintenance issues and come with a bike capable of riding 45+ miles along uneven city street surfaces.


UPDATE (August 20th): The ride will take approximately 2 hours each way.  Please arrive on time.  We will leave at 10:15 sharp.
results.name: Ride to City Island

Run – 10:00 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

results.description:
Updated April 18th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien 
[masked]


MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's a great way to start your Saturday!
results.name: Saturday Ultimate @ 10AM - Morningside Park

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Wu style Tai Chi and The Alexander Technique In this class series, participants will learn the beginning of the Wu-Style Tai Chi form, a 108 sequence of movements. In addition, proper alignment within the form will be learned using the Alexander Technique. Tai Chi is an excellent way to practice Alexander Technique principles and to learn how to move with ease, relieve tension and to move more gracefully. Wu Style Tai Chi: is a Chinese martial arts system that uses slow, meditative, deliberate movements to learn a fighting system and healthy body posture. In particular, the Wu System uses a shorter stance to create more power and thrust from the practitioner’s base. Benefits include, pain relief, grace, joint health and stress-relief.

The yoga class will be led by Lauren:

http://www.westchesteryogini.com/

Saturday, July 18, 2015, 10:30 AM- 12:30 PM +. Captain Lawrence Brewery in Elmsford, New York.

Yoga and Beer. Join us for a morning yoga practice followed by beer packed with antioxidants that will compliment our asana practice.  We will practice in the brewery before it opens; followed up with beer samples.  (Last time we had about a half hour after the class to sample unlimited amounts of five or six different varieties of beer).  Since the yoga is inside the brewery, the event will be held, rain or shine.  Feel free to stay and make the day of it.  Hang out at the brewery, grab a bite to eat (pizza from Gleason’s of Peekskill Mobile Wood Fired Pizza Oven), and play bocce outside.  There is usually live music- starts at 2.

$25- includes yoga, tasting glass and featured beers.

Don't believe beer and yoga mix? Read.....

http://www.yogajournal.com/practice-section/beer-can-enhance-practice/

For information on Captain Lawrence, see:

http://www.captainlawrencebrewing.com/

Please bring your own yoga stuff- mat, block, towel, strap, water, etc. Sunscreen if you want to hang out outside afterwards.

Come out and enjoy a good stretch with your fellow hikers!

Liability Waiver: Yoga, like all physical activities, has inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes, yoga classes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. You agree to participate in this event completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. By joining this meetup, you acknowledge that you are physically able to participate.

Warning: This is a real Yoga class!!!

Remember: Do not drink and drive.

results.description:
Wu style Tai Chi and The Alexander Technique In this class series, participants will learn the beginning of the Wu-Style Tai Chi form, a 108 sequence of movements. In addition, proper alignment within the form will be learned using the Alexander Technique. Tai Chi is an excellent way to practice Alexander Technique principles and to learn how to move with ease, relieve tension and to move more gracefully. Wu Style Tai Chi: is a Chinese martial arts system that uses slow, meditative, deliberate movements to learn a fighting system and healthy body posture. In particular, the Wu System uses a shorter stance to create more power and thrust from the practitioner’s base. Benefits include, pain relief, grace, joint health and stress-relief.

Date: Aug 22 - 10:30am - 1hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Tickets: https://goo.gl/hXjjCx

results.description:
The "Back to School Picnic" is scheduled for Saturday August 22, 2015. 


It will be held at Orchard Beach at the North Picnic Area (1)  in the Bronx.  This is a catered picnic we hold for a group of children being raised by their grandparents.  A great lunch is served, games are played, they hold a raffle and we give every child a backpack filled with school supplies. The event usually starts at 11am and is over at 5pm.  We need volunteers to help at the event with food and plan some games for the children.

Directions to Orchard Beach

Pelham Bay Park, The Bronx

Note: Our Picnic site (OB-North Picnic Area (1) is at the far end of the Parking Lot (north side) near tennis courts/basketball area.  There is usually a $10 parking fee.

When traveling by car there are several ways to approach Orchard Beach.  Two major highways provide access from points north and south: The Hutchinson River Parkway and the Bruckner Expressway/New England Thruway combination.  Both highways have “Orchard Beach/City Island” exits from either direction (whether traveling south from Westchester or north from the southern Bronx and Manhattan) and once you’ve exited, just follow the signs to Orchard Beach.

The major cross-town route in the Bronx is Pelham Parkway.  Take it eastbound past the New England Thruway, over the Pelham Bridge, and make a right at the traffic light.  At the traffic circle, follow the signs to Orchard Beach.

From Manhattan/Brooklyn/Staten Island:

Take the FDR Drive north to the Willis Ave. Bridge exit.  Bear right and head toward the Bruckner Expressway.  Take the Bruckner/I-95 to the Orchard beach/City Island exit.  Go past the war memorial, over the Pelham Bridge, and make a right at the first traffic light onto City Island Road.  Go straight to the traffic circle and follow the signs to Orchard Beach.

From Queens/Long Island:

You can take the Triborough, Whitestone or Throgs Neck Bridge. 

From the Triborough, follow the signs for The Bronx and take the Bruckner Expressway/I-95 toward New England.  Get off at the Orchard Beach/City Island exit.  Go past the war memorial, over the Pelham Bridge, and make a right at the first traffic light onto City Island Road.  Go straight to the traffic circle and follow the signs to Orchard Beach.

From the Whitestone and Throgs Neck Bridges, follow the signs for the Bruckner Expressway/I-95 toward New England.  Get off at the Orchard Beach/City Island exit.  Go past the war memorial, over the Pelham Bridge, and make a right at the first traffic light onto City Island Road.  Go straight to the traffic circle and follow the signs to Orchard Beach.

Public Transportation:

Pelham Bay Park can be reached by the IRT No. 6 train to the last stop; the Bx5, Bx12 and Qbx1 buses to the train station; the Bx29 to the City Island Traffic Circle; or Westchester bus No. 45 to the Barlow-Pell Mansion Museum.  Orchard Beach is served by the Bx5 and Bx12 buses during the summer only.  During the Winter, take the Bx29 to the City Island Circle and walk to the beach.

results.description:
10-a-side. 2 teams, 60min+ game. Pls arrive early, to warm up and be ready to start at 10.45am.



ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.

If we have extra players we'll sub, or play 10v10. It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.


• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.


•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.


• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.


• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


The payment goes toward field permit & equipment. 

See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Do something GREAT this Summer!!


Take Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park
Free Group Lessons Saturdays, May 16th to October 17.


You will learn to read notes, chords and play songs you know and love.  You will have the opportunity to learn:


• Basic info about the guitar
• To read and play chords
• To read and play Rhythm
• Techniques for using the pick
• How play finger style.
• What you learn can be applied to Rock, Blues, Folk, Country,
   Jazz, Classical
• Plenty of new songs


Anyone can attend and you don't need to attend all the sessions.  A new breakthrough approach, allows each session to be complete even for people who have no experience playing the guitar.  Note: You must RSVP by 9pm on Friday the day before the meetup is scheduled. After 9p.m., registration will be closed.

And after the lesson (12:30 - 1:30p.m), hang out and network with  people, or go check out the sights in the Park!!

WHAT TO BRING:

• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Bring a portable music stand if you have one
• Also bring a 3-ring binder and a pencil


OPTIONAL DONATION: The lesson is FREE.  However, your voluntary $5 or  $10 donation help to offset the cost of making the free lessons available to you.



IN CASE OF RAIN:
If it rains, or there's a threat of rain (including if there is rain the night before or in the early morning and the ground is left soggy), we will have the meetup at an indoor location; check the meetup group announcements for update if looks like rain...the alternate location we will meet at is:

The Sony Public Atrium (pictured below)
550 Madison Avenue, NY, NY  10022
Enter on 55th Street, and look for the guitars gathered near the Starbucks to the right of the entrance.

Remember: please update your RSVP if your plans change and you are unable to make it.  If something changes the day of the meetup, please let me know by phone or text at[masked]-1031.

results.description:
**Please click here to RSVP through our website (MANDATORY)**

check our Facebook & Twitter for discount codes!

Unity3D is the most robust, popular, and adaptable game engine used by indie game developers today. This thorough full day workshop will focus on getting you up to speed and productive in Unity, and walk you through step by step on creating a full, simple game from scratch. 

We'll be going over:

• How to navigate and use Unity's GUI effectively

• Basics of practical C# scripting for games

• Fundamentals of a Unity Workflow

• Overview of fast prototyping in Unity

• Good programming structure in Unity3D

• Publishing the game online and on mobile/other platforms

• And the big one: Creating a game from complete scratch from start to finish

• Including: GameObject manipulation, collision events, 3D workflow, UI creation, exporting to web, and more! 

Timeline:

A week before the lesson, we will be taking a vote on what type of game we'll be creating. That is, if you really want us to make a Flappy Bird clone, or a simple turn-based strategy game, then we'll do it in front of you and teach you how! 

During the first half we will go through all of the Unity3D basics and get you up to speed and productive, and have you start on our game we'll be making from scratch. The second half will be a pre-prepared intensive, live coding session where we'll explain every step and the reasoning behind it. 

The last stretch of the workshop will be a freeform coding improvisation where students will make suggestions on what we should add to the game, which we'll implement in front of you! And lastly, we will hold extra hours after in which you are free to ask us any questions whatsoever!


## Students MUST BRING

A laptop with Unity installed. Go to the site and click download. We'll be using the free version of Unity. If you want to use Pro or the Pro trial, that's completely fine too.

Unity3D

## IT MUST BE INSTALLED. SERIOUSLY.

It's huge, don't expect to be able to download and install it here. If you don't have it,  you'll seriously be missing out, though you can still come. Open it at least once to make sure it works, too! I'll try to help anyone troubleshoot before class starts. 

Again,

OPEN IT AT LEAST ONCE. MAKE SURE IT WORKS!


<a href="http://www.sublimetext.com/"></a>
results.name: Unity3D "Build a Video Game" Workshop [Full Day]

Ever endeavoring to turn social cyclists into cycling commuters.


The goals are to ride bikes and hang out with friends that love riding bikes.

Feel free to contact us with any questions/concerns.


[masked]

CAUTION: If you like to ride ahead of the lead, please be sure to test the route for your own safety and for the safety of anyone that doesn't know the route and follows you. Feel free to ride ahead on bridges as we always mass up on the other side.

WHAT YOU NEED: NYC Department of Transportation Bicycle Laws, Rules & Regulations require: White headlight and red taillight must be used from dusk to dawn, bell or other audible signal (not whistle), working brakes, and reflective tires and/or other reflective devices.

Social Cycling NYC strongly recommends that every cyclist: Follows NYC DOT rules, EXPECTS all cyclists to accept personal responsibility for their own actions (or lack thereof), and recommends cyclists bring/use bikes, helmets, locks, IDs, money for food and drinks, and cycling friends!

HOW: WE ride AS traffic and NOT AGAINST it. We stop at red lights, yield the right of way and let cars pass as best we can. We don't block intersections. We are nice to both our fellow riders and the other traffic on the road. LISTEN TO the volunteers helping to lead the ride. They are some nice people and have your best interests in mind. If you have any questions about the rules, please check here: 

http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6

REMINDER: The goal is to create a safe environment for all riders, but we cannot control, nor do we desire to, every rider's behavior. We promote personal responsibility and all riders are responsible for themselves. If you choose to ride with us, then you accept the risks inherent in riding a bicycle with a large group of other people riding bicycles.

Social Cycling New York City is modeled after Social Cycling Austin.

https://www.facebook.com/socialcyclingaustin/info

results.description: Thanks for letting me join the Meetup! I'm the owner of Get Up and Ride, we're a boutique bike tour company based in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. We're organizing an awesome group ride from our shop in Williamsburg up to the Bronx Brewery on Saturday, August 22nd and I'd love to invite the members of your group to join us! Along the way we're stopping for lunch at this amazing BBQ joint in Long Island City and when we get to the Brewery we're doing a tour and getting a free beer. Beers after that are $1 off for all riders. Ideally we'd have 50 riders total, we've already booked 10. I thought it would be cool to bring a "team" of Urban Cyclists too! Check out the details on here and use the code urbancyclists for $10 off the ride: http://www.getupandride.com/822-local-group-bike-ride-bbq-and-the-bronx-brewery/ Thanks and see you on the bike lanes!

results.description:
This 2-Day comprehensive workshop explores visual storytelling with dynamic camera movement and skillful actor blocking.

Through extensive, daily hands-on exercises, participants will learn to visualize the scene, work with actors, strategize with storyboards, and evoke the essence of the script: DRAMA!

Participants will learn how to visualize, choose optimum camera positions, camera movement, and lens choices in relations with actor blocking.

Through this process, participants will understand how to convey tone, mood, and style, as well as give the film a distinct look that belongs to the director's unique vision.

WHEN: AUG 22-23 (Sat & Sun) 11am - 3pm
WHO: Narrative/Documentary Filmmakers
FEE: $425 Includes Studio and Equipment

LIMITED SEATING. Join us! Unleash Your Creativity!

Registration: http://www.solarnyc.com/workshops/directing/registration.html

Solar Film/Video Productions
632 Broadway, Ste. 304
New York, NY 10012

results.description:
AFROPUNK 2015 is returning to Brooklyn’s Commodore Barry Park, also known as City Park, for a weekend of live music, vibrant art and good vibes on August 22nd and 23rd. Described by the New York Times as “the most multicultural festival in the US,” the word AFROPUNK itself has become synonymous with open­minded, non­conforming and unconventional, placing the institution at the epicenter of urban culture inspired by alternative music. The AFROPUNK Festival is spearheaded by founder Matthew Morgan and partner Jocelyn Cooper.

Come to AFROPUNK 2015 this summer and sweat, mosh, and shout! Feel the music, express yourself, free your mind, join the movement. View AFROPUNK FEST 2013 and 2014

Tickets Cost $50 per day.

Musical Line-up for 8/22:

Grace Jones

Kelis

Danny Brown

Suicidal Tendencies

Lion Babe

Adia Victoria

Brenmar

Papi Juice

Please purchase your tickets here:

Join us for a special essential oils event with essential oils expert Joe Monkman who is visiting us from California. Joe will generously share his expertise with us.  You will want to take advantage of Joe's visit and receive cutting edge tips on how to integrate essential oils into your life.  Joe is a charismatic speaker;  you will be interested and engaged in this fun workshop. We will have plenty of time to have your questions answered.  Take away with a better understanding of essential oils, some essential oils samples, and the opportunity to win some gifts.

Are you looking for natural ways to enhance the well being of your body, mind, and spirit? Essential oils are Nature's pure, potent and powerful gifts that could:

- help to create a calmer inner and outer environment

- contribute to a restful night's sleep

- cleanse and soothe the skin, and improve appearance

- support the respiratory system

- help to ease the effects of occasional upset stomach

- take the edge off muscle soreness after exercise

Join us and learn (for FREE!) how to safely use essential oils, and about the ways in which they could lift your spirits, clear your mind, and give your body the boost it's been waiting for.

Enter our PRIZE DRAWING and you'll qualify to win an essential oil, a Wellness Consultation, and an NLP session. (These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent disease.) Call or text me when you arrive .  The workshop will be on the Terrace Outside  with a beautiful view of the Hudson River and in the Common area depending upon the weather. You must call or text when you arrive
   

RSVP: Debra at[masked]-0810 or [masked]

results.description:
Mobsters and gangsters were always a part of the new world, new New York. The first gangs formed at Five Points and the Lower East Side where the most poor and desperate people lived. The tour will tell you the extensive history from the early mafia such as the Bowery Boys and Dead Rabbit to the latest infamous Italian organized mafia Cosa Nostra, the one of the most famous “Lucky” Luciano and modern criminals. Rituals, the rules, the life style, pictures, the business crimes, restaurants and funeral homes, movie scenes – all these you will see in just about two hours with me on Saturday at 11 pm, Rain or Shine! 

This tour is a promo tour and does not require any payment but gratitude is appreciated.
results.how_to_find_us: Broadway/ Prince Street Prince Street, N or R Train Station by PRADA store, New York, NY
results.name: MAFIA TOUR ( PROMO TOUR)

results.description:
Howdy Benders!  Hope your week is productive.  Sending out a reminder about our session this Saturday same time same place. As the weather changes, it is the perfect opportunity to drag yourself out of bed and unto your yoga mat. When I first wake up and my bed feels so good I have trouble getting out of bed. But then I remember how stressful by my work week was and how imperative yoga is to detoxing my body and aligning my mind and spirit. We owe it to ourselves to feel great! Start investing in yourself by treating yourself right. I can't tell you how many times I didn't feel like doing yoga but how great I felt afterwards.

Think about how you have an opportunity to do yoga in a community setting, meet like-minded people, and support a local business at the same time!

I would like to continue the yoga and would love to see more benders. Please take advantage of this opportunity because it may not be here for long. See you on Saturday. Namaste.
results.name: Bronx Beer and Bend Yoga

results.description:
This is a walking tour in Central Harlem. Join us and explore the word-class visual vocabulary in the largest neighborhood of Manhattan. We will explore it's storied past, interesting present and visualize the promising future of this dynamic community.

Itinerary:

• The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture 
• Harlem Hospital Mural 
• Abyssinian Baptist Church 
• Strivers Row (architectural gem of the community) 
• Harlem's Walk of Fame 
• The Apollo Theater 
• And Much More 

We will explore these and more sights using the visual links immediate to the location.

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide (Juan J.) in front of the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture by 10:50am. Map here. Walk concludes at the Apollo Theater; map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!
results.how_to_find_us: Participants meet with the guide in front by the entrance of the meeting location.
results.name: The Art & Culture of Central Harlem

results.description:
We will bike to Liberty state park and back.


Ride is approximately 14 miles and is for both casual and intermediate riders.

Bring your bike and meet Mike outside Trinity where we will start and end the ride.

*Helmets are highly encouraged for safety

Note that if you are driving into Hoboken allow extra time to find parking.  There is a paid parking lot right next to Trinity (entrance on 3rd street).  You can also park at Lincoln Harbor just north of Hoboken and bike down along the waterfront (about 15 - 20 minutes depending on how fast you ride).

We go at a casual pace (7 - 10 MPH). There are a few areas where we need to ride on the street. Most of the ride is along the waterfront and in Liberty State Park.

-Mike
results.name: Bike Ride to Liberty State Park

results.description:
Inline skate lesson for Beginner to intermediate skaters.
We should have a great day to skate.
Cost of this class is: $25 per individual class, $45 for 2 classes or $60 for package of 3 classes; fees are collected before class begins, however we suggest that you to pay in advance, using Pay Pal option.

Please note that you must have complete set of protection gear and helmet to participate in class.

We meet in the Blades Skate Store, 156 West 72nd St., near Amsterdam Ave. at 1:00PM, if you need to rent skates and all of your gear. The class leaves for the lesson area by 1:15PM.  We will then walk to the practice area so we are geared up ready to skate by 1:30PM. As a reminder – helmets, wrist, knee and elbow guards are required. These can be rented at Blades if needed. Please have your gear by 1:15PM, so we can get started. If possible, rent the gear the day before the class as it is a 24 hour rental. Please check all of your gear before coming to class to see if it fits properly. Make sure the wheels, buckles, straps, snaps, laces and everything else is in good working order.

Please note that if it is raining or the lesson surface is wet, we will NOT have the class.
If you have any other questions, please post them on this page or text/call me at [masked]

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T. )

(Co-Leader- Jefferson)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
August 22, 2015 (11:30 am to 2pm)
Have you always wondered about spices, wanted to get a hang of Indian cooking essentials and generally get a lowdown of what’s what from an everyday perspective, well, you just might be in luck. In this second cooking class, award winning author and cooking teacher Rinku Bhattacharya can get you started in this cooking class where you learn, watch, cook and eat your own brunch. Rinku is a huge advocate of local and seasonal eating and particularly enjoys putting together healthy and beautiful menus that are simple and practical to make.
In this very interactive demonstration we shall explore some of the essentials of home style Indian cooking, you will about how the process of naturally fermenting dosa batter, discuss the essentials of using whole spices, a traditionally vegan and gluten free crepe that is popular breakfast fare all over Southern India. In this class, the featured dishes are,
• Dosa’s – Crispy Rice and Lentil Crepes, watch how to make your own dosa, and customize your dosa from an assortment of traditional and inspired toppings.
• Silver Dollar Oothapams – Miniature Gluten-free pancakes, topped with green or red chutney.
• Crisp Onion and Split Pea Fritters – Vadas
• South Indian Mixed Vegetable Medley
• Coconut and Almond Chutney
• Roasted Red Bell Pepper Chutney
• Classic Green Chutney

Cost of the Class and Meal is $35 for adults and $15 for children (under 12).
Rinku Bhattacharya is a Westchester based food writer, culinary instructor and home chef. She writes the blog, Spice Chronicles (www.spicechronicles.com) and the Journal News online column, Spices and Seasons. She is the author of two award winning cookbooks, The Bengali Five Spice Chronicles and Spices and Seasons, Simple, Sustainable Indian Flavors.

Tickets can be purchased at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/spices-and-seasons-dosa-day-brunch-and-cooking-demo-tickets-17848747083
results.name: Spices and Seasons - Dosa Day - Brunch and Cooking Demo

results.description:
Let’s take a free water taxi  from Lower Manhattan to Red Hook, Brooklyn--an isolated, fascinating neighborhood on the waterfront. (GET ON THE TAXI LINE NO LATER THAN 11:55). We can't all stand on line together. So we'll assemble on the IKEA dock when the taxi arrives, at 12:35. We’ll feast on the renowned Latin Food trucks (or bring your own lunch), starting shortly after 1 PM, and later at Steve’s Key Lime Pie. Then we'll tour "Black and White," the juried Waterfront Art Show (in a Civil-War-era warehouse), visit a quirky collection of memorabilia, see  two old NYC trolleys, get a close-up view of the statue of liberty, and bask in the waterfront vistas and park.


PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: About 3-4 miles.

FINISH AT: Around 5:30 PM. But you can leave earlier, of course.


COST: Inexpensive lunch at the food trucks (or bring your own); pay what you wish at the art show (but at least $2); and $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup’s recently increased organizer fee.

TRANSPORTATION: 2,3 (closest) or 4 train to Wall St. (No 1 or 5 to Wall St. this weekend). For more details, Consult hopstop.com,tripplanner.mta.info, or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate. Also check mta.info/weekender.html for weekend service changes

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient, no matter how how many are waiting. Long lists  people have totally disappeared because of cancellations, especially at the last minute. And if you're in the top 20 on the list (shown below the main list on the right side of this page on a computer only) at any time before the walk starts you can come.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk to east (river) end of Wall St., cross South St., then walk slightly south (right) to the pier. Get on line NO LATER THAN NOON for the Ikea/Red Hook water taxi. WE'LL MEET ON THE DOCK NEAR IKEA at around 12:45. Look for me in a red baseball cap.
results.name: Red Hook: Cruise, art, food, & much more!

results.description:
That's right, another Steve Brill tour!  This foraging tour, led by the Wildman himself, is going to take place in Prospect Park this time, and boasts lots of summer mushrooms, including bolete, chantarelle, and chicken mushrooms.  This is also the season for many different berries, including blackberries, elderberries, purple flowering raspberries, and black cherries which grow throughout the park.


As always, the price Steve charges is $20, but no one will ever be turned away due to lack of funds.  


Please note you MUST call Steve at (914)[masked] at least 24 hours in advance to book.


More information here:

http://www.wildmanstevebrill.com/Public%20Tour%20Stuff/Tour%20Announcements/Prospect.8.22.15.html


Directions here:

https://goo.gl/maps/ejya5

results.description:
Join me on one of my favorite trails at Harriman.

Length: 5.4 Miles

Time: 3 hours

Difficulty: Moderate

Dogs: Allowed. 

Attire: Hiking Boots, Wicking fabric clothing

Food: Water, snacks, water, water and water.

Driving Directions:


From the New York State Thruway, take Exit 15A (Sloatsburg). Turn north onto N.Y. Route 17 north, and continue through the Village of Sloatsburg. Just past the village, turn right at the traffic light, following the sign for Seven Lakes Drive/Harriman State Park. Cross an overpass over railroad tracks and continue along Seven Lakes Drive for 0.7 mile, passing under the Thruway. Just before reaching a large sign "Welcome to Harriman State Park," turn left at a sign for Johnsontown Road, immediately reaching a stop sign at a T-intersection. Turn right, proceed for 1.2 miles to the end of Johnsontown Road, and park at the cul-de-sac
results.name: Last Summer Hike at Harriman State Park

group.name: NJ Nomads.. Hiking, Nature Walks, Running

results.description:
Yoga day at the beach, what does that mean?

We will have a beautiful yoga day at the beach. Beach season is here! No need to spend hours commuting to the beaches in Long Island or New Jersey for a nice day at the shore, sleep in a bit and let's spend the day with swimming, yoga, picnic and playing in the sand of one of NYC's little known secrets -- Rockaway Beach Park 

We will kick back and relax here under the Summer sun, go for a swim, do yoga and just hang and converse or play a game or two. 

Where do we meet and where is this beach ?

Rockaway Park Beach, walking distance away from the last stop on A train. We will meet at the Flight 587 Memorial Park  and find a spot on the beach.

How can i get there ?

You can google "Rockaway Park Beach – 116 st" and drive there or you can take Brooklyn bound A (Rockaway Park Beach) train and get off at the Beach 116 st stop which is the last stop. There are two A trains. One is Far Rockaway another is Rockaway Park Beach. Although they go to the same direction, they split after Broad Channel stop. You can take S shuttle train to the 116th or Rockaway Park Beach after Broad channel . Once you got off at the last stop and leave the station, turn left and walk straight. You will see the park at the end.

This sounds so cool. What the day will be like ?

I know. There is no strict schedule but we will try to follow this:

-12.00 PM - We will meet in the park at 12.00 PM and go to the beach.

-12.30 PM – 30 mins of stretch and basic asanas 

-Free time – Sunbath, swimming, reading etc.

-2.30 PM – 30 mins of theoretical class, Questions and answers.

-3,00 PM Picnic/Lunch - You can always bring a sandwich, snack, fruits, nuts etc.

-Free time – beach games included :)

-5.45 PM Sunset Chakra Class


How does the picnic work? 

Just bring whatever you like and share with others. i.e. 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26163153/?success=uploaded#[masked] 

How are we not going to end up having so many of the same foods/snacks or let's say few people brought cake and juice, how are we going to make sure we will have disposable plates, forks, cups etc. for everyone ?

well, Just let us know through comment section what you are bringing (including plates, forks etc) so we will know what we are going to have and what we will need.

I didn't get it. can you give me an example ?

Ok, let's say you are bringing apricots and strawberries. You will just comment here as " I'm bringing apricots and strawberries" That's it.

Is there a grocery store or restaurant around?

Yes, there are many restaurants and grocery stores. There is actually one fruit market which is recently opened. They always have fresh fruits and nuts there.I love that place. They are all in walking distance to the beach.  

Is there a shower or bathroom ?

Yes, there is a shower and bathroom within walking distance.

I'm a beginner can i still join ? 

Definitely yes. We always have beginners in classes and in fact %40 of the people in classes are beginners. They are all encouraged to join the group and discover many benefits of yoga. Check out  group reviews

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/about/comments/?op=all 

I did yoga for a few times and it's been a while.Can i still catch up with the postures do you think?

Instructions during the classes are very clear and easy to follow. Even a small child can follow the class. No flexibility or strength needed.

What are the things we can do during those free times?

Anything you usually do at a beach. Sunbath, swimming, chatting, reading, being a kid again :) Group members are super positive and friendly people and you would feel very comfortable around them.

Can we also play games ?

Absolutely. We are open to all beach-games. Feel free to bring a frisbee or volleyball. Again, we are going to have a beautiful beach day. If you need to come late or leave early, that's OK, too.

Will there be a yoga mat for me ?

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket. Whatever is available.

Can I text or call the Organizer ?

Yes, if you have a question which is not answered in here, you can text or call him.

[masked] 

Oh, OK. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.

Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 

***Besides emergency situations, members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group. 

I'm not sure if i can make it on time. Can I come later ?

Short answer is NO.We encourage everyone to attend the classes which are free. All you need to do is come on time. 

What kind of yoga class this will be ?

It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. The Instructor will be helping with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Cool, What should I bring with me ?

Your towel, yoga mat, picnic goodies :) maybe a book and your positivity :)

I'll be there for sure!

Great, we will see you there

Peace and Love!
results.how_to_find_us: Enter the park from the 72nd street. Look at your left-hand side. Did you see the benches ? OK, we are there !
results.name: Meeting @ Rockaway Beach to enjoy a B/ful summer day w/ Yoga,Picnic and swimming

Whether or not you've seen Mamma Mia before, this will be your last chance to experience one the most beloved musicals of the past 14 years!

Join 50 members on Sat, Aug 22nd at our Pre-Mingle and then we will all sit together in the rear Mezz. Package for the tickets & pre-mingle is $87.50-$97.50 depending on how early you purchase ticket. This will sell out so get your tickets ASAP!

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mamma/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (12pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater. We will hand out the show tickets then.

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, closer to event date.  It will start at 12pm and we'll leave at 1:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 2pm show.  

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific.  This is a multi-Meetup event and all are welcome. 

In addition to RSVP'ing you must also purchase tickets in advance.  An RSVP alone will not hold your spot and this will sell out - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mamma/

Story

GIMME GIMME GIMME one last chance to see Mamma Mia! The sunny funny tale inspired by the music of ABBA will play its final Broadway performance on September 12, 2015. On the eve of her wedding, a daughter’s quest to discover the identity of her father brings back 3 men from her mother’s past. During the hit musical’s historic fourteen year run the Broadway blockbuster became an international phenomenon. See it again or for the first time.

Should I See It? What Is Mamma Mia! Like?

Calling all ABBA fans, this has your name written all over it. The songs are all culled from the Swedish super-group’s songbook, and this is one Broadway show where singing along (and dancing in the aisles) is encouraged.

AFROPUNK, the now world renowned Festival that just took place in Paris last month, has announced the lineup up for its flagship Festival, AFROPUNK Brooklyn to take place August 22nd & 23rd at Brooklyn's Commodore Barry Park. The 2015 AFROPUNK Festival, whose lineup includes Lenny Kravitz, Grace Jones, Ms. Lauryn Hill, Kelis, Danny Brown, Suicidal Tendencies, Thundercat, GoldLink, Kaytranada, Curtis Harding and many more (full lineup below) will be the biggest undertaking of the critically acclaimed festival yet. Preemptively AFROPUNK will be throwing their first annual AFROPUNK FANCY DRESS BALL w/ special guest Grace Jones and more TBD to raise funds for their AFROPUNK Global Initiative: an alliance dedicated to moving the needle of progress closer to a holistic, democratic and enlightened representation of people of color within all facets of society with the goal to create unique programming that encourages diversity in media. The AFROPUNK FANCY DRESS BALL will take place August 21st at Commodore Barry Park. 

 
Due to the amount of attendees (60,000 last year) the festival has now moved to an affordable paid and earned ticket to the event to assure entry. AFROPUNK has been long known as an advocate of cultural change as well as change directly in the Brooklyn community. The earned ticket program, called AFROPUNK Army, expounds upon that giving fans the chance to volunteer for the earned ticket. AFROPUNK will work closely with partners to provide low barrier volunteer activities and projects for youth to complete in exchange for a ticket to the festival. The volunteer program will create awareness for organizations in need, provide access to an engaged pool of valuable resources and help deliver a sustainable impact to communities. Sample projects include landscaping (beautification, painting), packing supplies (meal prep, serving) and advocacy via social promotion. PAID / EARNED TICKETS AVAILABLE FROM WEDNESDAY JUNE 3RD. CLICK HERE TO GET YOUR TICKET. 
AFROPUNKFEST.COM

results.description:
Fajing literally means to ‘emit strength’. In this school, we focus in ‘whole-body strength emission’. In the area of self-defense, this is of major importance, since one wants to hit an attacker as hard and as fast as possible, and incapacitate him/her within three seconds, in order to save our lives; while maintaining internal equanimity and control. However, most people respond to life-threatening attacks with only the strength of their arms or legs, as opposed to the strength of their whole bodies. Therefore, our responses to attacks are significantly hampered, and our chances of survival get drastically minimized.

Erle Montaigue’s Fajing Quan System of Fighting and Healing is the system of training created by Erle Montaigue, the founder of the World Taiji Boxing Association, in order to develop true whole-body fajing, the method of movement through which we engage every joint in our body in perfect coordination in an explosive manner, delivering full-body strikes into our opponent (think about how much you weigh, as opposed to only the weight of your arm or your leg). 

This desired response is achieved by accessing our reptilian brain, which has been sophisticated through one’s training, and operate from it in the event of an attack, as opposed to operate from our cerebral cortex/human brain, which processes information slower by trying to understand logically what is happening. Our reptilian brain acts only on reflexes, which are deeply engrained in our nervous system; so our training will come out just as another learnt reflex, like muscle memory.

This ability to fajing will be useful also in the healing arts, by emitting healing energy through the same method, in a soft, non-explosive way (Yin-Yang uses of a core, unique principle).

The training consist on:

- 8 Wudang Stepping Methods

- 12 Wudang Hand Weapons Drills

- Small San Sau Self-Defense Form

- One Hand Yang Style Martial Push Hands

- Entering Methods

- Internal and External Mechanics for Striking/Kicking/Punching

- Wudang Knife Forms

- Introduction to Dim Mak

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

Described by the New York Times as “the most multicultural festival in the US,” the word AFROPUNK itself has become synonymous with open-minded, non-conforming and unconventional, placing the institution at the epicenter of urban culture inspired by alternative music. 

This is an all day event that caters to those who enjoy good music, diverse atmospheres and an incredible culture of creativity and talent.


Come to AFROPUNK 2015 this summer and sweat, mosh, and shout. Feel the music, free your mind, join the movement.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Dear Sisters:

We cordially invite you to join us for a combined gathering with the women of Apostolic Temple of Jesus Christ for a day of fun, food and fellowship.  Location will be disclosed when you convey your intention to participate .

Come out and get to know like and Christ-minded women in an informal setting, where we can be ourselves and drop the masks.

We have teams to help coordinate the event and hope you are willing to participate in as well as attend.  Let me know what team you would like to contribute to and make a donation, using the "Chip In" button:

• Green Team (Grill) - Charcoal, fuel, and foil. Captain Greta Lytle.

• Yellow Team (Meat) - Franks, Burgers, Chicken. Captain Jo Anne Meekins (me).

• Brown Team (Starches) - Rice, salad, corn, baked beans, mac and cheese. Captain Diana.

• Blue Team - Condiments (ketchup/mustard/barbeque sauce/seasonings), snacks, fruit, desserts. Captain Elaine Harbin.

• Red Team - Soda, Juice, Ice, Water. Captain Loretta Ferguson-Callender.

• Purple Team - Table cloths, napkins, cups, plates. Captain Marcia Fraser.

• Orange (Clean Up) - Captain Cheryl Watkins.

RSVP for the meetup and let me know what team you are interested in contributing to with your donation.  Hope to hear from you soon.

Be blessed,

Jo Anne Meekins

results.description:
"Join us for SculptureCenter's LIC Block Party, presented with the Purves Street Block Association, featuring art and entertainment for all ages. The Block Party features artist-led activities, live music and performances, an artists' market showcasing affordable and functional art and objects, and family-friendly food options from local restaurants."

Admission is free and the event will take place rain or shine!

The program will include:

Performances by: Pill, Dog Man & Friends, and Broken Time (Matt Freedman & Tim Spelios)

Installation and performance by: Eli Keszler

DJ Sets by: Nelleke

Activity booths by: Amanda Jasnowski, Aidan Koch, LAZY MOM, Nathaniel de Large, Sofia Leiby, Aria McManus & Raine Trainor, Lele Saveri, Shabd, Vanity Projects, and Where

Artists' Market featuring: Desert Island Books, Ryan Foerster, Leigh Forsstrom, Hand Job Gallery, Massif Central, Mixed Media, Social Malpractice, Sophy Naess, and Peradam

Check out video from 2013's LIC Block Party: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z5ERLcd-0bU

Block Party Partners:

American Folk Art Museum, Long Island City Cultural Alliance, Long Island City Partnership, Long Island City YMCA, Materials for the Arts, Museum of the Moving Image, Noguchi Museum, Queens Tourism Council, Sculpture Space NYC, Smiling Hogshead Ranch, Socrates Sculpture Park, and Volunteer Lawyers for the Arts

Sponsors:

Modern Spaces, Rockrose, jetBlue, Brause Realty, car2go, The Mill, Silvercup Properties, NYC Council Majority Leader Jimmy van Bramer, Fine Art Frameworks, M. Wells, The Yoga Room, and Douglas Elliman

Media Partners:

BORO, The Queens Courier, and Brooklyn Magazine

Vendors:

Bartleby & Sage, Danny Brown, Doughnut Plant, Hibino LIC, Manducatis Rustica, The Mill, and Rockaway Brewing Co.

results.description:
Introduction to Figure Drawing for Beginners. 

This four-hour session is designed to introduce beginners (and people who consider themselves beginners) to figure drawing. 

The Session: This session will cover the basic theories artists use to draw the human figure. 

We will work from a live model for the entire session. 

Introduction: Drawing the human form. The first 30 minutes of the session will discuss our approach to treating the human figure as a series of simple shapes to more easily represent it. We will briefly discuss foreshortening and why it is important for students to go on to study anatomy. (This is not an anatomy class.)

Gesture Drawing: What is it and why do we practice it? Students will approach gesture drawing two different ways.  This is an essential part of figure drawing. 

Figure Drawing: What is our goal when drawing 5-10 minute poses? There is a great deal we can do in these medium length poses if only we set ourselves goals in the time allotted. We will practice two different approaches to these poses. 

Long Poses: We will practice at least two long poses. Many of us run out of things to draw in longer poses. We grow bored and stop “thinking” while we work. With a proper focus we will find that these long poses will actually feel very brief to us. 

Critique: Drawings of willing students will be shown and discussed. We will talk about successes and what we can do to improve in the future. The goal of a good critique is not to criticize students but to point out future goals where they can improve. This allows them to leave the session eager to continue drawing and improving.

Material requirements: 16x20 inch sketch or drawing pad (not newsprint.) 2H, HB and 4B pencils. An eraser and pencil sharpener. 


If you have any questions please feel free to email me at simon (at) drawingnewyork.com

Instructor: Simon Levenson teaches drawing at The National Arts Club, The Museum of the City of New York and The Morgan Library and Museum. He is the founder of Drawing New York.

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/WzdyuvEOSEOdO67t1Yq8

Prepare for an hour of insane fun, team building, and laughter - as you are about to be trapped in a room with a zombie! 

You and 11 other adventurers will enter a room and are challenged to find the clues, solve the riddles, and get the key to escape.... or get eaten. As the clock dwindles down from 60 to 0, every 5 minutes the hungry zombie's chain gets longer and the danger zone increases. Communication and team work are musts if you want to make it out alive. More dates and times available!

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/DpdRpV

*Please remember that this Meetup listing may not have accurate information - the people who have RSVPed may not have PAID/SIGNED UP. Please check attached link for the most accurate details!

results.description:
FREE ZUMBA CLASSES. JOIN THE PARTY WE HAVE FUN!!!

Zumba involves dance and aerobic elements. Zumba's choreography incorporates hip-hop, soca, samba, salsa, merengue, mambo, martial arts, and some Bollywood and belly dance moves. Squats and lunges are also included. Approximately 14 million people take weekly Zumba classes in over 141,000 locations across more than 151 countries.

results.description:
Let's go be Scottish for a day!  I've thought about going to this the past few years, so I put it on the calendar now!  Its the same place I believe where they hold the "Rise of the Jack-O-Lanterns".  Its supposed to be fun and interesting!


2015 - 55th Annual Scottish Festival and Games  Date:Saturday, August 22nd, 2015. 8:00am-5:00pm.  Location:  Old Westbury Gardens, Old Westbury NY.  Competitions:Highland Games and Children's Games  Antique AutosAdmission:Adults: $17.00Seniors: $15.00Children (Ages 6 - 17) and O.W. Members: $8.00Children (Ages Under 6): Free

It has lots of drumming, bagpipe music, dancing, singing, Celtic vendors and Scottish food, Scottish highland games.

Here's a link to get a feel for what its all about:  http://www.newsday.com/entertainment/long-island-events/festivals/scottish-games-1.3917454

Kilts are mandatory for men : o )    (just kidding!)
results.how_to_find_us: We'll email how to meet up a few days before the event.
results.name: Scottish Games & Festival

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

******YOU WILL BE ABLE TO SIGN UP FOR THIS WONDERFUL MEETUP,
BEGINNING ON MONDAY, AUGUST 10, 2015 @ 8 PM. ********

I scheduled a luncheon for

Saturday, August 22, 2015 @ 1 PM,

on the patio at:

Gourmet Grill

6334 Avenue N

Brooklyn, NY 11234

(between E. 63rd & E. 64th St.)

[masked]

Here's their website, if you would like to check out their

extensive menu:

http://www.gourmetgrillbrooklyn.com/#anchor-u8315

As usual, I have arranged for each person to receive an individual check.  Please bring CASH ONLY.  Please add on a 20% tip to your bill, for the server.  The management is being very kind to do this for us.

 ******IN ADDITION, UPON ARRIVAL, THERE WILL BE A $2.00 MEETUP FEE FOR THIS EVENT. ******

• Following the luncheon, we will go next door to FROZEN PLANET. 

 It's a wonderful frozen yogurt place owned by the same owner of

GOURMET GRILL.

Here's FROZEN PLANET'S website:

http://frozenplanetyogurt.com/menu.html

                  **********Please be considerate of others. **********

If you need to change your RSVP from a YES to a NO, for any reason, please

do so by Wednesday, August 19, 2015 @ 10 AM.  If you are on the waiting list

and realize that you cannot attend please change to a NO by August 19th

 @ 10 AM, as well.

RSVP's will close on:

Friday, August 21, 2015 @ 10 AM, in order to give an exact head count to the restaurant.

I am looking forward to having an exciting afternoon with lovely women who make this group so inviting.  It's the people in the group, who continue to join in and have fun with new friends and old friends.  By the end of the day, we are all friends.

All the best,

Michele

group.name: Mature Women Friends of Brooklyn and New York

results.description:
Meet to share and discuss SF and fantasy writing, books, films, TV shows, the writing process, the publishing industry, etc. with other SF and fantasy writers (both published and unpublished).  We usually have a long and lively discussion, followed by critiques of stories or chapters (if any) that members brought along.  We don't always have stories to critique, but we usually enjoy having hours worth of discussion, so let us know near the beginning of the Meetup if you brought something to have critiqued so we don't use up all our time talking -- time flies when you're having fun!

Further details or topics for this Meetup may be announced later.

As usual, you can bring a chapter or short story for the group to critique, but it's by no means necessary.  If you do bring your MS, try to bring enough paper copies for everyone attending to have one, and if you want us to write comments or corrections on it, then please double-space it.  We usually ask the author to read it aloud (unless you're shy), which is very helpful, because you'd be surprised how often you don't catch your own mistakes until you read your manuscript aloud for the first time! 

For the manuscript (MS) critiques, length is not set in stone, but suggested length is 1500 words, maximum length 3000 words. In pages (Times 12 point font), 1500 words is just under five pages double spaced, or about three pages single-spaced (but you should always double-space to allow room for people to write comments or corrections!)  Don't worry if your MS is longer than 1500 words, you can still bring it, but please keep it under 3,000 words.

For more guidelines on critiques, see http://www.meetup.com/The-Woodbridge-Science-Fiction-Fantasy-Writers-Meetup/about/
results.name: Share and discuss writing with other SF and fantasy writers

$20, Members $15

OK to register at door—please arrive 10 mins. early.

results.description:
Aloha, Pony Friends! 


Join Bronies-NYC for a lei'd back summer party at our Upper West Side Party Space. The surf's up, the fruit punch is icy cold and the dance floor is hotter than a volcano. The rave is back, DJs Kezz and Serif are going to get your hooves movin and your flip flops flippin. 

We've got TWO animated feature films on the big screen for you this month; LILO & STITCH and Equestria Girls: RAINBOW ROCKS! 

PONYCAKES CAFÈ will entertain us with TWO luau dance performances, and have prepared a fantastic menu including such treats as Hawaiian bread sandwiches, pineapple upside-down cake cupcakes, and Pony Five-O punch!


The Inverted Shadow coming on down to show a taste of what he has in store for everyone in the near future with not just one, but TWO videos! Hope you are ready cause they will leave you with chills!

♪ ♪ ♪ Musical Island Interlude by INDIE NOTES 

And more and more and more and more...

* Free flower LEIS for everypony!

* GameCube Corner

* Vendors selling MLP collectibles and merchandise

* Special guest  Jazmin "JAZ KITTY" Ruotolo from Angel Trip Studios 

* BNYC Art Guild Table with sketching, drawing, painting! Come over & dabble. 

* COSTUME CONTEST - come attired in your coolest Surfer, Island Luau, or Tacky Tourist getup for a chance to win something from MIDTOWN COMICS or one of of our other sponsors

Looking forward to making our last monthly bash of the hot season summer blast with you all! Aloha and Mahalo- 

The Schedule

1:00 - Doors Open Video Games, Tables games and Drawing area open!
3:00 - Equestria Girls - Rainbow Rocks
4:30 - pm Ponycakes Performs! then A teaser from Inverted Shadow
4:45 - Lilo & Stitch
6:30 - Indie Notes
7:00 - Pizza!
7:45 - Costume Contest Results
8:00 - DJ Kezz
9:30 - DJ Serif

results.description:
At one time or another our favorite shows have decided they should scare our pants off.  What were those times for you?

Choose Your Own Marathon: the Scariest SciFi Fantasy TV Episodes!


For four and a half years I've had the best time organizing events and hanging out with all of you.  This August, I'll be hosting my final event: a marathon of the scariest science fiction and fantasy episodes, co-hosted with The New York Horror Movie Group. 


Each group gets to pick three of the episodes they think are the best/scariest. It's Doctor Who vs. Torchwood! Firefly vs. Star Trek! For more check out io9's master list and the top three from each group will be revealed at the event!


* We have lots of crossover members in both groups.  Please feel free to vote in both polls (each group gets a different set to choose from) but please only RSVP on one event page. Thanks!


Schedule:

1pm - Arrive, socialize, drink/eat

2pm - Third place episodes

more food/more drinks

4pm - Second place episodes

more food/more drinks

6pm - Winners revealed!

Where to Find Us: We will be meeting in the back room of the bar.

Food and Drinks: Full bar and menu available. Drink specials!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the back!
results.name: Choose Your Own Marathon: The Scariest SciFi Fantasy TV Episodes!

FREE BRAKING LESSONS and Safety Techniques!
Learn to use your heel brake.
We operate a Stopping Clinic on West 72nd Street, where Skate Patrollers give free lessons on how to use the heel brake. If you are a first timer who has never skated before, please sign up with Skate School, where we will help you to learn how to skate.
The clinic is located just inside the West 72nd Street entrance to the Park.
Come and learn to Stop or improve your technique!
