results.description:
MORE DATES AVAILABLE!

Tickets: https://goo.gl/KdwPdr 
20% Off Code: HISUMMER

Taking influences from European and African roots, the movement is a synthesis of Contemporary dance, Hip hop culture and African rhythms. 

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/BYMUIQ9zTd6MKyD13qfG

Each class will be explored in depth to enhance and develop the dancers fluidity, physical awareness and a true passion to perform. 

The work will allow you to improve creative and technical skills with live rhythmic music ; performing exuberant floorwork through to vigorous dance movements, ensuring that the dancers leave a signature spatial mark.

Poundo’s class encourages dancers to approach the movement with technique, fluidity, risk, weight, respiration and athleticism. While pushing the boundaries of the body, we’ll be using the technique paths to explore new ways to move through emotional and organic intentions. 

Tickets: https://goo.gl/KdwPdr 
20% Off Code: HISUMMER

results.description:
REFER TO THIS MAP - - - IT SHOWS PIER 26, WEST STREET, VESTRY STREET, LAIGHT STREET and NORTH MOORE STREET - - - Then read WHERE, below.

From the official website of 18th Annual Pier 26 Blues & BBQ Festival at


http://www.hudsonriverpark.org/events/blues-bbq-2015

WHEN: Saturday, August 22nd, 2 P.M. till 9 P.M, Rain or shine

WHERE: We’ll meet at 1 P.M. at the little "postage stamp-size park" about 2 blocks north of Pier 26, roughly adjacent to Laight and Vestry Streets, a little oasis between the bicycle path and the pier walking path. I encourage you to come early and look for me - April. I'll be wearing my new neon ORANGE headband with the ribbons and orange flower. My plan is to congregate here for a half-hour, till 1:30 P.M., and then proceed down to Pier 26. I also want to remind everyone to bring sunscreen, a floppy hat and a pair of soft memory foam ear plugs....just in case you need them. The event itself is scheduled to run from 2 P.M. to 9 P.M. If you come late, look for us between the 4th and 8th rows on the right side of the stage.


Via                                                                                                                  • A, C, E Subways to Canal Street;                                                          •1 Subway to Franklin Street or Chambers Street;                                or,                                                                                                                • The M20 or M22 Bus.

COST: Free!

PROHIBITED:
•Blankets
•Coolers
•Chairs or lawn furniture of any kind
•Beach/golf umbrellas
•Smoking
•Pets of any kind
•Bikes, skateboards, scooters and personal motorized vehicles
•Outside food & beverage, including alcoholic
•Illegal substances
•Glass containers of any kind
•Weapons of any kind
•Framed or large backpacks
•Fireworks and explosives
•Laser pointers
•Instruments
•Video equipment
•Video recording
•Tripods
•Professional still camera equipment (detachable lenses, tripods, big zooms, or commercial use rigs)
•Audio recording equipment
•Unauthorized/unlicensed vendors


RESTROOMS: Pier 25 Comfort Station

ACCESSIBLE TO PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES: Yes

Music by Otis Taylor Band, Naomi Shelton & The Gospel Queens, Jarekus Singleton, Vaneese Thomas, The Ed Palermo Big Band featuring Jimmy Vivino and Felix Cabrera (performing the music of Paul Butterfield and Mike Bloomfield),
results.name: The 18th Annual "BLUES AND BBQ FESTIVAL" ON PIER 26: TRIBECA

LINE-UP!

Badfish - Sublime Tribute performing SUBLIME's 40oz of Freedom album in its entirety + the hits!

Bob Marley Tribute Performed By CannabisCupBand CCB

GARY Nesta PINE - former lead singer of The Wailers

Top Shotta Band featuring Screechy Dan

New Breed Brass Band

DJ JAH CULTURE

ADMISSION:

Ticket #1 General Admission Ticket: $40

or

Ticket #2 General Admission Ticket + Seafood Platter*: $60 for a Seafood Platter that includes (1) Lobster Roll, (A Dozen) Steamed Clams, Fried Calamari )

*(Seafood Platter will be available for $30 during event while supplies last.) Additional Food items will be offered.

DIRECTIONS

The Governors Island ferry departs from the Battery Maritime Building located at 10 South Street, adjacent to the Staten Island Ferry in Lower Manhattan. The ferry terminal is accessible as follows:

By Subway / 1 to South Ferry station / 4, 5 to Bowling Green station / R to Whitehall St. station

There is a $2 fee to ride the Ferry. There will be continuous and frequent ferry service throughout the day.

EVENT IS RAIN OR SHINE

And if summer rain showers pop up, you stay dry under the open air tent and enjoy a pint and some funk!

Ages 5 & Under Admitted Free!

These items are prohibited on the ferry and at the show:
Bicycles, scooters, skateboards, etc. (the ferry is walk-on only); outside food and beverages; bottles, cans, camelbaks, canteens, flasks, bota bags, etc.; weapons of any kind; illegal substances; chairs; pets; beach umbrellas

results.description:
Party at Blythedale Children's Hospital!


**Volunteers must be healthy and over the age 18.**

Come join us in a fun filled day spreading cheer and smiles to the kids at Blythdale Children's Hospital. 

Our favorite nurses are organizing a big bash complete with a DJ, and they have asked us to provide the craft/art activity!  This event is very popular for volunteers and patients alike.  =)  We will hang out with the kids and help them complete a craft project during the party.

Please note - There is an $5 charge for this event to cover the cost of the craft supplies.  Any leftover funds will be donated to the hospital.  If you cancel your rsvp, there are no refunds, and your funds will be allocated to the party or to the hospital.

There is no waitlist due to payment being required, but if the event is full and you wish to be waitlisted please email your full name and cell phone number to me at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: we will meet in the hospital front lobby
results.name: Party at Blythedale Children's Hospital

results.description:
At first The Emigrants appears simply to document the lives of four Jewish émigrés in the twentieth century. But gradually, as Sebald's precise, almost dreamlike prose begins to draw their stories, the four narrations merge into one overwhelming evocation of exile and loss.

Written with a bone-dry sense of humour and a fascination with the oddness of existence The Emigrants is highly original in its heady mix of fact, memory and fiction and photographs.

Organizer's note--It seems that the Michael Hulse translation is highly praised.
results.name: August -- The Emigrants by W.G. Sebald

MORE DATES AVAILABLE!

20% Off Code: HISUMMER

Taking influences from European and African roots, the movement is a synthesis of Contemporary dance, Hip hop culture and African rhythms. 

https://d3mjyf8rb023qs.cloudfront.net/api/file/BYMUIQ9zTd6MKyD13qfG

Each class will be explored in depth to enhance and develop the dancers fluidity, physical awareness and a true passion to perform. 

The work will allow you to improve creative and technical skills with live rhythmic music ; performing exuberant floorwork through to vigorous dance movements, ensuring that the dancers leave a signature spatial mark.

Poundo’s class encourages dancers to approach the movement with technique, fluidity, risk, weight, respiration and athleticism. While pushing the boundaries of the body, we’ll be using the technique paths to explore new ways to move through emotional and organic intentions.

results.description:
As subscribers of Dragon+ know, "DDEX3-1 Harried In Hillsfar" -- the first adventure in the new D&D Expeditions season -- has been released online. Around an oppressive city near the borders of Cormanthor forest, a recent string of strange occurrences has the locals on edge. Is this machinations by the tyrants of Hillsfar, or something more? (Hint: IT'S SOMETHING MORE.) A series of mini-adventures for 1st-2nd level characters (pre-gens available). Come check it out!

EDIT 1: We're using 5th edition; you can download the basic rules (with 4 classes, 4 races) for free at http://bit.ly/1EzS3Uq -- new/returning players welcome, everything provided (but bring dice if you got 'em).


EDIT 2: Although there is no cover charge for this event, because the venue is a bar/restaurant, players will be expected to order food or drink in exchange for using the space. Please check out their brunch menu and adjust your RSVP accordingly.

We love Pier 2!!! I know it's a bit of a late notice but the weather reports kept changing!!! :( We hope you can make it out for some games! Come one come all :p

Directions: The handball courts are located on Pier #2 within Brooklyn Bridge Park. The entrance to Brooklyn Bridge Park and the path to Pier #2 is located at the corner of Old Fulton St & Furman St in Brooklyn. If you have issues finding it, post a message to the RSVP page and I will quickly respond! 

Nearest trains are the A or C train to High St or F Train to York St or 2 or 3 Train to Clark St. Regardless of the train you take, make your way to Old Fulton St and Furman St. Please check the MTA website if you using mass transit and check if there are any delays or re-routes to plan accordingly.

Weather Notice: Weather channel predicts sunshine. Will top out at 87 degrees but since we will be in the shade, we will be fine! Really hoping it won't rain like last week, but at least we have cover!

Cancellation Notice: Meetup cancellations only happen upon bad weather or low RSVP count.

results.description:
Just like STASS and other nerf wars, more people are interested in flinging foam darts that go Pew! Nerf is fun.

WHAT TO BRING? 


~A foam dart blaster. Anything firing non dangerous nerf darts, buzzbee or boomco (that means no death darts or NBPs stupid exploding darts) 

~darts, nerf darts buzzbee darts, boomco and off brand china darts,  

~Water, it's gonna be hot and water is important          

 ~Eye protection. Always better safe than sorry            

 ~Good attitude. Nobody likes a dick                                        

 -You may bring a meelee weapon, they're fun and satisfying to get a kill with (must be COVERED in foam, no plastic exposed, I'm not dealing with boo boos) 


GAMEMODES
Being a 1337 MLG dank nurf guy from the NIC (we make homemade nurf blasters and they go pew) we will play simple gamemodes. They will be
~3/15
~Capture the flag
~VIP
~Freeze tag
~Maybe experimental types too

- Nerfhaven list of modes, comment if any mode you want to try. (http://nerfhaven.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=22230)

RULES
~Don't be a dick. Damnit that's annoying
~Blaster hits will count! It's just easier to count, so don't bring a shield because it will count as a part of you.
~No realistic paintjobs. We've heard the stories, lets not make this one of those
~Call your hits! It's no fun to argue about that, read the NH thread, just call it, it's not that serious.
~Don't shoot/point your blasters at anyone not playing, that sets a bad reputation and can get us kicked out
~Don't say your going on the thread if you're not, you know who you are, it gets annoying expecting more people than who will show up

Conclusion
~Try to bring more people, the more the merrier but hopefully mature people.
~This war will have some plus ones from me, but your friends are cool too!
~You can show up any time, try to be earlier but hey, if life prevails than it's alright
~Comment if you need a blaster and/or darts, I have a surplus but they will need to be returned.
~My number is[masked] call me if you have any questions or if you're a girl who wants to go out with me ;)
results.name: Nerfing in Central park!

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.

results.description:
AgeHa is a Clinton neighborhood modern sushi house offering both traditional and innovative sushi and Asian cuisine.in a stylish, brick interior.  The menu features creative rolls, Japanese dishes and cocktails . The restaurant serves a prix-fix lunch meal Monday through Sunday.  The lunch specials include miso soup and salad with any two rolls or any three rolls. Or you can order General Tso's Chicken, or Shrimp, Udon or Soba noodles, Teriyaki, Tempura, various fried rice, and sesame dishes, Also on the lunch special is a Bento Box...served with shumai, california roll, salad, soup and rice, and a choice of;

Beef Negimaki, Kastu Chicken or pork, Tempura Chicken or shrimp    Teriyaki Chicken, salmon, shrimp or tofu, and Sushi or Sashimi

The menu:

http://agehasushi.com/order-online/

A $2.00 fee is requested to help defray the organizer dues payments, which have recently gone up again - cash before the event will be appreciated. 


They will be giving us separate checks for a change.
results.name: Lunch Special at AgeHa Japanese Restaurant

results.description:
Register for this event on our website

Tournament Details:

Age Restrictions: 18+

Paying in cash at the venue is accepted.

Arrive be 1:45 PM. 

Event will end by approximately 5:00pm

World Cup Format - Group stage round robin, followed by knock out stages.

Games will be played on eight Xbox Ones. 

Refund must be requested three days prior to event.

Tournament Structure:

Group Stage: Round Robin format. Groups will consist of four to five teams. Each player plays everyone in their group once. 

Top two or three teams in each group move on to the knock out stage.    Win - 3 Points     Tie - 1 Point      Loss - 0 Points


Group Stage Tie Breakers:     

 1. Goal Differential      2. Head to Head      3. Goals Scored      4. Goals Against      

 Knock Out Stage: 

Single Elimination Tournament. The #1 seeds in each group will play the #2 seeds from another group.

Games will be played on eight Xbox Ones. If you have a PS4 controller w/ a converter you are welcome to bring it.

Refunds must be requested three days prior to event.


Prizes:

1st Place - $100

2nd Place - $40

3rd Place - $20


Rules:

Any International Team can be used.

6 Minute Halves.

Legendary Difficulty.

Injuries Off.

Knock Out Stages: Overtime is played in classic. PKs at the end of extra time will not count. Games that are tied after 120 minutes will be restarted and played under a golden goal stipulation.
results.name: Players' Lounge World Cup VI | International Teams

Manhattan's Greenway encouraging the return of locals in New York to enjoy, music, food and the outdoors. Come out and lounge with us and take in the performances of various famous.

The same organizations will be participating this  year.


Venues such as Dinosaur BBQ & Delancy. The food was great last time

results.description:
Hudson River Park’s Blues BBQ Festival returns for the 16th season! Pairing America’s best Blues and Roots musicians with New York City’s best BBQ restaurants, makes for an unforgettable summer day on the Hudson River! Rain or Shine.

More info

A great way to really enjoy the summer is of course BBQ ... and here the top restaurants open their stand for you to enjoy. Add to that some good Blues and you are all set.

Even though the posting on the official website, indicates Free, from past experience we would expect a cost at each vendor to taste the food; come with cash (not your $100 bill), it's the fastest and most efficient way to pay at those events!

We will meet at 1:30pm at the corner of West Street and N Moore Street (plot 88 N Moore street then go toward river) to walk to the pier when it opens at 2pm.

Access: http://www.hudsonriverpark.org/explore-the-park/locations/pier-26

Event may be followed by a walk in the Hudson park depending on people's interest.

Recommended donation to cover organization costs of the meetup is $5 (cash at outing or through Chase QuickPay in advance).
results.name: Blues BBQ at Pier 26 in Tribeca

If you are new to Buddhism and meditation and wish to find out what it is all about, please come to our free open house. Experience a relaxing guided breathing meditation, short talk on meditation and Buddhism as well as an introduction to the Fall programs. You are welcome to browse our book store and ask questions. Saturday August 22nd 2:00 – 3:00 pm. Everyone is welcome!

Stay on for our Annual Summer Party (3:00 – 5:00pm), enjoy delicious food refreshments and more. You’ll have an opportunity to meet our extended community. Please invite your family and friends for a sweet afternoon at our beautiful center, an Oasis of Peace in the middle of New Jersey.
No cost; bring a vegetarian dish to share for the party

results.description:
The tour of the past and the present includes New York City and national landmarks designed by world famous architects, and focuses on both post modern and modern skyscrapers along with Art Deco gems and Historically styled club houses, mansions, and skyscrapers. The tour also features a landmark church with a Byzantine dome, a Moorish and Islamic styled synagogue and beautiful mosaics along with a modern Rockefeller guest house designed by Philip Johnson. Add to this diverse mix an early example of deconstructionism in a small Manhattan skyscraper and at the other end of the spectrum a landmark wood frame French Second Empire home built in 1866 and we can appreciate the melange featured in this tour.

Date: Aug 22 - 2pm - 3hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

results.description:
This class is for those with some experience of the basics to the advanced student, however, all are welcome. We meet in NYC every Saturday from 2:00 to 3:30 in room 4G on the 4th floor. This class is taught by Tarik Sultan and focuses of Egyptian Baladi and Raks Sharki style. You will learn what are the characteristics that distinguishes traditional Egyptian style from the American and fusion styles of Belly Dance

The focus is on learning how to develop your unique personality, musicality and interpritation so that you will be able to improvise naturally to any song, or be able to choreograph your own dance. Graceful coordination of the hands and arms, propper posture, execution of propper technique and musical response are all emphasized in a supportive and non judgemental atmosphere that allows you to develop your skills at your own pace. Whether you are just looking for exercise or to take your skills to the next level, this class is for you. You will see a dramatic improvements in your abilities gauranteed! I will show you how to bring out the best that is within you!

Each class session is $25 or you cand sign up for class packages

5 classes for $95

For more details call Tarik at[masked]

Email: [masked]

To find out more about Tarik visit www.tariksultan.net
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in room 4G

results.description:
American identical twins working in London, stop motion animators Stephen and Timothy Quay (born 1947 in Norristown, Pennsylvania) find their inspiration in Eastern European literature and classical music and art, their work distinguished by its dark humor and an uncanny feeling for color and texture. Masters of miniaturization, they turn their tiny sets into unforgettable worlds suggestive of long-repressed childhood dreams. These three Quay masterworks, selected by director Christopher Nolan, feature broken pencils and lead shavings in IN ABSENTIA (2000; “a dazzling piece of work” – The Guardian); a porcelain doll’s explorations of a dreamer’s imagination in THE COMB (1991; “most beautiful of their recent films” – The New Yorker); and the nightmarish netherworld of STREET OF CROCODILES (1986; “their crowning achievement” – Film Comment); and for the first time ever, QUAY (2015), Nolan’s new short film revealing the inner workings of the Brothers’ studio. Approx. 70 mins. All four films in 35mm.
http://filmforum.org/film/quay-brothers-on-35mm-film
--------------------------------
If you have not seen a film by the Quay brothers (or their retrospective in MoMA a couple years ago) then you have been deprived. While they are both Americans, they have lived in Europe long enough to make this foreign-worthy for this meetup. The following is a music video they did in the 80s. I think it is representative of their work. If you like this and want more then come on by Saturday. I hope to see you there.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G9uf25wHhs0

The film starts at 2:20. I will be outside around 2:00. It is a cash only theater.

As always, we will get a drink and deconstruct the movie after.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be outside in a green t-shirt.  See you soon
results.name: THE QUAY BROTHERS – ON 35MM

results.description:
Free and open to the public. This event repeats every Saturday between 2/14/2015 and 2/27/2016 from 2:00 p.m. to 3:30 p.m.

The Union Square Partnership teamed with Big Onion Walking Tours to create a free, 90-minute walking tour Saturdays entitled Union Square: Crossroads of New York. The tour departs from the Abraham Lincoln Statue located along the 16th Street transverse. With the help of a tour guide, you will explore the social and political history of the Union Square neighborhood through discussions of the people, history, architecture, and forces that have shaped this community. Reservations are not required for individuals, but are required for groups.
results.how_to_find_us: There is no organizer for this - just show up and enjoy the tour.
results.name: Union Square: Crossroads of New York Walking Tour

results.description:
Blues is still alive! New Jam on Sat at Parkside Lounge

jonathankalb

"Hey everybody, lets have some fun you only live once and when you're dead you're done so let the good times roll"

I will be running a new Blues Jam starting Nov 22,  from 2-5 pm and every Saturday afterwards at The Parkside Lounge at 317 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002 
(tel (212)[masked])

Musicians bring your axes, and listeners just bring your ears as well as the rest of you, we should have a blast 
Pa and Backline provided by Funkadelic studios. Really nice room I played there a few weeks ago , good vibes, owner staff etc. It is a blues jam but this includes, soul, blues, country and jazz mixed into a hot Memphis Stew. Entrance is free but if your wallet permits get a drink or two to let the owner know that we want to keep these jams alive and well. 

Hope to see and hear you keeping the blues alive!

Jonathan Kalb

results.description:
This Event:


The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Saturday Python Study Group

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
Dakbokkeumtang or Daktoritang is a spicy braised chicken Korean cuisine stir-fried in a condiment of gochujang, soy sauce, green onions and garlic, boiled until a bit of soup is left. This chicken cuisine is considered as a type of Korean jorim (Korean cooking term: Simmering ingredient with sauce). The minor ingredients are potatoes, onions and carrots.

'Dakbokkeumtang is assumed to be originated from Pyongyang and northwestern area in Korea during the 20th century, and a lot of controversies aroused with its name. People also call it with other names such as 'Dakgamjatang,' 'Dakmaeuntang,' or 'Dakgamjajorim.'

***Please Note***

- Please give me your email address and phone number right after RSVP then we will send you an invoice from Paypal when we can pay through that.

-Class will start at 3pm so please don't be late. please be in the class at least 10minutes early.
results.name: Let's Cook 닭볶음탕(Dakbokkeumtang; Spicy Braised Chicken)

results.description:
The Museum of Modern Art and MoMA PS1 announce Andrés Jaque / Office for Political Innovation as the winner of the annual Young Architects Program (YAP) in New York. Now in its 16th edition, the Young Architects Program at MoMA and MoMA PS1 has been committed to offering emerging architectural talent the opportunity to design and present innovative projects, challenging each year’s winners to develop creative designs for a temporary, outdoor installation at MoMA PS1 that provides shade, seating, and water.


Tickets $18 in advance, $20 day-of

MoMA PS1 presents Warm Up 2015, beginning June 27 and taking place every Saturday this summer through September 5. A New York summer staple now in its 18th year, MoMA PS1’s highly anticipated Warm Up outdoor music series continues its tradition of introducing audiences to the best in experimental live music, sound, and DJs—both local and international—across a range of genres. Warm Up supports both established and emerging artists by creating a platform that allows for experimentation and providing a space for collaboration, new material, and side projects.

The series is programmed by a curatorial committee selected by the museum to represent a wide spectrum of expertise and experience in music, sound, and the performing arts, resulting in a unique lineup of artists that explore, interpret, and combine genres. Selected by Klaus Biesenbach, Director, MoMA PS1, and Chief Curator at Large, The Museum of Modern Art; and organized by Margaret Knowles, Curatorial Assistant and Warm Up Producer, MoMA PS1, the Warm Up 2015 curatorial committee includes Dean Bein, Head of True Panther Sounds; Jonathan Galkin, Co-Founder of DFA Records; Eliza Ryan; Brandon Stosuy, Senior Editor for Pitchfork; Imogene Strauss, of Cool Managers; Matt Werth, Label Head of RVNG Intl.

Warm Up will feature rotating stage installations by local New York design talent.

For more infomation, visit http://momaps1.org/warmup/
results.how_to_find_us: I will send an email with contact information
results.name: MoMA PS1: Warm Up 2015

results.description:
Premise: the emergence of the "digital-sharing" economy has drastically changed the consumer landscape, as well as redefining the sense of a "community."  It has cultivated an "on-demand" culture aided by the use of the latest technology tools; furthermore, it has given rise to the "gig economy" and has fundamentally transformed the "connectors" in the chain of the economy.


For this meetup, we'll discuss the two prominent players in this new economic model -- Airbnb and Uber. 


I.  Airbnb

In October 2014, the New York Attorney General released a report and unveiled an initiative to crack down on Airbnb.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pvR9YN8Mpgc

II.  Uber

After a heated showdown last month, the Mayor backed away from his proposed plans for an "expansion cap," while leaving some room to revisit the matter later.  Meanwhile, this public dust up has created a rift between the Mayor and the Council Speaker.

--------------------------------------------------------------------


Our discussions will include the following:

• Overall, do you hold a favorable view for either or both companies?

• Have you had any direct experiences with either services? If so, were they positive or negative?

• Is it a net positive for your neighborhood or the local community?

• Is it a net positive for the City as a whole?

•  What are the negative attributes or potential unintended consequences, if any?

• The "gig-economy" — what concerns, if any, does it raise about the future of the job market?

• Will this new economic paradigm lead to the next (or the Third) Industrial Revolution?

--------------------------------------------------------------------
results.name: Airbnb, Uber & the "shari­ng" economy — the economic trends & the future of NYC

results.description:
I keep an eye on the weather and the field.  In the case of inclement weather - I try to make a determination as early as possible - preferably 24+ hours in advance, or by noon the day of if it's still questionable.  If we are not meeting, I will actually cancel the event page and send out an email.  If you are not signed up to receive emails, check the site, or text me[masked]


Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc.   If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF.  If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...).  If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.



What is Ultimate Frisbee?  In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee.  You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Montclair)
Interm/Adv only, C rating and up, 3-5pm

results.description:
We're very excited to announce our first meetup at the OSA Community Center! This is our furthest Uptown meetup yet. OSA is short for Our Saviour's Attonement (Lutheran Church), however, do not let that dissuade you if you follow a certain religion -our use of the community center is of no religious affiliation! This is a Saturday afternoon of tabletop gaming, welcome to all. RSVP as soon as you can commit, because space is limited to 30 people!

If you haven't attended our other meetups, you can expect to play tabletop games of all sorts; examples include Carcassonne, The Resistance, Castles of Burgundy, Settlers of Catan, Lords of Waterdeep, Agricola, Through the Ages, etc. Feel free to bring any games that you'd like to play with other Uptown Gamers.


Our group is renting this space, so, unlike our other meetups to date, I will have to collect an 8 dollar contribution upon attendance. This will be a good venue for our group because we will not feel obligated to buy food or drinks as we do when we have events at bars/restaurants. The good news, though, is that we are allowed to bring food and (non-alcoholic) beverages into the space, as long as we clean up after ourselves.


Our space will be through the southern entrance, and up the stairs in the balcony room. The space is well lit, and has nice folding tables and chairs which will be very conducive to table top gaming. As I mentioned before, the space is limited to 30 people, so I'd ask that you do not RSVP unless you are reasonably certain that you can attend -this is also important because of the contributions that we'll need to collect in order to keep renting this center.

As I mentioned before, this is our first meetup at this venue, and I am considering this a trial run; if it goes well, I believe that we will be able to do this once a month. So, if you're interested, please make an effort to come out to this meetup so we can continue to foster our Uptown gaming community!

As always, Uptown Gamers Unite!
results.name: Tabletop Games At OSA Community Center

results.description:
Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
This is a "challenging" 6 mile hike in Hartshorne State Park in Highlands, NJ. It should last under 2 hours from start to finish, so the pace will be upbeat, rather than leisurely. Come appropriate, with hiking shoes/ decent sneakers, layered clothing, hat, hydration, and a positive attitude for a great time. You do NOT have to be a "pro" for this, but be ready to keep pace. I leave no one behind, and there is absolutely no criticism on my hikes. We all start and end together. :) 

We'll be meeting at the Rocky Point trailhead, located at 200 Portland Ave, Highlands, for an 4p step off. I'll be arriving to the parking lot in a black Ford Escape with army stickers on the back window approx. 15 mins ahead to do a little bit of stretching (recommended) before this 6-mile "challenging" hike (see map, but try not to be jealous of my photoshopping skillzzz). 

We have a really nice time getting our heart pumping and always great conversations throughout. Please, however, leave your four-legged friends home for this one. In the event of unfavorable weather, look for an update the morning of. A little snow is ok, but nobody enjoys monsoons. Looking forward to seeing you all there! Please post any questions in the thread. NOTE: If you arrive at 4:01, you should be able to catch up to us. ;)

DISCLAIMER: If you join us for this event, please understand that you are responsible for your own (and your guest's) preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. Your attendance to this event signifies that you have read and accepted the terms of this liability waiver.
results.how_to_find_us: 200 Portland is actually a development. Don't turn into it. Keep going 1/4 mile down the road and you'll see the park entrance in front of you. If lost on day of, call Rob @ 908-420-3421
results.name: Hike - Hartshorne Park

Let's get together to enjoy the beautiful view of Hudson River Park and get some exercise while making many new friends. We're going to walk following a circular path for one hour and then come back to the starting point when we are done.

We have a volunteer photographer who will be taking high quality DSLR photos for people in our group, all photographers are welcome to join us to take photos for you at this beautiful park.

results.description:
THE FORECAST FOR SUNDAY IS A 60% CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS SO MY BETTER JUDGEMENT TOLD ME TO SWITCH THE HIKE TO TOMORROW SATURDAY AUG 22ND , THE BETTER DAY OF THE WEEKEND.  IF YOU CANNOT MAKE IT PLEASE CHANGE YOUR RSVP.  DINNER WILL BE AT ANOTHER LOCAL VENUE TO BE ANNOUNCED. 

Its’ that time again to do the 
 Piermont to S.Nyack rail trail! This event was inspired by our good friend Al Edly who unfortunately is no longer able to join us so this ones' for you Al!

  Let's celebrate the summer together with new and old friends, as we walk from Piermont to South Nyack along the Shady Esposito Rail Trail with stunning Hudson River views and peaks at the new Tappan Zee Bridge construction!  

After one short, steep paved hill to the trailhead, the remainder of the walk is on mostly, level, gravel and woods trails, so good supportive walking or hiking, boots or shoes should suffice. Bring water, snacks, sun protection, bugspray and cameras of course!

This will be about a 2 1/2 
 hour(approx. 6 miles), moderate paced walk, including breaks. Early, out available. 

 Afterwards, there is optional  dining at  Confettis about 7:00  in Piermont in walking distance for the first 20 to rsvp yes for dinner. Individual checks available! Check out their menu at: http://www.confettiofpiermont.com/menu/

Inclement weather cancels.  ALWAYS CHECK THE DAY OF AN EVENT FOR POSSIBLE CHANGES.


  PLEASE ANSWER THE ADDITIONAL DINNER RSVP ALONG WITH YOUR RSVP FOR THE WALK.   IF YOU DO NOT KNOW HOW TO RSVP FOR DINNER PLEASE POST YOUR RESPONSE so we can have an accurate count for our dinner reservation. THANKS. 

Directions : From Route 9W follow signs to Piermont Business District. Follow winding road (Ash Street- which  makes a very sharp right turn), across Piermont Avenue at bottom of hill and the library will be on your left, after the bank and diagonally across the street from Confettis restaurant. 


When finding a new place it is always advisable to leave yourself some extra time.  Park in the town lots, behind Confettis, or in the lot on the side of the library. Let's enjoy our towns on the Hudson!

results.description:
Brooklyn Heights was the first-ever NYC neighborhood designated a Historic District, and a large part of that history is rooted in 19th-century abolitionism and events leading up to the Civil War. Yet there's even more than that. Hear about Brooklyn Heights' role in the Underground Railroad and about the larger-than-life minister Henry Ward Beecher, as well as why Abraham Lincoln turned down an exclusive luncheon invitation from one of the richest Republicans; who the tot once held by Marquis de Lafayette grew up to be; what happened to two lovers on the Titanic; where Washington Roebling spied out on the building of his Brooklyn Bridge; and how feminist and one-time Presidential candidate Victoria Woodhull exposed a red-hot sex scandal, all in the confines of this seemingly demure sets of streets.

Where to meet: Meet in front of the Hotel Saint George, on the corner of Clark Street and Henry Street.

When to meet: 4:45pm for a 5pm start. I will be holding a sign that reads, "Brooklyn Heights NORTH".

Train: Take the 2,3 to "Clark Street" and you're right inside the Hotel Saint George's subway station. Come outside and find us on the corner.

Fee: $20, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age. Cash only, exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins.  Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours.

The tour will be approximately 2.5 hours long. For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella.  While Friendly Native tours walk usually do take place on the date and at the time they are scheduled, on occasion they will be postponed in cases of high temperatures or high probability of rain,  and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event.

The nearest restrooms to this location are inside the restaurant across the street from our meeting place. Make a small purchase (like a danish) and use the facilities as a customer. Please be sure to "take care of things" before the start of the tour!

results.name: Brooklyn Heights NORTH: Starring Henry Ward Beecher and a Great Supporting Cast!

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

8/22: Ping will be hosting!

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.name: A Conversation About Happiness, Citicorp at 53rd and Lex.

We are so excited to announce that we will continue to hold beginner series in ASTORIA!!!

Please join us for the basics of swing dancing and lindy hop! No partner or experience necessary, just bring your comfortable shoes and happy feet!! We will meet every Saturday from 5pm to 6pm in August (8/8, 15, 22 and 29) so that you will be comfortable with the basic steps of swing dancing.  We will rotate partners frequently during the lesson so you will instantly make lots of new friends!!  You will have a chance to mingle and dance with each other and try out all the new moves to authentic jazz music from 30s and 40s!!

Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes to learn various steps of swing dancing so that you will be comfortable on the social dance floor.  Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it!!  $52 for 4 classes or $15 for single class.

Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot!  Please register in advance at QED website and get the discount!!

http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa

This month, we will be focusing on side by side Charleston!  Classes are taught by Michael Duke and Akemi Kinukawa, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.swingdanceastoria.com)

Looking forward to dancing with you!

Here is a video from the last workshop at QED:

https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=537214196418671&set=vb.395724470567645&type=2&theater

If you are interested in finding out what types of materials we cover in the beginner class, please go to Facebook group Swing Dance Astoria and check out the recap video!!  (and like us : )

results.description:
Dear Foodies,

Because you ask for it,  Second trip to New York this Summer!! 

 

New York is my city!! I’m completely and utterly in love with NYC!!

 

The idea of this trip is to experience NYC LIKE A LOCAL, we’ll skip the tourist traps and we are going to be NEW YORKERS for 7 days!! I know the city pretty well!! You won`t be disappointed!! I promise!!

Date: From August 22 to August 29th Summer in New York! 

We are going to be 13 people.

Housing: I found an amazing Townhouse in the Upper East Side. The whole house only for us ! Location! Location!! Best location ever!!

We’ll share rooms and bathrooms. We`ll be New Yorkers and that’s the way New Yorkers do!! Sharing space!! Lets play Friends, Sex and the City or How I meet your mother, maybe?? ;) The Townhouse is very close to Central Park and the 59st Subway station (4,5,6, R,Q,N line ). 

I’m going to be in charge of the Housing and some activities I will plan for the group, like reservations in some amazing Restaurants, best places for Brunch, Rooftop bars, Discos,etc.

 

Did you hear about the Hamptons? Well for New Yorkers, the country often means the Hamptons – a roughly 200-square-mile collection of former fishing and whaling villages that dot the South Fork of Long Island’s lush farmlands and white sand beaches, about 90 miles east of Manhattan. I will take you there;)) It's a must!!

I will organize a Networking event with professional people from New York. You guys will have the chance to mingle and jingle with the Locals;) It’s going to be great!!!

 

You’ll become addicted to the "energy" and "buzz" of NYC.

 

Open your mind and senses to experiencing the greatest city on earth!! Can’t Wait!!!

Vanessa

PD: If you have the desire to travel to New York with me but  the group is full. Please join the waiting list. I will contact you shortly , you can be part of our next trip!!
results.name: TRIP  TO NEW YORK !! SUMMER!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zmr1iSG3RTA


Part of the See it Big! series at the Museum, this classic won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture and Best Score.  It made a star of Peter O'Toole and features the legendary Anthony Quinn and a young and very handsome Omar Sharif:  

Maurice Jarre went on to score three more of Lean's films:  Doctor Zhivago, Ryan's Daughter, and A Passage to India, for which he won another Oscar.


This film is presented in 70mm Panavision with a strong, mostly-British cast that includes Anthony Quayle and Alec Guinness.  The soundtrack music is conducted by Sir Adrian Boult.  Runtime is 217 minutes, including the intermission.

Admission is free with purchase of museum entrance ticket: $12 ($9 for senior citizens and students / free for members at the Film Lover level and above). Order tickets online. (Members may contact [masked] with any questions regarding online reservations.) 

All tickets include same-day admission to the Museum (see gallery hours). View the Museum’s ticketing policy here. For more information on membership and to join online, visit our membership page. 

This is not a film to watch on your computer screen!

If you are interested in a mid-afternoon meal before the film, it is now posted as a separate event.  

After the film there are several restaurants nearby where we might have a drink and some apps if there is interest.

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates to this event.

If you are a member of both groups, please RSVP only once.

Originally posted on 7/18/15
Updated on 7/21/15

results.description:
The Place: Currently rated the 40th best restaurant in the world and one of six NYC restaurants with 3 Michelin stars.


Opened in 2004, Per Se is Thomas Keller’s acclaimed New York interpretation of The French Laundry in the Time Warner Center at Columbus Circle. Designed by Adam D. Tihany, Per Se features a serene and intimate environment with spectacular views of Central Park and Columbus Circle.

The restaurant is Chef Keller’s second three-Michelin-starred property featuring his daily nine-course tasting menu and a nine-course vegetable tasting menu using classic French technique and the finest quality ingredients available. An award-winning wine list, boasting more than 2,000 bottles, complements the menu. The list highlights a collection of older wines as well as wines from small producers that are released in limited quantities. Per Se is a member of French-based associated Relais & Chateaux, Relais Gourmands and Traditions & Qualité organizations, recognized for their dedication to maintaining the highest international standards for hospitality and culinary excellence.

Menu: The menu changes daily but there are a few core dishes that remain the same. Please note we will be doing the normal, not the vegetarian menu.

Prepay: The cost of the meal is $310 plus tax- my understanding is that service is included. However, the no show fee is only $175 so that is all I am asking for up front to lock in your spot. Venmo is preferred, but Paypal and Chase Quickpay also work (all are free and 100% goes towards the cost of your meal). I will not offer refunds for prepay, although you are welcome to find someone else to go in your place.


Dress Code: Please note jackets are required for men and whatever the equivalent is for women.

results.description:
HETEP is an Egyptian word for being calm and content within the self.
Healing Touch Program gathers a community of people who want to communicate love, respect, and compassion through the language of healing touch. They care to keep improving their ‘touch intelligence’ so as to be aware of another’s needs and boundaries. 

A HETEP GATHERING starts with an invocation to the Elements and the various aspects of the Mother Goddess. The space created is sacred and safe for all of us to share our experiences - our thoughts and feelings, our presence, and the rhythms of our breathing as we participate in the expansion of our touch perception.

This event is expanding now to include everyone interested in evolving their 'touch intelligence'. It has been a monthly women's gathering and a wonderful opportunity to share and celebrate our intention, strength, and life experience!

You're invited to join this ongoing class at any time. It is 'by donation', because your healing presence is the most important material you can contribute! So please come and donate your body to the science of healing - we will return it renewed and energized. 

Every gathering starts with an introduction of ourselves in a circle. You will be introduced to this simple healing touch method. We will practice on each other on the floor lined with yoga mats and blankets. You may want to wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat. This program is designed for every body shape and sensory ability - or sensitivity! 

HETEP facilitator, Karuna Ma has been introduced to healing touch very early in life. Since 1998, qualified as a Reiki Master Healer and Seichim Master Teacher. Seichim energy is sometimes called 'Egyptian Kundalini' as it is great at assisting a breakthrough experience for both physical and psychic well-being. Since her training in 2001, Karuna has been working as a massage therapist, energy and sound healer.
results.name: HETEP Healing Touch Program

results.description:
Thought provoking and stunningly cinematic, GURUKULAM will be greatly appreciated by anyone interested in Indian arts, culture, and philosophy. 

Aug. 22nd, 6pm: Open with the lovely sounds of the South Indian Carnatic violin by Anjna Swaminathan, followed by Q & A with filmmakers and special reception.


Aug. 23rd, 3pm: Film followed by Q & A with filmmakers


Aug. 24th, 7pm: Film followed by Q & A with filmmakers


In vivid and sensuous detail, Gurukulam follows a group of students and their teacher as they confront fundamental questions about the nature of reality and self-identity at a remote forest ashram in southern India.


Daily chores, meditation, ritual, and rigorous study are woven together connecting the natural and spiritual worlds in moments of surprising revelations. Deeply observational and experiential, Gurukulam evokes the presence of the place and a tactile sense of the sacred. The richly layered soundscape and the intimate imagery bring us into a place of extraordinary beauty and simplicity.


From Swami Dayananda’s first lesson: ‘Saying is only an expression of what you see,’ Gurukulam is a rare invitation to look, listen, and experience a contemplative rhythm of life as old as the Bhagavad Gita and as new as present-day India.


GURUKULAM premiered at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival, played to a sold out audience of 550 in Canada, and screened in Mumbai. It is produced and co-directed by award winning filmmaker and Yoga teacher, Jillian Elizabeth (ON COAL RIVER, WHATEVER IT TAKES) and co-directed by Neil Dalal, professor of Indian philosophy and Religion, and traditional teacher of Advaita Vedanta.

Tickets can be purchased here > >

http://rubinmuseum.org/events/series/gurukulam


https://vimeo.com/113890428
results.name: NYC Premiere of Gurukulam

results.description:
http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/1/5/d/f/event_185599.jpegThe Thelemic pantheon includes a number of deities. The three main deities are adapted from ancient Egyptian religion, who are the three speakers of The Book of the Law: Nuit, Hadit and Ra-Hoor-Khuit. Other deities include Hoor-Par-Kraat, Heru-Ra-Ha, and Babalon.

We will discuss the nature of these divine entities, and how they are inspired by, but differ from, ancient Egyptian and Babylonian deities.

We will also put this into the context of the Thelemic concept of the three Aeons: The Aeon of Isis, the Aeon of Osiris, and today's Aeon of Horus the child.

This talk will include a slide show of beautiful examples of ancient art: depictions of the Gods.

This is chapter 000 in our textbook, "Pearls of Wisdom" by James Eshelman. We encourage you to get this book, but it's not necessary. We will have copies available to buy at the event, $30.

results.description:
PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU RSVP. WE WILL BOTH BE BETTER OFF THAT WAY.

MEETING DETAILS SENT OUT 8:55  P.M FRIDAY BY E-MAIL TO ALL THOSE WHO RSVP'D. IF YOU DO NOT RECEIVE THIS E-MAIL, CONTACT ME IMMEDIATELY, DON'T POST A COMMENT, AND SEND ME YOUR PRIVATE E-MAIL ADDRESS AND I WILL RESEND.

I SUBSCRIBE TO THE EXTREMELY RADICAL VIEW, EXPRESSED IN MY DESCRIPTION OF THIS EVENT,  THAT IF SOMEONE RSVP'S FOR AN EVENT, THEY SHOULD SHOW UP.

I did not plan on doing a hike this weekend but I got inspired by the sunset hike on Roosevelt Island this past Saturday evening.

This is one of the best events that I lead-so I say.

We did this back in June but the bad weather forecast scared away a lot of people…but it did not rain.

Join AMC club members who do not have to RSVP on a three mile fun but fast paced tour that I like to do a couple of times a year.
Unlock the secrets of the unique spaces and memorials of the Lower Manhattan waterfront. There are a lot of unique parks and truly haunting memorials in this area as well as some sites of historical interest.. I have led a variation of this hike numerous times for Open House New York and many times for AMC and it’s always a lot of fun. When we move, we will go at a fast pace but I will stop very briefly a number of times to talk about what we see. There will be many surprises along the way even if you have done this with me before. You are guaranteed to see things you never saw before. We are going to end at the Fulton Transit Center right after we visit the Transportation Hub across the street which are both pretty amazing just by themselves (they are going to be connected some day). WE WILL ALSO VISIT THE NEW CAROUSEL IN BATTERY PARK. WE WILL BEGIN BEFORE 6:45 P.M. BE READY TO GO.

NO FOOD STOPS. EAT BEFORE WE MEET.

Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup. Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC club members, there is NO need for AMC club members to RSVP for this-unless you don’t get last minute e-mails. Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any previous AMC Meetup events that I have led or are a chronic abuser of the RSVP process –see your Attendance History- please do not sign up for this event because I am just going to delete your RSVP. Let someone else go who will actually show up. 

PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO THOSE WHO HAVE PREVIOUSLY ATTENDED OTHER AMC MEETUP EVENTS.

I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You have more than enough information to do this once you get the meeting details. No offense, but I don’t need to know-and probably neither does anyone else- what you are doing that day if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather forecast is really bad, See Accuweather like I do, I will post a notice on the day of the hike by 1:00 P.M. If there is no notice, we go. We will finish around 10:00 p.m.
results.name: Sunset Hike On the Waterfront-and More!

results.description:
Take A Risk SEX is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality. 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.

150 West 28th street, suite 1803, New York

Admission: $20

Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with
The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra
Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska and Cynthia Kagoshima

Bio:
Dr. Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

results.description:
WONDERSHOW returns to New York for a 3-night spectacle of mystery and mischief featuring a line up of today’s top magicians and variety artists. Praised by Time Out as “Professional Mindfuckery by the most skilled performers in the business, ” this new installment will showcase uproarious comedy from MASTER LEE (Late Night with Conan O’Brien) as well as jaw dropping magic from TJ TANA (Masters of Illusion), plus exquisite sleight of hand from BEN NEMZER (Hollywood’s Magic Castle) and Much More!

Presented exclusively at THE MUSE - Bushwick’s newly renovated circus arts warehouse - WONDERSHOW is an experience like no other and will highlight the best in underground talent as well as established professionals, like the evening’s headliner, JON STETSON: America’s Master Mentalist. As one of today’s most popular magicians, Jon has appeared on major networks and in major venues around the globe, not to mention private shows for The King of Sweden, The New England Patriots, and multiple Fortune 100 companies. His extensive television credits and thousands of live shows combined with a razor sharp style - and sense of humor - guarantee that you will never forget ‘The Stetson Experience.’

And as if that wasn't enough, WONDERSHOW will also include a special performance from 25-time world record holder, THE GREAT THROWDINI, who has appeared on Good Morning America, ESPN, and The History Channel. A Grand Champion in the Impalement Arts, Throwdini will demonstrate the skills that made him one of the most elegant and terrifying entertainers in the world.

Like nothing you expect and everything you imagine, this concert of modern will also feature glam soul songstress AUDRA ISADORA as WONDERSHOW's Master of Ceremonies. Described by Vogue as "Your Future Musical Obesession," she will provide a live soundtrack to the night's spirit for all things astounding and confounding.

ADVANCE PURCHASE ($22) REQUIRED:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wondershow-tickets-17486915836

Please purchase your ticket online before you RSVP "yes" for this event.

PLEASE ARRIVE PROMPTLY AT 7:00PM TO GET SEATS TOGETHER AND SOCIALIZE BEFORE THE MUSIC STARTS.
results.name: WONDERSHOW

results.description:
Brasserie
100 East 53rd (Lexington and Park)
Saturday, August 22nd
7:00 pm optional drinks, 8:00 pm dinner
$87 3-course meal, glass wine, coffee, tax & tip

There will be at least 20-30 from my dinner group joining us. Please go to www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/brasserie/

The Patina Group with over 60 restaurants worldwide, continues to shine at this French classic located in the recently sold Seagram building. Since 1959 this icon has been serving French cuisine with a modern twist in an ultra-sleek setting. A destination for New York nightlife and dining, it upholds the beloved culinary traditions of Paris. Zagat rated 21, “A “tried-and-true” “crowd-pleaser,” this sunken brasserie remains a “go-to” for “delicious” French bites and “unpretentious” service in a “stylish,” futuristic space while steadfast supporters keep it “happening”. ZAGAT, says this is as an “essential NYC” experience. Join us for what could be our last visit ever here.
results.name: Brasserie

results.description:
Hope everyone is having a great summer!

Our next, and best, event will be held at the awesome bar Hops Hill, located in Clinton Hill. It consistently has one of the best tap lists in the city, and they are putting up a really great one for us. They also have a pretty gigantic bottle list.

Because our group is just THAT cool, they'll be tapping THREE rare, special, and totally awesome kegs just for us:

Prairie Artisan Ales BOMB!, a 14% imperial stout aged with coffee, cacao nibs, vanilla beans, and ancho chili peppers.

Crooked Stave HopSavant, a sour/funky pale ale

The Bruery Sour in the Rye, a wild ale aged in oak barrels.


The bar is in Clinton Hill, at 866 Fulton Street, right outside the A/C Clinton/Washington stop. Also walkable from the Clinton/Washington G, and Bergen 2/3.


Please let me know if you have any questions, and I hope to see everyone there!

Eric

results.name: Let's Drink Awesome Beer at Hops Hill!

results.description:
If you've been excited to try D&D legend Monte Cook's Numenera but haven't found a group to play with, Game Master Liam Delaney will be running a fresh new Numenera campaign for those new or veteran to adventures in the Ninth World!

Numenera is an RPG set in the far future where the technologies of old have become indistinguishable from magic (http://www.numenera.com/). Build characters using a simple "fill-in-the-blank" sentence: "I am a _____ _____ who ______", and venture out into the new world for adventure or to uncover the secrets of the ancients. Fans of Planescape, Spelljammer, and any of the more outlandish D&D settings will love delving into Numenera!

Game will be hosted by but not affiliated with the Brooklyn Strategist; players will expected to pay a $10 cover for use of the playspace. Direct all questions to this meetup group. Thank you!
results.name: Learn & Play Numenera

group.name: The NYC Dungeons & Dragons Meetup Group

results.description:
Beach Volleyball at Pier 25 in Manhattan. We'll be on court #1. 

We will be playing 4 on 4 with 1 person on each side rotating on to the court for a straight 2 hours of volleyball. (THERE WILL NOT BE A THIRD TEAM THAT SITS OUT)


The $15/person is to cover the cost of the court/occasional ball replacements. 

If you reserve and cant make it there will be NO REFUND!!! 

We are playing with beach volleyball rules: 

1) No volleying when receiving the serve


2) No volleying over the net

Please keep in mind that if your skill level is not adequate you will not be asked back.

results.description:
Let's head up to Port Chester for some amazing Peruvian seafood (there's more than seafood on the menu) and ceviche on Saturday August 22nd starting at 7pm. 

Port Chester has become known for its many restaurants. Among the profusion of Latino restaurants, most do not offer the kind of atmosphere diners from out of town might expect. Of all these restaurants, Acuario is the one that best retains the exotic feeling of authenticity, while providing an attractive ambience, without prices that take it out of the "affordable" category. The ceviche here is the best in town. 


Here are some comments by others, "Yesterday was our second time at Acuario and it confirmed that the first time was not an anomaly- the food and overall experience is of a consistently high quality. My wife loves the ceviche mariscos, and my Milanesa de Pollo was moist and tasty. I would highly recommend getting a side of tostones, they were excellent. My daughter always gets the tallarines verde con bistek, basically fettuccine with pesto and steak, another great dish. On our first visit I had the Pollo Encebollado and it was a very nice combination of flavors. It's a fairly busy restaurant so be prepared for some noise during peak hours, but this adds to the overall atmosphere of festivity. They have a full bar and the Peruvian beer Cusquena (which I've never seen at my local store) was very good. Highly recommended, a great family restaurant with something for everyone. While there are cheaper Peruvian options out there I haven't found one with better tasting dishes, and that's worth paying a little more for."

Another writes, "Can I give it 10 stars?? Cause if I could I would!!!!  Seared Scallops......Cooked to utter perfection. Steak that you can cut with a butter knife. Fried Yuca which I already love, so it doesn't take much to woo me with that one. Papa Huancaina...........I can't even explain this one, but if you have never had it you're missing out on one of the wonders of the world. Lol  And the little spicy dipping sauce that they give you with the bread.  OMG  Lastly, the salad dressing. It's homemade and made me feel like I died and went to heaven. Go, go, go.  If you're still reading this you have already wasted enough time. Enjoy it.  I promise you will savor every bite!!!!!"

And one more says, "I just went this restaurant tonight for the first time ever. There were two of us. We had the Mixto Ceviche with medium spice. It was delicious! Amazing. Freshest seafood. The large was more than enough for two and extremely filling for the two of us.  We barely had enough room for our entrees of Cau Cau and the pesto bistec. They were good, but we did not have enough room because of the ceviche. Took it to go.Service was great. We have Laura, who was attentive and pleasant.  Ambiance was okay. A little too dark for me, but my boyfriend said it was fine.  Above all, ceviche was worth everything. I will definitely be back."

Check out their website for more info, menu, etc: http://www.acuariorestaurant.com/

So.. I will make a reservation for 8 - as this place gets packed... and is not very large... your $3.00 will secure your spot... 

See you there!

results.name: Let's go to Acuario for great Peruvian Seafood in Port Chester!

results.description:
Join us for a special essential oils event with essential oils expert Joe Monkman who is visiting us from California. Joe will generously share his expertise with us.  You will want to take advantage of Joe's visit and receive cutting edge tips on how to integrate essential oils into your life.  Joe is a charismatic speaker;  you will be interested and engaged in this fun workshop. We will have plenty of time to get your questions answered.  Take away with a better understanding of essential oils, some essential oils samples, and the opportunity to win some gifts.

Are you looking for natural ways to enhance the well being of your body, mind, and spirit? Essential oils are Nature's pure, potent and powerful gifts that could:

- help to create a calmer inner and outer environment

- contribute to a restful night's sleep

- cleanse and soothe the skin, and improve appearance

- support the respiratory system

- help to ease the effects of occasional upset stomach

- take the edge off muscle soreness after exercise

Join us and learn (for FREE!) how to safely use essential oils, and about the ways in which they could lift your spirits, clear your mind, and give your body the boost it's been waiting for.

Enter our PRIZE DRAWING and you'll qualify to win an essential oil, a Wellness Consultation, and an NLP session. (These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent disease.)
When and Where: Mon., Aug. 24th, 6:30-8pm, Green Spa Wellness Center,[masked]rd Ave., Bay Ridge, Brooklyn call or text Joe upon arrival at[masked]
This is a complimentary experience. (You may, however, want to buy coffee, tea, or a snack so please bring some cash.)

RSVP: Debra at[masked] or [masked]
*** Enter our PRIZE DRAWING and you'll qualify to win an essential oil, a Wellness Consultation, and an NLP session. ***

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
